story:
Hello! My name is Ben and I am a guitarist, musician, and songwriter. I started playing in a band called Worth Road 3 years ago, and have toured and recorded with various artists off and on over the last 5 years, but after a few recent events, I feel it impressed upon myself to record and release a solo album, and put some energy into a new and fresh musical expedition with a new and fresh musical direction. I put everything that I have into my music and after independently recording a self-funded full-length instrumental CD in 2012, which was only released to a handful of people, I am ready to record my next full-length album entitled "Genosis"!

This album is important to me because it is the biggest step I have ever taken in my musical career, being the first album that I have ever sang lead on, as well as the first ever recording that I have played drums on. I have one song almost fully recorded for you so far to give you a taste of what is to come with this album, but I need your help to finish this song and to complete the remaining 14 songs for this album.

$101,000. I know that is an exceptionally large number, but making music is expensive, and especially making it right. Which is how I want to record this album. I always want to make sure that I am giving 101% (hehe) to my music. There are many high costs involved (production, equipment, session musicians, mixing, mastering, artwork, pressing, publicity...just to name few!). If I am blessed enough to raise more than my goal, then I will definitely record more songs for you.

I have a list of incentives to accommodate all fans and samaritans, no matter your financial ability to help make this happen. Also, purchasing the CD up front is like a pre-order for you, while also making it possible for me to record the CD – so everybody wins!

Thank you so much for visiting my page, I appreciate you more than I will ever be able to express! And if you feel led, please share this link with your social networks. I can’t do this without you, and I will forever remember the contributors who made this possible for me. God bless you. 

-Ben

story:
You, Me, and Tennessee: The Story
Caleb and Anna Edwards were married in May of 2014 and moved to Nashville shortly after to pursue a career in music. They both come from a strong background of faith, family, and determination and it shows in their music.
"You, Me and Tennessee comes from a collection of songs that were written from the inspiration of moving to a new city, with a new career, and a new family." Says Caleb. "We wanted a project that would define us as a musical and marital duo."
The couple comes from a Americana and folk way of playing music from playing in family bands, bluegrass bands, and gospel bands most of their lives.
"It was time to collaborate our loves of music, words, and life and this is the outcome."
Where YOU come in:
In this day and age, albums are hard to make for musicians that aren't on record labels but have just as much to say. We are living in the most community driven music industry the world has ever seen and the outcomes have been beautiful music by independent artists that are getting the recognition they deserve.

$3000 is a mild and humble price to pay for an album and we knew that we were going to hire the best to help us release this music so we asked for the very minimum of what we absolutely needed to record the music professionally for the folks who have been asking about it for years.

And for those folks, we have some fantastic perks that we hope all of you take advantage of for the sake of music and creativity!
Why is this worth your donation?
Caleb and Anna have been deemed as a rare feat of genuine people loyal to their friends and family and this record will be just another tally to that score. As musicians, they are firm believers in community and what better way to be a community than to help one another in their creativity and art? This record has the potential to open the door to a career and life we could never imagine. We believe that the sky is the limit, and with YOU and your help, there are no limits.
Obstacles:
As a young and newly-wedded couple, many obstacles lie in the not-so-distant-future.
We have spent our time, thoughts, skills, and money on writing, composing, singing, and recording this record and to see it fall through because of a short of funds would be such a shame. Unfortunately, dreams have a price.
How You Can Help:
Donations are obviously the way to a working musician's heart but, more often than not, we can't donate what we'd like.
And that is okay!
Spread the word about our music and our campaign to spread it all over the world! Share our story! IndieGoGo has some fantastic ways of using social media to help artists reach their goals and we encourage you to use them. Thank you all!

story:
Lucky Number 7!

Pauline Reese is so excited to be able to launch this very special INDIEGOGO campaign centered around her 7th album called "Lucky Number 7" (produced by Dwight Baker, a platinum producer / engineer / mixer /songwriter who has worked with many artists such as Kelly Clarkson, Brandi Carlile, Bob Schneider, Blue October, Alpha Rev, and David Archuleta). Pauline will create her first official music video plus a very special "Lucky Number 7" live concert taping and VIP red carpet launch party in Austin, Texas. Beyond just the CD’s, live concert and VIP red carpet launch party, you’ll find some amazing exclusive perks here – from limited edition posters signed by Billy Perkins and Pauline Reese and "Lucky Number 7" t-shirts to creative writing sessions with Pauline Reese and special house concerts with special guests.

Pauline Reese will be recording "Lucky Number 7" at Matchbox Studios starting January 2, 2016.

"Lucky Number 7" live concert taping and VIP red carpet launch party at One World Theater in Austin, Texas. Show TBA.

"Lucky Number 7" album will be promoted on the radio and officially released in March 2016.

Biography

"Pauline Reese is my favorite female artist."~ Willie Nelson

Pauline Reese was twice named "Entertainer of The Year" by the Texas Music Association and has successfully carved her name in the male-dominated music business, touring with such notable Texas acts as Cory Morrow, Jack Ingram, Kevin Fowler and Pat Green. With a magnetic stage presence, quick wit and a smoking band, she performs regularly around Texas & Oklahoma.

If Pauline Reese had been born in the 1800s, she would have used a plow and a Henry rifle to carve her place the Wild West. Instead, she’s slinging a guitar and sharp-edged lyrics to blaze a trail in a man’s world of outlaw country music and staking milestones along the way, including praise from Willie Nelson as his favorite female vocalist and from the Texas Music Awards as the reigning entertainer of the year – the first woman to earn that honor. 

Pauline’s albums won critical acclaim since her self-titled debut in 1999. Willie joined her for a duet on “Pick Up the Pieces” on her 2004 CD “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly.” The Texas Music Awards bestowed album of the year honors on her 2007 CD “Too Texas,” a collection of her classics and others’. Her sixth CD, “Just Getting Started,” reveals Pauline’s growth as an artist in a powerful collection of folk, pop rock and alternative and contemporary country that reflects a life being lived to its fullest – from a leaving a rocky marriage and finding new love and a new role as a wife and mother with two young daughters to all the highs and lows in between.

For Pauline, there are plenty of trails yet to blaze. As the chorus in her latest CD’s title track says, “I’ve just hit my stride this ride ain’t over yet/ My heart is racing to see what’s waiting up ahead/ I’m about to make my mark/ Yeah, I’m just getting started.” "I am full of surprises," sings Pauline Reese on opener "Just Getting Started," and the Austinite's not kidding.

Reese challenges Carrie Underwood for Nashville good looks, but she's a crack Texas songwriter ("First Love") in the tradition of Dolly Parton ("Beautiful Shame," "Front Porch Sunday") and spends half the year on the road honing that craft. Reese isn't afraid to demand your attention; listen up.
~Margaret Moser, The Austin Chronicle

Its buoyant Red Dirt landscape splits hooks (“Just Getting Started”) and hope (the Django Walker co-write “Bring Me Down”) throughout shadows cracking with light (“Front Porch Sunday”). Each feels endlessly lived in. Pay particular attention to “Front Porch Sunday.” The title track might eventually connect radio waves for miles and miles, but Reese’s most compelling moment comes straight from the heart.
~Brian Atkinson, Texas Music Magazine


Fans Can Help & What You Get In Return

Pauline is offering many special perks for her fans to contribute in different ways:

  • Autographed goodies + passes.
  • Special house concerts with Pauline and friends + passes.
  • Bundles + passes.
  • Writing session with Pauline + passes.
  • Weekend retreat with Pauline and Band + passes.
  • Executive Producer  + passes.


Impact By The Fans

Your contribution will help launch Pauline's 7th album and ignite her illustrious musical career to go national! By contributing, you help create her "Lucky Number 7" album, brand and campaign. Your contribution helps her promote "Lucky Number 7" on the radio nationally, provide press releases and national marketing initiatives. 100% of the proceeds goes to recording the album, promoting the album nationally on the radio, creating a professional music video, taping a live concert in Austin, Texas at One World Theater. Show TBA.

  • Get the chance to be part of Pauline Reese launch to stardom!
  • The smallest of contributions matter!


Funding Challenges & Total Costs

Currently we are funded by a private investor for $20,000.00, which covers the producer, recording and mixing. This does not include the musicians, mastering of songs, CD replication, graphic design, radio promotion, video production, video editing, video director and merchandising. Once we know how much is raised in two months time, will determine what can be implemented based on Pauline's "Lucky Number 7" brand budget needs. Below are the ancelary costs associated with the "Lucky Number 7" campaign.

Producing, recording and mixed "Lucky Number 7" album = $ 20,000.00
Studio musicians = $ 6,000.00
Mastered songs = $ 10,000.00
Radio promotion = $ 5,000.00
CD design & photography artwork = $ 4,000.00
Limited edition poster and t-shirt artwork = $ 3,000.00
Press releases and marketing campaign = $ 2,000.00
CD replication = $ 5,000.00
Music video = $ 10,000.00
Live concert taping = $ 10,000.00

Total Privately Funded = $20,000.00

Grand Total To Raise = $ 55,000.00

If you are not able to contribute, please contribute in other ways by getting the word out that Pauline Reese is raising money to create her next album and marketing campaign "Lucky Number 7".

story:
Short Summary

Studio 42 is an up and coming media production studio, proudly located in Brooklyn, NY. We are honored to be involved in the local artist community and have begun building a solid reputation for quality results and trustworthy prices. As a full service audio recording, video production, and photography studio, there is almost nothing we cannot do. We invite you to come and find out all that we have to offer both aspiring and seasoned artists. We are an avant-garde styled company featuring services such as:

• Professional Audio Recording—We have the equipment and space to do live recording sessions with bands, multitrack booths for mixing, and vocalist specific microphones for capturing premium sound. We provide engineering and post production services as well.

• Video Production—Utilizing top-of-the-line HDSLR cameras, jibs, cranes, and tracks, we are able to create beautiful in-studio or on-set video recordings. We also perform the associated post production work to ensure that your final piece is unique and effective.

• Photography—Our shooters are in tune with the latest cultural trends and stay heavily involved in our thriving local artist community. We produce: Headshots - Editorials - Live shows - Events. https://www.instagram.com/studio42brooklynphoto/

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

HERE A LITTLE STORY ABOUT THE IDEA 

The design idea for Studio42 floated in my head for about 5 years before i put it on paper with the help of Architect/Designer Pietro Pagliaro.

For an Entire year we sketched, scrapped, burned and tossed A LOT of ideas over pizzas and beers, occasionally pasta... but mainly pizza... more on that later.  

We finally set out on a basic layout and after a lot of pizzas and beers 

though it felt as if ..... as if... we just ate pizzas and beers.... and the design was taking 2 steps forward and 3 steps back. 

We've then decided to switch to pasta with pesto for our meetings and it is then...and only then, that things started to take shape!! call it pesto synchronicity or beer serendipity, I don't know...but something deeply influenced our neurons. 

We've finally come up with a cohesive idea.

The most difficult part was to combine acoustical properties/materials, ergonomics,isolation and the design. Pietro wants things pretty, I want things to sound good and occasionally be pretty where i need them to be, we've balanced each other out quite well. 

The main live room can shape shift from one large live room where you can track BIG DRUMS and shoot videos and pictures, to 3 separate rooms with sight lines for isolation, just in case someone out there does't like mic bleed into their recordings, I do like it but let's leave this discussion for another time.. 

It feels like most of the work, is now behind us. Now we need to BUILD! and here is where you come in! 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT THE STUDIO CAN DO 

Studio 42 will be geared for high end recordings, with or without sound separation between the instruments. 

The lighting and the colors/textures will be geared towards filming and giving a cinematic look to the footage. 

The space can be opened up and accommodate a live intimate concert with an audience. 

Backdrops of different colors can be pulled from the ceiling and be your best friends during a photo shoot or video shoot. 

There are many more combinations.. and i hope we will discover them together during this new year! 


Thank you for the support! 


Alessio Romano


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

MAKE A CONTRIBUTION IF:

- You love music 

- You don't particularly love music but you like an instrument..say.. the Kazoo!! 

- You like discovering new music that takes you places! 

- You appreciate visual Aesthetics 

- You are fascinated by sound 

- You like live music! 

- You don't like garlic 

- You like pizza but pasta is better

- Sometimes you think you are in a movie 

- Sometimes you take the subway in the opposite direction of where you need to go 

- Sometimes you are paralyzed by the abundance of options 

-  You've been on tinder and swiped right by accident ( or left ) 

-  While taking your bike and listening to music your earbuds got ripped off of your      ears and it is, enraging. 

- you need promotional material for your project

- You need a crowd funding campaign video 

- You just want to help someone out 

- You believe in Karma! 

- You like cats but a Koala wins 

- You like Penguins but a Panda wins. 

- You've liked our past work at the studio! 


What We Need & What You Get

WE NEED TO: 

  • Build an awesome Studio! A one of a kind Studio! and it gets expensive, around 100 bucks per square foot!!! This campaign will fund the special feature of the studio the MOVABLE WALLS which cost around 20.000 dollars.
  • YOU GET:
  • Tons of Perks to Choose from that can help your career/business/idea grow. 


Other Ways You Can Help

 If you can't contribute but you like the idea or you think someone might need some of the services provided, share this link, send it to a friend, share on social media or donate any amount you can afford . 

Thank you !!

story:
IT STARTS WITH A SONG...

Hello, 

For those of you who do not know who I am, my name is Morgan Alexander.  I am a singer, songwriter, entertainer, radio personality, and a lucky father of two living in Nashville, Tennessee. I moved here from Oregon in 2009 where I met the woman who stole my heart and gave me those two little ones we love so much.

This IndieGoGo campaign, called "IT STARTS WITH A SONG", was inspired after a trip I made in 2015 to the island of Exuma in the Bahamas for a songwriting festival.  I was invited to perform with members of the Standard Club #Nashville and various hit country stars of the Canadian country music scene.   

THIS YEARS PROMO


I have been invited back for a second year as a performer and to emcee the festival and wrote a song for this little island.  I have realized through many respected members of the music industry that I have a radio hit on my hands.

Here is how YOU help get this song on the radio...

You may not know what it takes to get a song on the radio, but these days it takes more than just a phone call or handshake. Most songs you hear on the radio are purchased by labels and companies who have deep pockets to go along with the talent behind the song.

It's a 24/7 job that I have been studying for the past 10 years, and as a radio personality and performer I understand the pit falls a songwriter or artist faces when trying to get their song on the radio, tv or even film.

Your help will come in the way of finishing (mixing, mastering, distribution and marketing campaign) the song "EXUMA" and the other two songs to be released on the EP.

In short, doing a radio release has been a life long goal and dream added by the possibility to have a hit song and with your generosity and heart, together I believe this will happen in 2016.


What we NEED & what YOU get

Why am I asking for $5000?
I learned a ton after my first album "AMERICAN SOUL" was released in 2012.
The costs involved to make a record and make it sound better than someone doing it in a garage can be overwhelming for a low on the totem poll musician/songwriter.
Recording, mixing, mastering, distribution, and marketing are just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to getting a song on the radio and all of those have some costs.
I have established some amazing relationships over the last few years and the costs will be reduced because of the friends I have here in Nashville and back in my home state of Oregon. But there are still more elements that need to be covered. 
Some of it is travel based (me in a car driving from station to station)
Some of it will be for the marketing needed to spread the word (social media, ect.)
Some of the cost goes back to you (Rewards that you get for pledge levels)
And all of it will go towards the end goal, which is making "EXUMA" and future songs to be on your radio, smartphone, or however you get your music, and we don't want to just stop with one song. But I do believe IT STARTS WITH A SONG and I believe in this one and many others that are just waiting to be recorded.
(Also, don't forget the tax implications)

THE PERKS OF BEING PART OF A HIT SONG!
Of course you are going to get the music; you're getting the entire EP.  But, what are the other perks of assisting with your hard earned money? 
Live web acoustic concerts (for you, your friends and whomever else you can fit in front of a screen)
Video birthday shoutouts (you give me the day of birth and the person, if the person is not you, but of course it can be for you as well)
TAKE YOU ON A TOUR OF NASHVILLE TENNESSEE (via the web if you are not actually in Nashville, TN)
Live house or business concerts (this may require the addition of travel expenses depending on the distance, TBD should funds be reached) 
Check out the other perks in the the perk section.


WHAT IF WE DON'T REACH THE ENTIRE GOAL?!?

Good question, I will continue to work and raise for this as well. I know it's not easy to raise $5 let alone $5000, but I have the process and layout ready to go. 

Funds will still go towards the goal, and the goal is to get "Exuma" on the radio.

This can be met in many ways, but with your help in this campaign it will take less time and an easier effort to make the goal a reality.


Other Ways You Can Help

AS ALWAYS IF YOU CANNOT GIVE FINANCIALLY, PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN WITH YOUR FRIENDS, FAMILY AND ANYBODY YOU THINK MAY BE INTERESTED IN THE MUSIC OR MY PASSION. 
PLEASE VISIT www.MORGANALEXANDERMUSIC.com FOR UPDATES, SHOWS, all SOCIAL MEDIA LINKS, VIDEOS and THE EVENTUAL RELEASE OF " EXUMA " AND THIS EP. 
HUGS,
-MORGAN
story_txt:
IT STARTS WITH A SONG...
Hello, 
For those of you who do not know who I am, my name is Morgan Alexander.  I am a singer, songwriter, entertainer, radio personality, and a lucky father of two living in Nashville, Tennessee. I moved here from Oregon in 2009 where I met the woman who stole my heart and gave me those two little ones we love so much.
This IndieGoGo campaign, called "IT STARTS WITH A SONG", was inspired after a trip I made in 2015 to the island of Exuma in the Bahamas for a songwriting festival.  I was invited to perform with members of the Standard Club #Nashville and various hit country stars of the Canadian country music scene.   
THIS YEARS PROMO



I have been invited back for a second year as a performer and to emcee the festival and wrote a song for this little island.  I have realized through many respected members of the music industry that I have a radio hit on my hands.

Other Ways You Can Help

AS ALWAYS IF YOU CANNOT GIVE FINANCIALLY, PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN WITH YOUR FRIENDS, FAMILY AND ANYBODY YOU THINK MAY BE INTERESTED IN THE MUSIC OR MY PASSION. PLEASE VISIT www.MORGANALEXANDERMUSIC.com FOR UPDATES, SHOWS, all SOCIAL MEDIA LINKS, VIDEOS and THE EVENTUAL RELEASE OF " EXUMA " AND THIS EP. HUGS,-MORGAN

story:
THE PAST: In the winter of 2011/2012 we embarked on recording our first ever worship album in the woods of North Carolina. What a process and learning experience it was to explore our hearts and the song inside us, all the while shrinking and fitting that into 80 minutes on a CD. It was a long road to the finish line of releasing the album but on December 9th, 2013, what we had dreamed of for some time, we shared with the world. We are so proud of the finished product and the testimonies we continue to hear from it.

THE PRESENT: Since recording “In My Bones” a lot of things have changed. We’ve gone through many transformative life changes that have inspired, shaped and marked our songwriting and sound into a greater depth and intimacy with the Father. Since becoming new parents to our amazing son, we’ve come to a place of deepened awareness of our heavenly Father’s perfect love for us, and that started to naturally spill over into our songwriting. 

We've been writing new material ever since the making of our last album and haven’t stopped putting pen to paper to express the multi-faceted reality of who we are to our heavenly Father and the reality of who He is to us. We wanted to ground our songs and songwriting in the simple yet powerful truth of the Father’s love for us. Our son Echo’s name means, “to resound the sound of the Father’s voice throughout the earth” and we want this album to do just that, resound the Fathers love, truth, identity, hope and acceptance through song and sound. 

THE FUTURE: We hope you will join us in this journey of creating and making an album that will transform hearts, inspire hope, speak identity, call the lost home and most importantly resound the Fathers voice throughout the earth.


WHAT WILL THE ALBUM SOUND LIKE? This past February we got a chance to gather with 60 of our closest friends and family and record a live version of one of the songs that will be going on this album(we absolutely can't wait to record a studio version of this song!!!). It was an incredible night of encounter and worship with our beloved community. You can watch the live video for Love Unshakeable here: https://youtu.be/kMZq0wcp558 and can purchase the single by clicking the link below the cover art:


WHERE'S THE MONEY GOING? Of the $12,000, most of that is funding the album itself, while we will personally be funding the rewards. However if we go over our goal(which would be absolutely AMAZING!!!), the extra money will go towards studio musicians, funding the rewards, and marketing. Here is a basic estimated cost breakdown:
$9,600 - Production, Engineering, Mixing
$900 - Mastering
$1,500 - Indiegogo fees & Perks/Rewards

Rewards/Perks:
*Men's Anchor T-shirt**Men's Dreams T-shirt**Women's Dreams T-shirt**Women's Anchor T-shirt*

"Love Unshakeable" lyric art-print

Risks/Challenges:

No money is given to us until the fundraising campaign is completed. We will make sure that all rewards are fulfilled as soon as the album is completed.

Thank you so much for your support and prayers!

story:
Lockers are required to implement a community service program within Desert Hot Springs California.

Those providing community service, are low level non violent offenders, in their community, as part of their probation conditions.  

This grass roots advocacy program, promotes community involvement and crime reduction, by providing a targeted community the opportunity to love and respect their city. 

Lockers are a mandatory requirement to move this project forward. Thru community involvement and advocacy, that targets a certain population of people, we improve the community, its public appearance and has been statistically proven to reduce future crime in other cities.

$5, $10, $20, $50, $100, or what ever you can donate to help is greatly appreciated.  We also invite you to be part of this program as a volunteer.

story:
[TODAY IS THE LAST DAY TO CONTRIBUTE]

Dear Friends,

Welcome to my new Indiegogo campaign to support two projects that are dear to my heart: The making of my 12th Album and the realization of the Love and Mantra Outreach Tour!

LOVE AND MANTRA OUTREACH TOUR

First, your contribution will help me to manifest The Love and Mantra Outreach Tour, on which my wife Mira and I will be sharing Kirtan and sacred music at prisons, psychiatric hospitals, correction facilities, addiction recovery centers, and in hospice care. The tour will be in partnership with Call and Response Foundation and will take place for two weeks in the fall of 2016.

The Love and Mantra Outreach Tour gives us the opportunity to spread love and touch the hearts of those who need it most. Call and Response Foundation has generously pledged half the funds for the tour, and I will donate a portion of all campaign contributions to fulfill the remaining budget.

NEW ALBUM 

I would also like to invite you to be part of the creative process for my music by contributing to the making of my new album. Over the past year, I have enjoyed sharing my reflections on the path of love and the wisdom of the heart through writings and artful posters on social media. It has brought me great joy to see how these posts have touched so many of you.

Soon after sharing these posts, I began turning these reminders into Songs and Mantras. In doing so, I have felt deep creative inspiration, and have written music that amplifies the impact of the words. This music will comprise my 12th album, on which I am collaborating with renowned record producer Niko Bolas, known for his work with Neil Young, Melissa Etheridge, and many others.

I am now ready to get back into the studio to make some musical magic happen, and to do that, I am reaching out to you for your support to raise the funds. In return, I extend my deepest gratitude, and my commitment to give all of my heart to making beautiful and healing new music to share with all of you. 

THANK YOU FOR PARTICIPATING

I am so grateful for your participation in this campaign and would deeply appreciate your contribution for the making of my 12th Album and The Love and Mantra Outreach Tour. In addition to the gift of the music itself, we have made some unique perks available as a way of honoring your kindness and support. Please take a look at these special gifts.

My intention and prayer is that my new music inspires and uplifts you, and brings tremendous joy into your life. Please know that any amount you are able to offer is deeply appreciated. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for taking this blessed journey with me and for creating community through love and music.

With Love and Gratitude!

David

1. Some original posters that I turned into songs and chants for the new album...


2. Me and my beloved family, wife Mira, and daughter Tulsi...

3. For The Love and Mantra Outreach Tour, we will be partnering with Call and Response Foundation, a nonprofit organization devoted to expanding the mantra music community by bringing the experience of chanting to universities, schools, hospitals, prisons, music therapy programs, refugee support programs, battered women’s organizations, shelters, hospice, and nursing homes... 

4. Speaking of the Call and Response Foundation… The photo below was taken during a concert that they arranged for me at Skyland Trail Mental Health Facility for Young Adults in Atlanta. That event touched me deeply and was part of my inspiration for creating the Love and Mantra Outreach Tour!

5. My producer for the new album, Niko Bolas, shown below with another artist that he works with, Neil Young. I believe I am in good company :)

5. My view of Bliss! I am deeply blessed to share my music and heart with so many receptive and Loving Souls...

6. My first 11 albums. I left a space for #12...

6. I am Grateful for You...

story:
Hi! We are The Sha-Low Band...

We are a high energy, shuffle driven, cheeky country and rock and roll band from Timaru New Zealand. 
We are... Shane Clarke (established music teacher, compare of the Caroline Bay Carnival and bass player extraordinaire) Mitch Low (multi award winning vocalist and guitarist) Josh Blaikie (fastest sticks in East Timaru and one of the most exciting new talents in NZ) and Sarah Conlan (established independent artist, multi award winning songwriter and vocalist whose debut EP has already made the top ten album on the NZ charts)
And! We want to record a LIVE 5 track EP of some of our favourite songs and hopefully they are your favourites too. 
Here's where you come in... 

Would you like to help us get into the studio? Go on you know you want too! We are hoping to raise some money to go towards our recording and upcoming tour. Any money you donate to us goes directly to the following things... 

Recording, mixing, mastering, duplication (copies of the album) promotion and art work. We guesstimate the whole thing will cost around $2000.00 and as well as crowd funding we are doing everything we can to raise the money ourselves. 

You can help in other ways... 

  • Help us spread the word share our campaign with everyone you know 
  • Like our Facebook page 
  • Come and see us on tour 
  • Buy our album once it's out

story:
Short Summary

Live music creates community.  It breaks down barriers and creates bridges between cultures, races and religions.  For 19 years, St. Clair Productions has been creating community by bringing musicians to Ashland that might otherwise not be heard here.  We've produced music from Eastern Europe, Greece, China, Tuva, Caucasus Georgia, Turkey, Japan, Ireland, Scotland, Africa, Hawaii, Mexico, South America, and India.  Our styles of music from the US has included bluegrass, Americana, folk, and Native American.  We've brought in solo acts, bands and small vocal ensembles as well as the occasional comedian, storyteller, and one-person play.  Some of the performers we've produced include: Holly Near, Alasdair Fraser and Natalie Haas, Battlefield Band, Rajeev Taranath, Jai Uttal, Blame Sally, On Ensemble, Country Joe McDonald, Harry Manx, Mary Youngblood, Kitka, Tom Paxton, Klezmatics, Lucy Kaplansky, Odetta and over 300 others. 

When we filmed our video, we had 9 shows confirmed.  We have now finished planning our 20th Annual Eclectic Music and More Series of 13 shows.  The shows begin on September 20 and ends April 30. 

September 20: Cheryl Wheeler, singer/songwriter from the funny to the heart   
       warming with Peter Mulvey opening.
October 3 Cris Williamson, singer/songwriter, women's music
November 6 Tish Hinojosa, traditional Mexican folk songs and original music
November 14 Kirtan Rabbi Andrew Haun, Hebrew chants
November 21 Chris Smither, acoustic blues
December 12 Patrick Ball, Lisa Lynne and Aryeh Frankfurter, "A Winter's 
       Gift"Celtic harp and storytelling for the holidays
January 23 Keith Greeninger, singer/songwriter
February 20, Eliza Gilkyson, singer/songwriter
March 4 Pir Shabda Kahn, Indian vocal ragas
March 12 Mean Mary James, banjoist, traditional Americana and original songs
March 19 Swami Beyondananda, comedian
April 7 Sam Baker, singer/songwriter
April 30 Liquid Gold: William Coulter on guitar and Edwin Huizinga on violin,
      classical, folk and contemporary musical traditions from around the world.

   Cheryl Wheeler

     Peter Mulvey

     Pir Shabda Kahn

     Liquid Gold


In addition, Tish Hinojosa and Rabbi Andrew Haun will do school presentations.  Tish Hinojosa, Rabbi Andrew Haun, Pir Shabda Kahn, Swami Beyondananda and Mean Mary James will do public workshops.

Details on the concerts and workshops are at our website www.stclairevents.com.

What We Need & What You Get

We are using Indigogo to raise money for our 20th Annual Eclectic Music and More series as ticket sales don't cover all the expenses.  Although we only book acts that we consider extraordinary musicians and entertainers, we never know how many people will show up at a concert until we open the door.  Some shows have exceeded our expectations for attendance and some have had many less in attendance than we had hoped for.  We, therefore, need your support to keep the music coming.

      Rabbi Andrew Hahn, the Kirtan Rabbi

This is where YOU come in.  We need your contributions to help cover the expenses over what we bring in on ticket sales.  Our total estimated expenses for the 20th Annual Eclectic Music and More series will be $78,196.  We hope to have at least $25,000 of that covered by grants, sponsors, ads and YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS TO THIS CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN.

Direct costs for the shows before paying the musicians now totals $15,400.  These costs include hall rental, sound, advertising and printing. 

Musician guarantees (the amount of money paid to a musician no matter how many people show up) totals $25,000.  This amount includes the costs of Tish Hinojosa and Kirtan Rabbi's public workshops and a school presentations.   If a show does really well, the musicians also get paid a percentage of the door.  Therefore, I budget in another $10,000 to cover the percentage. 

Indirect costs include my stipend, website, printing the concert program and brochures, mailing the brochures, office supplies, refreshment supplies, non-profit and membership fees, and insurance.  These total $27,796

So far, we have received a $5000 grant from the City of Ashland from its lodging and food tax.  Western States Arts Federation has given us two grants -- $1925 for Rabbi Andrew Haun's concert, school presentation and public workshop and $1600 for Tish Hinojosa's concert, school presentation and public workshop.  The Carpenter Foundation has awarded us a $2000 grant.  We will be writing at least two more grants this summer.

       Cris Williamson

If you have read this far, we know you value live music.  Tickets to concerts are some of the perks you will receive.  You get to choose which concerts to attend.  Ads in the concert program is another perk at various levels and everyone will be thanked in the program.  At the $500 level, you also will receive a color poster from one concert signed by the musicians performing that night.  At the $800 level, you will receive a color poster from 3 concerts signed by the musicians performing that night. At $1200, you will receive a 15 minute private meeting with the musician of your choice.  Contribute just a little more -- $1500 -- and you get to have dinner with the musician of your choice paid for by St. Clair Productions.

     Chris Smither

The Impact

St. Clair Productions is so excited about having reached its 20th season.  We're the only non-profit producing folk music concerts in Ashland as our main reason for existing.  Giving Ashland residents the opportunity to attend hands-on workshops is our other focus.  St. Clair Productions also is the only producer of folk concerts in Ashland that has lasted 20 years.  Other organizations have come and gone -- we're still here. 

Why have we made it this long?  YOUR FINANCIAL SUPPORT.  And with your financial support, we can continue to bring musicians to Ashland that YOU love and want to come see live.

     Tish Hinojosa 

Risks & Challenges

Last season, attendance was down.  We ended the season approximately $3000 in the red.  Reserves from previous seasons are keeping us going for now.  We need both your Indiegogo contributions and your attending shows to make it through the next season in order to have a 21st season.  We still have some reserves, but cannot continue operating in the red.

      Swami Beyondananda
story_txt:
Short SummaryLive music creates community.  It breaks down barriers and creates bridges between cultures, races and religions.  For 19 years, St. Clair Productions has been creating community by bringing musicians to Ashland that might otherwise not be heard here.  We've produced music from Eastern Europe, Greece, China, Tuva, Caucasus Georgia, Turkey, Japan, Ireland, Scotland, Africa, Hawaii, Mexico, South America, and India.  Our styles of music from the US has included bluegrass, Americana, folk, and Native American.  We've brought in solo acts, bands and small vocal ensembles as well as the occasional comedian, storyteller, and one-person play.  Some of the performers we've produced include: Holly Near, Alasdair Fraser and Natalie Haas, Battlefield Band, Rajeev Taranath, Jai Uttal, Blame Sally, On Ensemble, Country Joe McDonald, Harry Manx, Mary Youngblood, Kitka, Tom Paxton, Klezmatics, Lucy Kaplansky, Odetta and over 300 others.  When we filmed our video, we had 9 shows confirmed.  We have now finished planning our 20th Annual Eclectic Music and More Series of 13 shows.  The shows begin on September 20 and ends April 30.  September 20: Cheryl Wheeler, singer/songwriter from the funny to the heart           warming with Peter Mulvey opening.October 3 Cris Williamson, singer/songwriter, women's musicNovember 6 Tish Hinojosa, traditional Mexican folk songs and original musicNovember 14 Kirtan Rabbi Andrew Haun, Hebrew chantsNovember 21 Chris Smither, acoustic bluesDecember 12 Patrick Ball, Lisa Lynne and Aryeh Frankfurter, "A Winter's         Gift"Celtic harp and storytelling for the holidaysJanuary 23 Keith Greeninger, singer/songwriterFebruary 20, Eliza Gilkyson, singer/songwriterMarch 4 Pir Shabda Kahn, Indian vocal ragasMarch 12 Mean Mary James, banjoist, traditional Americana and original songsMarch 19 Swami Beyondananda, comedianApril 7 Sam Baker, singer/songwriterApril 30 Liquid Gold: William Coulter on guitar and Edwin Huizinga on violin,       classical, folk and contemporary musical traditions from around the world.    Cheryl Wheeler 
     Peter Mulvey

     Pir Shabda Kahn
     Liquid Gold
In addition, Tish Hinojosa and Rabbi Andrew Haun will do school presentations.  Tish Hinojosa, Rabbi Andrew Haun, Pir Shabda Kahn, Swami Beyondananda and Mean Mary James will do public workshops.Details on the concerts and workshops are at our website www.stclairevents.com.
  What We Need & What You Get We are using Indigogo to raise money for our 20th Annual Eclectic Music and More series as ticket sales don't cover all the expenses.  Although we only book acts that we consider extraordinary musicians and entertainers, we never know how many people will show up at a concert until we open the door.  Some shows have exceeded our expectations for attendance and some have had many less in attendance than we had hoped for.  We, therefore, need your support to keep the music coming.

      Rabbi Andrew Hahn, the Kirtan Rabbi
This is where YOU come in.  We need your contributions to help cover the expenses over what we bring in on ticket sales.  Our total estimated expenses for the 20th Annual Eclectic Music and More series will be $78,196.  We hope to have at least $25,000 of that covered by grants, sponsors, ads and YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS TO THIS CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN.
Direct costs for the shows before paying the musicians now totals $15,400.  These costs include hall rental, sound, advertising and printing.  
Musician guarantees (the amount of money paid to a musician no matter how many people show up) totals $25,000.  This amount includes the costs of Tish Hinojosa and Kirtan Rabbi's public workshops and a school presentations.   If a show does really well, the musicians also get paid a percentage of the door.  Therefore, I budget in another $10,000 to cover the percentage.  
Indirect costs include my stipend, website, printing the concert program and brochures, mailing the brochures, office supplies, refreshment supplies, non-profit and membership fees, and insurance.  These total $27,796
So far, we have received a $5000 grant from the City of Ashland from its lodging and food tax.  Western States Arts Federation has given us two grants -- $1925 for Rabbi Andrew Haun's concert, school presentation and public workshop and $1600 for Tish Hinojosa's concert, school presentation and public workshop.  The Carpenter Foundation has awarded us a $2000 grant.  We will be writing at least two more grants this summer.

       Cris Williamson
If you have read this far, we know you value live music.  Tickets to concerts are some of the perks you will receive.  You get to choose which concerts to attend.  Ads in the concert program is another perk at various levels and everyone will be thanked in the program.  At the $500 level, you also will receive a color poster from one concert signed by the musicians performing that night.  At the $800 level, you will receive a color poster from 3 concerts signed by the musicians performing that night. At $1200, you will receive a 15 minute private meeting with the musician of your choice.  Contribute just a little more -- $1500 -- and you get to have dinner with the musician of your choice paid for by St. Clair Productions.

     Chris Smither
  The Impact St. Clair Productions is so excited about having reached its 20th season.  We're the only non-profit producing folk music concerts in Ashland as our main reason for existing.  Giving Ashland residents the opportunity to attend hands-on workshops is our other focus.  St. Clair Productions also is the only producer of folk concerts in Ashland that has lasted 20 years.  Other organizations have come and gone -- we're still here.  
Why have we made it this long?  YOUR FINANCIAL SUPPORT.  And with your financial support, we can continue to bring musicians to Ashland that YOU love and want to come see live.

     Tish Hinojosa  
  Risks & ChallengesLast season, attendance was down.  We ended the season approximately $3000 in the red.  Reserves from previous seasons are keeping us going for now.  We need both your Indiegogo contributions and your attending shows to make it through the next season in order to have a 21st season.  We still have some reserves, but cannot continue operating in the red.      Swami Beyondananda

story:
Namaste liebe Freunde,

Wir laden Euch ein, bei unserer neuen CD mitzuwirken !
Pre-Order unsere neue Mantra CD ´Gayatri´ und unterstütze gleichzeitig die unabhängige Produktion. Die Musik ist ideal für die eigene Yoga-Praxis

Seit 8 Jahren bringen wir jährlich weit mehr als tausend Menschen durch Festivals, Retreats und Kirtans zusammen um die Kraft von Yoga, Mantra & Meditation zu teilen. 

Mit unserem neuen Projekt, der CD ´Gayatri - a Savasana Soundtrack´ laden wir Dich ein, unsere neue CD als erstes zu genießen und uns somit gleichzeitig in der Produktion zu unterstützen - durch z.B. der Vorbestellung vom Download oder der signierten CD. 

Wir leben in einer neuen Zeit, in der die Kraft der Gemeinschaft die Welt bewegt und Projekte wie dieses Album durch Crowdfunding manifestieren. 

Musik-Labels oder Vertriebe die sonst den Großteil der Einnahmen vom Verkauf schlucken, werden durch diese Platform nicht mehr nötig sein. Wir können nun endlich eine CD durch direkten Kontakt mit Euch produzieren und vertreiben ohne wie vorher den Großteil vom Verkauf an ein Label/Vertrieb zahlen zu müssen.

Seit 2011 waren wir nicht mehr im Studio und arbeiten seitdem an neuen Songs (Mantren) & Arrangements und haben mehrere Musiker (an Piano, Vocals, Guitar, Harmonium, Sitar, Tabla, Bansuri, Esraj) eingeladen um Mantren wie das Gayatri, Asatoma, Moola Mantra zu vertonen und eine neue, einmalige CD für Yoga & Meditation zu produzieren.

Die Kosten für insgesamt 8 Musiker + Ton-Techniker + mehrere Wochen im Tonstudio + Mastering + Fotograf + GrafikDesign liegen bei mind. 18.000€ 

Wir freuen uns sehr, wenn Euch unser Wirken inspiriert und ihr Euch auf eine neue CD von uns freut. Wenn ihr dabei sein wollt, findet ihr hier die Option zur Vorbestellung des Downloads oder der signierten CD, sowie weitere Möglichkeiten, am Projekt teilzunehmen und zu unterstützen.
Wenn ihr ein Yoga-Studio habt, kommen wir gern zum CD-Release zu Euch und geben einen Workshop + Kirtan - die Option siehst du auch hier.
Unter ´Galerie´ findet ihr ein Video aus Bali von uns sowie einige Fotos :) enjoy

Danke Euch !!! Alles Liebe,
Sathya & Liliana
www.bhaktiyogasummer.com
https://soundcloud.com/sathya-liliana

story:
Le projet:

J'ai besoin de vous pour lancer ce projet dans les meilleures conditions.

Le projet est de créer un pôle complet de post-production audio, allant de la composition de bandes originales à l'enregistrement avec un vrai orchestre en passant par du sound design et doublage de voix.

Je souhaite proposer un service complet pour les professionnels et amateurs de l'audiovisuel, mais aussi une solution  étendue pour le monde vidéo-ludique,

Outre les services proposés, Dark Fantasy Studio éditera des albums au format digital dédiés à l'audiovisuel, tels que des musiques de trailers et teasers, d'ambiance ou encore des compilations de sound design par thème. 

Les pôles:

COMPOSITION / ENREGISTREMENT: Dark Fantasy Studio proposera de composer les bandes originales de divers projets, longs/ courts métrages, web-séries, documentaires ou encore jeux vidéo et applications. J'étudierais avec les futurs clients, les besoins et demandes, afin de trouver la meilleure solution pour habiller leurs images et leurs donner la puissance ou l'émotion qu'elles méritent. Une salle entièrement équipée pourra au final, accueillir un vrai orchestre et un chœur de qualité pour une dimension de son unique.

Exemple de mon travail pour un jeu vidéo.


Dark Fantasy Studio réalise également des arrangements pour des albums internationaux.

SOUND DESIGN: le pôle sound design permet la création des sons et ambiances. Une salle de réunion à proximité du petit studio permettra de définir la ligne conductrice pour trouver l'identité audio des projets. 

DOUBLAGE DE VOIX: troisième pôle de Dark Fantasy Studio, le studio de doublage permettra de poser des voix françaises sur du contenu étranger, ou encore habiller, par exemple, un film d'animation avec les voix de vrais acteurs. Nous pourrons également enregistrer des voix off pour tous projets. 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Je suis actuellement à la recherche de partenaires, mais j'ai avant tout besoin de vous! L'argent servira avant tout à rechercher un local et à l'équiper, ainsi, une fois en place, le travail pourra vraiment commencer et la recherche de projets sera plus simple. Le but premier est d'équiper la salle d'enregistrement pour pouvoir accueillir les musiciens dans les meilleures conditions possibles, le grand studio sera mis en place et si vous m'aidez à dépasser les objectifs, le studio de sound design et de doublage de voix pourrons sortir de terre. 

2000 euros: location du local

4000 euros: aménagement de la salle d'enregistrement

5000 euros: aménagement du premier studio

7000 euros: amélioration du matériel

10000 euros et plus: création du studio de doublage et de sound design

Comme Dark Fantasy Studio va développer ses propres albums, vous pourrez en profiter grandement en contreparties de votre aide. D'autres contreparties intéressantes sont mises en place suivant votre aide.



Si la campagne n'atteint pas son objectif final, les fonds serviront tout de même au développement du studio.

L'impact

Sans vous, je n'y arriverai pas. Dark Fantasy Studio à besoin de vous pour donner une vraie alternative aux porteurs de projets. 

Mon expérience en tant que compositeur m'a permis de travailler sur des projets étrangers, tels que le long métrage WISH FOR TOMORROW en Australie, le court métrage ASSASSIN EXIT aux USA,SHEILA en Angleterre, ou encore les orchestrations et  arrangements pour l'album de TIMO TOLKKI'S AVALON - ANGELS OF THE APOCALYPSE (avec les vocalistes de Nightwish/ Rhapsody / Epica / Virgin Steel etc etc) en Finlande.



 J'ai pu créer des contacts et améliorer mon travail, ma façon de faire à leurs côtés, aujourd'hui, je veux mettre à profit ce que j'ai appris pour que tous les porteurs de projets puissent avoir une post production audio de qualité. Amateurs ou professionnels, tout ce dont un projet a besoin en matière de post production audio sera disponible sur le site!

Vous êtes la locomotive moteur, mettons le train en marche et rien ne pourra l'arrêter! 

Risques et défis

Tout projet comporte un risque, il est évident que des obstacles se mettrons sur la route, mais le fait d'avoir un studio qui se monte, donne également une crédibilité certaine et ceci n'est possible que grâce à vous. Mon expérience grandissante m'a permis de voir le côté pervers du milieu de la musique, je suis donc équipé pour y faire face et passer outre.

D'autres façons d'aider

Votre contribution n'est pas uniquement financière! Vous pouvez partager cette page autant de fois que vous le souhaitez, partagez ce projet autour de vous, il intéressera forcement du monde près de vous!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Joel Meeks, a multi-instrumentalist, singer/songwriter, side man, comedian, and gluten-free baker. I have some great plans to create some completely ridiculous new content! I have a handful of new bluesy, tongue in cheek, original tunes that would make a fun EP. Some of these will be made into specialized, custom, dry-erase videos! You can check out some that I've already made on my Youtube channel "youtube.com/sleevelessmeeks," or just pop by my little website at joelmeekspresents.com! My last project was a blast! It featured some of my closest and most incredibly talented friends as well as a special appearance on "Piglets" by banjoist Richard Bailey of the SteelDrivers!!!! I'd love to be able to do it again, and if possible, make something even better. That's why I need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

So here's the skinny, I'm asking for 7000 buckaroos! If successfully raised, this will be spent on:

The EP:

  • Several recording sessions in a professional studio with an amazing engineer to record 5 songs
  • Time spent mixing and mastering those 5 songs
  • Photography/graphic design
  • Duplication of CD's 
  • Website design/update
Videos
  • A decent camera that suits my dry-erase animation needs
  • Dry-erase boards and markers
  • Decent lights to create a more consistent picture
  • A sturdy tripod
  • A budget to work with professional people when appropriate
Musical Instrument Maintenance
  • My alto saxophone badly needs new pads, springs, and cork.
  • My harmonicas badly need new reed plates, allowing me to play in tune in all keys.
  • I need an amp cover for my Jet City 333 tube amplifier to protect it.
  • Guitar strings
  • Mandolin...?

Prizes!!

As some of you know, I'm a fantastic baker and I love to perform at house parties and other fun events! Here is a list of prizes for my generous donors:

  • $25 - A signed copy of the brand new CD with your name in the liner notes and a custom, homemade "Thank you" card!
  • $50 - A signed copy of the brand new CD with your name in the liner notes, a merch package that includes a groovy t-shirt and a sticker, and a custom, homemade "Thank you" card!
  • $100 - A half-hour lesson for you or someone else on saxophone, harmonica, or guitar, a signed copy of the brand new CD with your name in the liner notes, a merch package that includes a groovy t-shirt and a sticker, and a custom, homemade "Thank you" card!
  • $350 - A private house concert with myself, a friend, and all of my instruments,  and one of my delicious gluten-free chocolate cakes with real chocolate ganache (8"x12")! PLUS A signed copy of the brand new CD with your name in the liner notes, a merch package that includes a groovy t-shirt and a sticker, and a custom, homemade "Thank you" card!
  • $700 - A personalized 30 second dry-erase animated advertisement, PSA, or campaign video (real or fictional) in which I basically tell the world how unbelievably freakin' awesome you are for donating. These will surely be a dumptruck load of fun for everyone involved! PLUS A private house concert with myself, a friend, and all of my instruments, and one of my delicious gluten-free chocolate cakes with real chocolate ganache icing (8"x12")! PLUS A signed copy of the brand new CD with your name in the liner notes, a merch package that includes a groovy t-shirt and a sticker, and a custom, homemade "Thank you" card!
  • $1000 - YOU get to be a character in the first animated video of the new project!! That's right, my silly stick figure version of YOUR LIKENESS will be used as a character in my next dry-erase board animated video!! PLUS A private house concert with myself, a friend, and all of my instruments, and one of my delicious gluten-free chocolate cakes (8"x12") with real chocolate ganache icing! PLUS A signed copy of the brand new CD with your name in the liner notes, a merch package that includes a groovy t-shirt and a sticker, and a custom, homemade "Thank you" card!
  • $5000 - I will record any song of your choice (original or cover) and make an animated video of the song with your likeness as one of the characters!! PLUS everything included in the Copper Package!!
  • $7000 - If someone is generous enough to donate the entire amount, not only will they get every single prize previously listed, they will get to choose the charity that benefits from my CD release party! Also, you will get to help me choose the title of the EP!!!
If an amount is donated that falls between or above any of the listed prizes, I will do my best to make sure some other prizes are included to show appreciation!!
The Impact

Your donation will surely impact more people than just one. Sure, I'll be incredibly thankful for the chance to record this new batch of songs and raise the quality of my videos and instruments, but so will others! This is also a donation to the bands I'm lucky enough to play with and possibly make videos for, and all the listeners and viewers that will be able to appreciate the art!! Furthermore, the CD release party will be a fundraiser with all proceeds going to an incredible charity that has yet to be decided! Your help is also a donation to others in your community!! And remember, my last three albums are still available for free download at joelmeeks.bandcamp.com!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with your friends via emails, social media, faceyspace, instagramp, tweedle deet,  and all that other stuff! Visit joelmeekspresents.com and watch some of my other videos and drop me a line, it'd be great to hear from you!


And THANK YOU in advance for all of your help!!

$1000 - YOU get to be a character in the first animated video of the new project!! That's right, my silly stick figure version of YOUR LIKENESS will be used as a character in my next dry-erase board animated video!! PLUS A private house concert with myself, a friend, and all of my instruments, and one of my delicious gluten-free chocolate cakes (8"x12") with real chocolate ganache icing! PLUS A signed copy of the brand new CD with your name in the liner notes, a merch package that includes a groovy t-shirt and a sticker, and a custom, homemade "Thank you" card!
$5000 - I will record any song of your choice (original or cover) and make an animated video of the song with your likeness as one of the characters!! PLUS everything included in the Copper Package!!
$7000 - If someone is generous enough to donate the entire amount, not only will they get every single prize previously listed, they will get to choose the charity that benefits from my CD release party! Also, you will get to help me choose the title of the EP!!!

If an amount is donated that falls between or above any of the listed prizes, I will do my best to make sure some other prizes are included to show appreciation!!

The Impact

 Your donation will surely impact more people than just one. Sure, I'll be incredibly thankful for the chance to record this new batch of songs and raise the quality of my videos and instruments, but so will others! This is also a donation to the bands I'm lucky enough to play with and possibly make videos for, and all the listeners and viewers that will be able to appreciate the art!! Furthermore, the CD release party will be a fundraiser with all proceeds going to an incredible charity that has yet to be decided! Your help is also a donation to others in your community!! And remember, my last three albums are still available for free download at joelmeeks.bandcamp.com!!

    Other Ways You Can Help Share this campaign with your friends via emails, social media, faceyspace, instagramp, tweedle deet,  and all that other stuff! Visit joelmeekspresents.com and watch some of my other videos and drop me a line, it'd be great to hear from you!

And THANK YOU in advance for all of your help!!

story:
Hi, my name is Garth Allen and I am the grateful leader and founder of Vancouver Rock band THE THICK OF IT!

Music has been through all stages of my life, single guy, party guy, living high on a major record deal guy, sad guy, depressed guy, family guy, working guy, screw the world guy and peaceful guy. I have written, performed and recorded music since the age of 14 only to get what was in my soul onto tape or on the stage. Along the way I have always found the means to pay for recording, pull-in favors or whatever. This time around I want to record what I believe is the most profound music I have ever written with my brothers in THE THICK OF IT. Although we have managed to get some loot together we do not want to "skimp" on quality. We need  help to get to the finish line hopefully through this campaign and crowd funding to record the songs that will get us to another level.

Why we need to do this 

The money we are trying to raise is specifically for recording a 4 song E.P, although there are many different ways to save money, recording at home, etc., the reality is  recording at a proper studio with a high level engineer/producer gets the golden results.
In addition to the money we already have in the "pot"  we need $6000 to complete the  recording and also to pay for press-packs and on-line " push" to get as many people as possible to hear us.

 I personally have been signed to a major record deal with the band "Flybanger"  AKA "JAR." on Columbia/Sony records back in the early 2000's and have learned so much about what needs to happen to MAKE IT HAPPEN . No matter how much our world is changing the basics still hold true, FIRST IMPRESSIONS ARE EVERYTHING and the first time someone hears new music it needs to first of all BE a great song but it also NEEDS to sound amazing!

Even if we do not reach the $6000 goal in our campaign not all is lost..we will prevail and start the recording to finish at least one or two songs which will still help us get the attention we need from influential agents and managers.

WHAT YOU GET IN RETURN

 Aside from the satisfaction of knowing you directly played a huge part in us reaching our goals and dreams, here are some of the  "perks" that will be offered to contributors.

- Receive our 4 song EP once it is all finished before the release date.

-Two never released original songs by Garth Allen of THE THICK OF IT recorded by Garth and Songwriter Scott Reinson. 

- Exclusive links emailed to you that include unreleased songs mentioned above + our finished EP  +  2 official band  stickers mailed to your door.
- Exclusive links emailed to you that include unreleased songs mentioned above + our finished EP +  2 official band  stickers mailed to your door. You will also get emailed a exclusive link for our full length album titled " First day of death" released in 2010. 
- Exclusive autographed CD of the finished product.
-   90 minute lesson with our main bass man Russell Bergquist in person ( within 75km of Vancouver)  or via Skype http://www.discogs.com/artist/1843548-Russell-Bergquist

-  90 minute lesson with our main guitar man Alex Roque in person ( within 75km of Vancouver) or via Skype https://www.facebook.com/alexander.roque.982?fref=ts

-  2 hour drum set-up/tuning lesson with our main drum man Jeffrey  Woods in person ( within 75km of Vancouver)  https://www.facebook.com/jeffery.woods.79?fref=ts

-  2 hour one-on-one writing session with Garth .A in person ( within 75km of Vancouver) or Via Skype  https://soundcloud.com/the-thick-of-it/sets/other-projects-i-write-perform

-  A live performance by THE THICK OF IT  electric OR acoustic at the venue of your choice within 75km of Vancouver. We will show-up and play your house,back yard, club your friends or family own...whatever! 

https://youtu.be/elRkC-sScFg

https://youtu.be/y3NZNfCs4Uo 


Other Ways You Can Help

The success of this campaign will not only help us give our dream it's " Best shot"  but will also take our music careers to a new level.On top of whatever perks you get, you also get the satisfaction of knowing we are eternally grateful for your support.

Please help if you can, even if "help" simply means reposting this on all of your various social media networks and telling all of your friends about it. This campaign cannot succeed unless you decide that it will.

- THE THICK OF IT

story:
The Sound and the Light

The Sound and the Light is a group of five musicians creating music without stylistic boundaries. We are inspired by stories from the world’s religious and mythic traditions in which sound and light interact to create the material universe, and we are excited about connecting with the community through our musical universe.

The Sound and the Light is:  Kallie Ciechomski (viola/voice), Joel Lambdin (violin), Laura Metcalf (cello/voice), and Jim Robertson (bass)


For bios and other info, check out our website here.

Our first concert is August 30th, 2PM

at Abrons Art Center

This is the first activity of our partnership with Abrons, and is mainly what we are asking you to support. The program reflects our eclectic interests and inspirations, and includes original music along with contemporary classical, medieval chant, and some pop tunes.


ACCESS ABRONS

Access Abrons is the title of the partnership of The Sound and the Light and Abrons Art Center, and it will include a variety of performance and educational projects. 

Here are some classes we will work with, pending funding:

  • Sonic Collective
  • Audio Landscapes (adult music creation class)
  • Open Jam (where you can play music with us, or just listen to us experiment)
     
Also, through Abrons' offsite programs, we will be visiting public school students learning about classical music.

Where does the money go?

Making our goal of $6000 would mean we could completely cover performer fees, administration fees, and would give us a start on covering artist fees for the classes we will be offering at Abrons beginning in September. The more generous you are, the less often we have to ask for your help. Abrons is a division of the Henry Street Settlement, which has a 100-year history of deeply impacting the Lower East Side community. Supporting us means supporting their much needed work that crosses class, race, and educational boundaries. If that's not enough for you, we created some perks like one does for these campaigns. Since we called our little project Access, our perks are all about accessing our performers and the artistic Mecca that is NYC.

What will this do for the community?

Abrons Art Center has working relationships with many schools and community organizations in the LES neighborhood. A great example is the Lower East Side Preparatory High School. As part of Access, we would play music for students in Abrons' existing choral and music appreciation program there. Quite apart from the well documented benefits of consistent exposure to the arts, a project like this can totally alter the course of lives in a good way. And you can be part of it!

A partnership of this type is also tricky. We are agreeing to shoulder much of the responsibility for fundraising in return for space and inclusion in Abrons' class offerings, so we are relying on you to make it happen. But each member of our group brings skills to the table beyond writing and performing music. Highlights of our combined administrative experience includes the establishment of chamber music festivals is Florida and Connecticut, development and funding of a music series with attendant outreach in Pennsylvania, Music Director for DBR and the Mission and so on. The challenges we face are sort of up our collective alley. Plus we are simply excited for the opportunity to work in this way, especially as a new project.

Other Ways You Can Help

You don't have to give us money! Come to the shows! Make some noise about what we are up to! Share this page! Or, if you prefer something more along a volunteer line, please get in touch with Joel. There is plenty to be done, and we would love to hear from you.

story:
Short Summary

Tobi Hero and James Bradley Junior along with their brothers in arms Kevin Walker and TM Stevens have come together to create an entirely new groove for the fan.  Music moves everyone, young and old which is why we would like to provide the world not only with our new music, but with an epic tour experience, documentary and album.  The group consists of 3 Platinum selling musicians from projects like the Beastie Boys, Slashes Blues Ball, Crazytown, Prince, Justin Timberlake and Anita Baker.  

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need 50,000 to record an album, video, purchase PR, radio campaigns and cover travel expenses to tour our first album internationally as A-List Independent musicians.  All artists with good music and a solid beat can shake things up a little. 
  • We have packages ranging from $5 up to $20,000 for 200 of your closest friends to have a private party and all the fixings.  Check out all the goodies in the perks section!

The Impact

We are helping to change the way fans and artists interact with each other by creating a Direct to fan interaction rather than filtering all of the fees and costs of promotion through a label we are showing large artists that they can fund albums and promotions without racking up large debit accounts.  This is the future, artists helping artists! 

Risks & Challenges

The New music market is more challenging and risky for those that support great music touring into markets around the world.  We seek to combat this by touring into the regions where our fans support us with donations.  With Big Data we can use analytics to give our true fans like you an experience they will not soon forget. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help tremendously by sharing this campaign with others and inviting your friends to like our Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/TheFearless3

story:
Who is this "Robert Svilpa" guy, and why should I support this music CD project??

I'm Robert Svilpa - musician, composer and vocalist over here in Snoqualmie Washington, USA. With my good friends Paul Harrington and Mark Parris, we've written, arranged & recorded about 80 minutes worth of original music. Helping out the project on drums and percussion were featured guests Nick D'Virgilio, Andy Edwards & Zsolt Galantai. Guitar god Alan Morse rounds out the guest list playing lead guitars on the instrumental Mesmerize. The artwork and packaging were created by celebrated artist Ed Unitsky  (www.edunitsky.com) whose resume includes album covers for Unitopia, The Flower Kings and many others.



The completed album was recorded mostly in our home studios between Nov 2007 and May 2009 - but for many reasons instead of releasing it at the time the album was shelved temporarily. I ended up burning a measly 35 CD-Rs - 14 which were sent to a small group of loyal supporters and the remaining 21 went out to reviewers & prog radio websites.

This original version of the album got rave reviews - some examples of which are below:

  • “A Fine Line Between… is an album that knows no boundaries in what relates to style, as its musical aesthetics never stand still on a particular genre. The music is melodious but in a complex way, always challenging the listener to accompany the directions it surprisingly takes...a great creation of modern progressive music with a deep respect for the legendary vintage bands. A work of art!”

    - Nuno Lourenco, ProgGnosis (Feb 12, 2010)

  • “A Fine Line Between ... is neo prog but contemporary... All tunes are very accessible - the songs are very well constructed - Robert Svilpa is a good song writer... neo progressive rock incorporating many traditional prog aspects without sounding old fashioned. Robert Svilpa very nicely combines elements from well known symphonic bands (with) songs that are accessible, without becoming too predictable... DPRP Recommended!!”

    - EDWIN ROOSJEN, DPRP (Jan 02, 2010)

  • "a fine line between..." is an excellent new album that caught this reviewer totally by surprise. Progressive rock with elements of neo, symphonic and pop that comes together remarkably well, very listenable & full of melodies... Do yourself a favour & check it out. You will not be disappointed.

    - Sea of Tranquility (Oct 15, 2009)

  • “Robert Svilpa and his band have created some great memorable music on A Fine Line Between… a very recommendable to fans of the more melodic side of progressive rock genre. This is an album that could sit side by side new releases by Porcupine Tree, IQ and many others.”

    - Ron Fuchs, ProgNaut.com (Oct 22, 2009)

So finally in 2013 I went back to the original recordings resulting in entirely new mixes of the songs incorporating significant improvements in vocal and instrumental performances. To date, feedback from internet radio and reviewers has been very positive - many have remarked on how clean & crisp but "with balls" these songs sound today.

Here's the first "single" that internet radio has been playing a lot.

Mirror Mirror - first single from the album


What We Need & What You Get

To be very transparent, this is what I'm looking to fund:

  • do a top to bottom mastering of the CD with Steve Turnidge - mastering engineer extraordinaire. Build a "glass master" CD to have for proper replication. Package rate of $500 is what's been quoted.
  • manufacture 1000 full color printed 6 panel CD packages, shrink wrapped and with UPC number. This is quoted at $1350 with shipping.
  • shooting a promotional video for the album - it will be a self-produced product using rented high definition cameras and my own video production/editing software. I'm estimating between $300 and $500 for the camera rental, incidentals, set pieces and rentals of lighting equipment as needed. (1 day)
  • I'm asking for a little bit more to cover off any overages in costs, plus promotional postage/shipping to enable setting up inventory with Amazon, CDBaby.com, and distribution networks overseas. I also need to send copies of the CD to music labels to work out distribution deals to both get exposure through the labels marketing networks and also provide credibility for the album itself. 
Of course, if we don't get all the funding we're hoping for I'll be following the task list above and completing each in that exact order - at minimum, reaching a value just over $800 would get us to the point of fully mastered songs and a glass master CD but then likely choosing to have CD-R duplication for short run of 100 exclusively for those who have contributed and are supporting the campaign. It's very important that we take care of you, our trusting supporters.
NOW, if we were to surpass our goal - I have been writing the narrative story that anchors and ties all the songs together with the intention to make it a novella that accompanied the CD. If we exceed the goal and achieve $4500 or more, I'll have the novella professionally printed into booklet form and have them sent along with the CD perks you purchased. I will even sign the booklet with a personal message to each contributor thanking you for your support.
The perks themselves have added items with each level - a full 60 minute CD of classic rock and progressive rock tribute songs. Select songs from the other two remixing projects "The Sound of Thoughts" and "Onion". Outtakes and rehearsal writing sessions of the songs that made it onto the CD. And I will offer the chance to have a phone or Skype conversation to discuss any music related item you would like to talk about - 30 minutes of one on one time.

The Impact you can make by contributing...

Having a proper replicated CD package of the album available gives the band a vehicle that will allow us to play more higher profile shows. Being able to play some of the key progressive rock festivals and events is invaluable but that opportunity can only be available if the band has CDs available - the credibility gains are immense.

Having success with this album then opens up opportunity for new music. As with everything in life, success breeds success - bands such as Marillion and Frost* have been able to ride grass roots fan support into long term success and a steady stream of new material, so this cannot be understated.

Risks & Challenges

From the perspective of the recordings, this project has very low risk 

  • marketing and publicity has been handled to date by myself (Rob) and people around us. Getting more airtime for the music shouldn't be difficult as I have been networking considerably to get it out there. Driving traffic to the website and all the distribution networks is the goal and all are on board with that task. 
  • Artwork & packaging is done:
  • Where risk exists is only in developing and legitimizing a working relationship with a music label who is supportive of the genre and in particular the band. With new music coming out and the reviews being good, we believe it will fit into the same sweet spot that artists like Steven Wilson, Gaspacho (the Norwegian band), IQ, Haken and Neal Morse / Spock's Beard sit right now.

Other Ways You Can Help

You personally may not be in a situation to contribute. That's ok - if you can help in the following way, it would be spectacular:

  • Help get the word out about this project and encourage people to contribute to my campaign.
  • Share the music, and ask me to do an interview or a Q & A session - there's a lot of background in terms of how everyone involved became involved with the CD
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Most of all - if you're on Facebook, Twitter, etc... share and rebroadcast anything to do with the project and future projects! 

Thanks to all and much love to you going forward!!
