do a top to bottom mastering of the CD with Steve Turnidge - mastering engineer extraordinaire. Build a "glass master" CD to have for proper replication. Package rate of $500 is what's been quoted.

manufacture 1000 full color printed 6 panel CD packages, shrink wrapped and with UPC number. This is quoted at $1350 with shipping.
shooting a promotional video for the album - it will be a self-produced product using rented high definition cameras and my own video production/editing software. I'm estimating between $300 and $500 for the camera rental, incidentals, set pieces and rentals of lighting equipment as needed. (1 day)
I'm asking for a little bit more to cover off any overages in costs, plus promotional postage/shipping to enable setting up inventory with Amazon, CDBaby.com, and distribution networks overseas. I also need to send copies of the CD to music labels to work out distribution deals to both get exposure through the labels marketing networks and also provide credibility for the album itself.  

Of course, if we don't get all the funding we're hoping for I'll be following the task list above and completing each in that exact order - at minimum, reaching a value just over $800 would get us to the point of fully mastered songs and a glass master CD but then likely choosing to have CD-R duplication for short run of 100 exclusively for those who have contributed and are supporting the campaign. It's very important that we take care of you, our trusting supporters.

NOW, if we were to surpass our goal - I have been writing the narrative story that anchors and ties all the songs together with the intention to make it a novella that accompanied the CD. If we exceed the goal and achieve $4500 or more, I'll have the novella professionally printed into booklet form and have them sent along with the CD perks you purchased. I will even sign the booklet with a personal message to each contributor thanking you for your support.
The perks themselves have added items with each level - a full 60 minute CD of classic rock and progressive rock tribute songs. Select songs from the other two remixing projects "The Sound of Thoughts" and "Onion". Outtakes and rehearsal writing sessions of the songs that made it onto the CD. And I will offer the chance to have a phone or Skype conversation to discuss any music related item you would like to talk about - 30 minutes of one on one time.   The Impact you can make by contributing... Having a proper replicated CD package of the album available gives the band a vehicle that will allow us to play more higher profile shows. Being able to play some of the key progressive rock festivals and events is invaluable but that opportunity can only be available if the band has CDs available - the credibility gains are immense.
Having success with this album then opens up opportunity for new music. As with everything in life, success breeds success - bands such as Marillion and Frost* have been able to ride grass roots fan support into long term success and a steady stream of new material, so this cannot be understated.
    Risks & Challenges From the perspective of the recordings, this project has very low risk 


marketing and publicity has been handled to date by myself (Rob) and people around us. Getting more airtime for the music shouldn't be difficult as I have been networking considerably to get it out there. Driving traffic to the website and all the distribution networks is the goal and all are on board with that task. 

Artwork & packaging is done:

Where risk exists is only in developing and legitimizing a working relationship with a music label who is supportive of the genre and in particular the band. With new music coming out and the reviews being good, we believe it will fit into the same sweet spot that artists like Steven Wilson, Gaspacho (the Norwegian band), IQ, Haken and Neal Morse / Spock's Beard sit right now.

    Other Ways You Can Help You personally may not be in a situation to contribute. That's ok - if you can help in the following way, it would be spectacular:  Help get the word out about this project and encourage people to contribute to my campaign.
Share the music, and ask me to do an interview or a Q & A session - there's a lot of background in terms of how everyone involved became involved with the CD Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Most of all - if you're on Facebook, Twitter, etc... share and rebroadcast anything to do with the project and future projects!    Thanks to all and much love to you going forward!!

story:
Voce Allegro Fund

Now in our 27th season, Voce's Artistic Director, Richard Giarusso leads our dynamic group of 38 talented choral artists based in Fairfax County, VA.

Voce Chamber Singers has long been regarded as one of the premier choruses in the greater Washington area, and with an all-volunteer membership we strive to represent the highest standards of choral musicianship in a diverse and challenging repertoire spanning centuries.

We have much in our history of which we can be proud, and we find ourselves in an exciting moment of artistic and organizational growth.  Our chorus members are committed and enthused, our audiences are growing and our artistic reputation is spreading throughout the region. 


As we look to new opportunities, we need to increase our budget to bring them to fruition.  Our goal is to raise $10,000 for three key initiatives:

- Commission and premiere a new choral work every two years - expanding the    choral repertoire for Voce and the whole choral community 

- Enrich Voce performances with guest musicians - enabling Voce to perform a    wider range of exciting repertoire

- Record a professional CD of Voce commissions and other works - increasing the    scope of Voce's audience

To enable us to accomplish these initiatives, we are launching the Voce Allegro Fund and are confident we can reach and even surpass our goal with your help. 

Voce is poised for extraordinary growth in the years ahead and we invite you, our extended family of friends and supporters, to join us in this effort and to share our story with others.  

Thank you for your support!


               ----We would love to see you at one of our concerts!----


THE WORLD WAKED - A Holiday Concert with Voce                                                    Friday, December 18, 2015 at 8:00 PM  & Sunday, December 20, 2015 at 4:00 PM

Voce celebrates the season with music spanning the Renaissance to the present day, including works of Lauridsen, Pärt, Górecki, Bruckner, Grieg, Tavener, and Virgil Thomson, among others. Join us as we present some of the most varied and beautiful choral repertoire that you're likely to hear anywhere this December!

AMERICAN CHORAL CLASSICS                                                                                           Friday, April 15, 2016 at 8:00 PM and Sunday, April 17, 2016 at 4:00 PM

Our season closes with a program to include the world premiere of a new Voce commission.  We will also revisit some of the best of Voce's previous commissions - a distinguished catalogue of works which have made a valuable contribution to the world of contemporary American choral music.  We situate this important element of our history within the broader context of American choral music in the 20th century, with a selection of works to include Bernstein's Chichester Psalms, Barber's Reincarnations, the Five Shaker Lyrics of Karen Tarlow, and works of Boston-based composer Rodney Lister.  

Tickets are available at www.voce.org/tickets or at the door                                          $25 General Admission, $20 Seniors (62+), $10 Students/ under 18 free


             ----and for our special non-subscription performance ----    

A JOINT CONCERT WITH THE CAPITOL HILL CHORALE                                 Saturday, March 12, 2016 at 7:30 PM and Sunday March 13, 2016 at 4:00 PM   Capitol Hill Presbyterian Church, 201 Independence Avenue, SE, Washington, DC

Voce joins the Capitol Hill Chorale and their artistic director, Frederick Binkholder, for a special collaborative concert to include the world premiere of three pieces by composer Kevin Siegfried.                                                                                                              

For more information and for tickets, visit www.capitolhillchorale.org

story:
Summary

My name is Ariel Levine.  Many of you may know me as lead singer and guitarist from the New York band, KiNDERGARTEN.  We were active through the 2000's and produced two albums together.  About 5 years ago, I was itching to step out of my comfort zone and leave my hometown of New York City.  I ended up in San Diego, where I've been making a name for myself as a producer, engineer and musician, here and in Los Angeles.  I've been lucky to work with some great artists, and have discovered new methods of finding happiness; namely the ocean.  But I'm an artist and a songwriter at heart.  Those sleepless nights are creeping back into my life, and new music is pouring out of me at a rate I can barely keep up with.  With that, I welcome you to the production of my debut solo album, "LET THE MACHINE GET IT".

This is meant to be a good ol' fashioned, full length, rock n' roll LP.  It has a story arc, it has recurring musical themes and it's meant to be listened to from start to finish.  That's not to say that each song can't stand out on it's own, I believe they do.  But I've always loved the art of the 40-45 minute album, I believe they're still relevant and it's the medium in which I work best. 

The songs I wrote with KiNDERGARTEN focused on finding humor in mankind's darkest moments, dystopian futures, cities and skylines.  However, this time I turn my candor inward, breaking down a wall I've kept up all these years. "LET THE MACHINE GET IT" is the first time where I'm writing about myself, my own personal experiences with love, loss, fear, change and obsession in a traveling story arc that surrounds the album. "LTMGI" is set to be the most personally revealing collection of songs in my career to date. 

What I Need

The drums have already been recorded at Rarefied Recording in San Diego, CA.  Now I just need to do the rest!

My asking budget will give me the complete start-to-finish freedom I need to create exactly what I set out to create, without compromises.  I'd love for "LTMGI" to be done at a professional studio.  Rarefied Recording has everything I need to make this sound as good as possible. 

Besides the recording process, my budget also includes:

-Hiring additional musicians when needed

-Mixing

-Mastering 

-Photo shoot, packaging and design of the album cover (see rough sketch below)

-Pressing and distributing vinyl

-Publicist and promotion  


Front cover rough concept:

 

Back cover rough concept:


The Impact

I believe in my heart I have something really good here.  I believe I have songs that everyone can find a spot to relate to.  I believe the art of the album is not dead.  This is not the only album I plan to make.  This is a starting point to what I hope is a long and prolific career as a solo artist.  The cornerstone to a full body of work to come.

If this can help boost my reputation and career, I will continue to write songs from my heart.  Songs that explore the human condition, the future, the world inside our heads and outside our eyes.  I will continue to make sounds that draw upon decades of influences, yet take them on new twists and turns. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it's ok, I know what it's like to struggle.  Moral support is sometimes just as effective as financial support.  Help spread the word if you can!  Share the links to my campaign and my Soundcloud on your social media pages and follow me on mine.  Make some noise!  Help get my name and my music out there!

story:
Hi, we are Nick & Nastya - IC3PEAK - audiovisual project based in Moscow.

We make music and art - it's our way of communication with the world above and beyond a "band".

You know that we love to keep it DIY: we film our videos, shoot photos make merch and produce all the music by our own.

This campaign is launched in order to level it up.


                           WHAT IS NEEDED:

We are starting to record our first full-length album. To make it truly unique, we'll need:

  • Studio time:               1500 $ for a month of recording/mixing at professional studio in Moscow. This album must sound good, which is difficult to achieve in our home studio. 
  • Camera crew:            2000 $ for 4 days of filming. Two music videos for tunes from the album will be made.
  • Publicist:                    2000 $ for a whole campaign. As this release will be exceptional, more people should know about it.
  • Merch production:   2000 $ for producing NECKLACE-USB'S, CD'S, SWEATSHIRTS AND CAPS.
  • Fees:                             500  $ for INDIEGOGO/PAYPAL fees

                      


                       PERKS 



FALLAL USB NECKLACE




FALLAL NECKLACE-STORAGE DEVICE WITH AN ALBUM, BONUS TRACK HIQ VIDEOS AND ALL THE PREVIOUS IC3PEAK RELEASES ON IT (WAV/MP3 FORMAT). IT WILL BE SHIPPED ALONG WITH BOOKLET W/LYRICS & TRACK-LIST, PACKED IN A JEWELLERY POUCH.


"I LOVE MYSELF" SWEATSHIRT


CUSTOM-MADE SWEATSHIRT WITH YOUR NAME ON IT ( YOUR NAME WILL BE PRINTED ON A BACK OF SWEATSHIRT WITH TINY LETTERS)


"REALITY BITES" CAP



"REALITY BITES"  CAP 

FALLAL CD

HAND-PRINTED AUDIO CD

IT GOES WITH BONUS TRACK, BOOKLET W/LYRICS & TRACK-LIST. IT WILL BE SHIPPED ALONG WITH IC3PEAK TATOO. 


USB BUNDLE





CD BUNDLE

TATOOS 

IC3PEAK TEMPORARY TATOOS

GOALS: 

8000   $ : we will record a full-length album, will film two videos, make sure that more people know about it, and we'll become cooler in live performance.

10000 $: we will be able to do all mentioned above + we'll go to Europe with a promo-tour.

12000 $: we'll be able to do all mentioned above + EU promo tour + US promo-tour.



IF YOU CAN'T HELP US WITH MONEY - JUST SHARE THE CAMPAIGN ON YOUR SOCIAL MEDIA, IT DOES HELP </3

story:
TRUST: AN EP FOR ERICA

Hello Friends,

My name is Ryan Tremblay and I am a Christian recording artist from Newport, Rhode Island. As some of you may or may not know, my sister, Erica Shea, passed away on June 23rd, 2015 from Breast Cancer... 

     Erica and Ryan - December 2014

Erica was diagnosed in December of 2014 and was fourteen weeks pregnant when she received the news. Despite many risks, she chose to continue her pregnancy and against all medical odds, gave birth to a beautiful, healthy baby girl on April 29th, 2015. Erica and her husband, Joshua, named their precious little miracle Eleanor "Ella" Gianna Shea...

    Erica and Ella - April 2015

Erica LOVED music and always encouraged me as a singer/songwriter. She was a fan of many artists including James Taylor, Amy Grant, and Michael W. Smith, and would often listen to music for inspiration. She believed in me and supported me in my dream of spreading the Good News through song...

Erica at The Ryman Auditorium in Nashville

Now, in honor of my sister, I'd like to make this record to share her story and give glory to God as she always did...And I want to do it in the biggest way possible! So for this project, I've asked one of my musical heroes, drumming legend Steve Gadd, to take part. He, along with a group of several A-list musicians, have agreed to be a part of this project, but first, I need your help...

What We Need & What You Get

In order to complete this project, I will need to raise $50,000. This money will go towards the cost of the five amazing studio musicians, studio time, the recording engineer, mixing/mastering, transportation to and from Los Angeles, food, lodging, production, and the wonderful perks for all of the contributors. Any left over proceeds will be donated to Cade and Ella's college fund - A special fund for Erica and Joshua's two children.

Here are some examples of the exciting perks we're happy to be offering to those who contribute to this project...


An Autographed CD



An Autographed Limited Edition GREEN Vinyl Record


A Limited Edition Autographed Poster


The TRUST Lyric Book


The TRUST Jumper


T-Shirts and Long Tee


If we do not reach the $50,000 goal, we will be forced to look at other options for seeing this project through to completion, but just like Erica, we're shooting for the moon first...We've got nothing to lose!

The Impact

Every dollar raised in this campaign will bring us one step closer to honoring Erica in a unique and powerful way. The end result will be a special keepsake for everyone who knew her and loved her, as well as for those who still have yet to hear her amazing story.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge of this campaign will be raising the total amount of funds needed to see this project and its perks through to completion.  While $50,000 may sound like a lofty goal at first, I believe achieving this goal is MORE than possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute monetarily to this campaign, you can still help us out by spreading the word to friends and family, co-workers and others who may be interested in supporting us in this project. Feel free to email, tweet, post, blog and share...The more the merrier!!
In conclusion, I am extremely grateful for the opportunity to work with such world-class talent on this project and I know that every penny will be put to good use. The music and other perks will certainly speak for themselves when all is said and done and we will be thrilled to share this project with the world!
Thank you in advance for your support and for helping to make this dream come true!  Without you, it wouldn't be possible...
Peace, Love, and Blessings,
-Ryan

The music and other perks will certainly speak for themselves when all is said and done and we will be thrilled to share this project with the world!
Thank you in advance for your support and for helping to make this dream come true!  Without you, it wouldn't be possible...
Peace, Love, and Blessings,
-Ryan

story:
Not since the early days of Motown has a company attempted to craft and mold young artist into full fledged musical brands that can create a fresh impact on the music landscape. "ON FUEGO PRODUCTIONS" wants to do just that. It's time to reestablish quality over quantity, style and substance, relevance and pride. Today's music is missing it's soul and we don't mean "soul music", we mean the "soul" of music. The ability to connect with the listener, to create those moments that take you back to a special time & place or that connection to love or a love lost... to create classic songs that will live on 20 years from now. Eddie Cabrera, Paul Beatty, Shawn Grate and Frank Desplantes have over 50 years of combined music experience. "ON FUEGO PRODUCTIONS". 

  • Big Q aka Eddie Cabrera was signed to Elektra Records as part of a 4 man group called P.R.I.M.O. Eddie was later signed to Indie label Timezrite Music where he released his debut solo album Eddie Cabrera The Arrival. 
  • Paul Beatty has released 3 contemporary Jazz albums in his career and has produced award winning jingles (The Happy Prince) & movie scores (Intervention). 
  • Frank "Dez" Deplantes was part of the hot 4 man group Business & Pleasure garnering upcoming songwriter honors in Billboard magazine (May 2004),
  • Shawn "Big Dap" Grate was a writer/ producer for Fine Tune Music Inc. and indie label Timezrite Music.

What's happened to today's music? What's missing? Where is the dedication to the art of making music? You can count on one hand the true artist today that can write/ play an instrument/ sing or captivate an audience with a virtuoso live performance. "ON FUEGO PRODUCTIONS" wants to reestablish the importance of artist development/ Branding and increase artists longevity. Blazing new trails and bringing real R&B/Pop music back!!

Our roster of talent, EVIE, VANITY & LIL' BIT are the embodiment of what we want to bring back to the music world. ON FUEGO PRODUCTIONS wants to bring their music to the world. The contributions to this project are a way for people to tell the world that anything is possible.....that real music is alive and well....and that no matter how far you fall you can get back up and make your life extraordinary. It's not often that you can be a part of a miracle... let alone affect it's very ability to exist. Be a part of the movement.....this music revolution......Help us bring real Artistry, music, composition, melodies and musicianship back to the world!!! Be a part of the renaissance! 

(Go to the gallery above and hear a snipet of "EVIE's" Christmas song "Celebrate")

What We Need & What You Get

Our Project goal is $150,000 and every penny counts toward making this project come to life. breakdown of costs include but are not limited to:

  • Studio Console and DAW software.
  • Apple Computer / Controller keyboard
  • Music production software
  • Studio Mic and accessories
  • Studio Monitors
  • Mobile floating studio booth 
  • Full CD production (10 song minimum), Mastering, CD artwork manufacturing & Packaging of our debut artist
  • Photo Sessions.
  • 6 month marketing campaign (social media and traditional).
  • Choreographer, dancers, vocal coach.
  • Rehearsal space.
  • Major US city tour - Transportation, gas, lodging, meals, band salary, security.
  • Wardrobe / Stylist
  • Tour give-aways.
  • We want to let our contributors know they are special....For your contributions you can receive,
  1. Free downloads of select tracks
  2. Personal shout outs from our artist on any of your social media pages.
  3. T shirts and signed memorabilia. 
  4. Live skype sessions with our artists
  5. Backstage passes to a show of your choice.
  6. One some special contributor can receive our "artist experience".....all cd's, memorabilia and 2 tickets to any performance in your area for a lifetime.
All contributions will go to "ON FUEGO PRODUCTIONS " upcoming projects. Whether we make our complete goal or a fraction of it, we appreciate any help and are dedicated to making this project successful. 

The Impact

We all want to be a part of something special, to leave our mark on the world, to be able to say I helped make that happen. You might say how does my little contribution make a difference....well it absolutely does. They all make a difference. In order to transition from what is being offered to us on the radio to what is being missed by us we need to make a real effort! This kind of project should be important to all of us. Let's take it back to a time when it was important for an artist to know they were role models, respecting the art, themselves and most importantly respecting the fans who deserve clean, courteous, beautiful, talented representation of their favorite music. Let's create artists honestly expressing themselves without shocking or needing to offend. The world needs art that opens the heart and mind. You can be a part of something special & very important to our musical culture! We are not the only ones in this movement.. it is world wide. Make sure you will be able to say "Wow... I actually helped bring back great music!". Here is a link to our sound cloud page. Click on the link then You decide.. real music or not? http://soundcloud.com/onfuegoprod

  • On Fuego has worked with industry heavies like Ron (Amenra) Lawrence of the original Hit men, 

  • Aafrika Bambatta, DJ Red Alert & Red Alert Prod, 

  • Eric (The Funky Technician) Hudson, Curtis Hudson, Mantronix, Fat Back band, 

  • Danny Mercado, Jameriqui, DJ Junior Vasquez, Keith Sweat, Danny LaPorte', Beenie Man & more. 

  • We specialize in R&B, Hip Hop, Pop, Latin, Jazz. 

  • We've also done movie scores (INTERVENTION) & jingles (HONEST AID). our artists have been in movies (THE TESTED) as seen on Netflix, 

  • videos (PAREECE - SHOWMEWATUGOT) and world wide radio from the States to Japan, Australia & The UK. 

  • Pareece's debut CD (Pareece 2021)  a well as Antoine "AY" Young's extended EP (AY)  & Eddie Cabrera The Arrival are available on I-Tunes/ Amazon and other online retail outlets.

We are now blessed with amazing new talent ready to be introduced to the world.   EVIE, the singer songwriter who is primed for success. LIL' BIT, who's (Lauren Hill) urban style will surely catch on fire & VANITY, the female trio who first came to us in their early teens. Real life circumstances had them go there separate ways for a time but they are back and better than ever, ready to share their unique Spanish Influenced sound with the world. That's just the beginning, These new, young, promising artists and our team of consummate professional writers and producers are ready to breath life back into our beloved industry! On Fuego Productions! 

Risks & Challenges

  • Obviously the greatest risk that we take is the unpredictable nature of the listening public. You never actually know what the next big thing is going to be. However there are some proven formulas that have stood the test of time.
  • untapped talent, developed and seasoned.
  • attention to detail.
  • relationships built over 20+ industry years.
  • Marketing & Promotion.
  • And above all else....simply put.....great singers & great songs!  

Other Ways You Can Help

It's important for everyone to know that even if you can't contribute you can still help get the word out. Use the indiegogo share tools. Share our campaign with your friends and family, Co-workers and colleagues. People that you know who love good music.....because that's what it's all about....

THE MUSIC!!!

story:
Short Summary

  • Velvetic is an electronic based experimental musical project created by Kevin Martins in São Paulo, Brazil. He's been doing a lot of free songs under the name 'Kira' which you can check out here: https://www.youtube.com/user/kirahez
  • Misophonia is an experimentation between sound, art, distortion, and love. It's based around a true story, that doesn't have an end. It has 6 songs along with the instrumentals.
  • By contributing to this, you wil help me realize my dream of being a music producer and composer.

What I Need & What You Get

  • I need at least $200 to record vocals and mix the songs, and $100 to pay for the CD pressings (if the campaign fails and someone chooses a perk that has the physical copy included, that person will still receive the CD, but it'll take a little bit longer to deliver it).
  • Depending on your contribution, you can get stuff like: Physical copy of the EP, free digital download of the EP, an exclusive 'contributers' song, a personal e-mail saying thank you, your name of the CD booklet, a song made just for you, and the stems for every song on the EP!
  • If the campaign doesn't reach it's goal, I'm still gonna release the EP on bandcamp.

The Impact

  • I'm trying to give more meaning to life to those who think like me. You are not alone.
  • You can listen to the first and only recorded single here: https://velvetic.bandcamp.com/album/misophonia-...
  • Music has always been the way I express my feelings and thoughts. This is something I never thought could be possible, so I'm hoping you guys can help make it a reality.

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is the shipping of the physical copies.

  • I'm a loyal and patient person, we can discuss everything before I send you the goodies.
  • I already have a plan A and a plan B.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have money? Don't worry, you can share this to people you know, so you can help me realize my goal.

story:
Making the Music

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $30,000 to make this record happen. Even shoestrings are expensive. This money will pay for production, manufacturing, and publicity. There will be some fun perks for you! And if you want something not listed, just let me know. (Within reason.)

You can also contribute any amount, without choosing a perk, by simply using the "Back It" button, above.

If we don't meet the goal, we will keep working until it is finished.

The Impact

Many of you know making music outside the mainstream is always a challenge. I have made five albums that have all been critical successes, but have never hit large sales goals. I want this one to surpass those goals and reach a lot of folks. Now that there is a name for what we do, Americana, things should be easier to market!

If you can't contribute,  that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please help us get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Who We Are

Hi folks! We are a husband/wife team of songwriters and kids performers living in NYC. 

We've been doing music classes for children all around the city for over 7 years and we've amassed quite a collection of original tunes. We're almost done with recording our first full length album, and to get it past the finish line (and onto iTunes and Spotify) we need your help! 

What We Need & What You Get

We've funded the vast majority of recording the album ourselves, but we need about $5,000 more to add the bells and whistles that bring it to a professional level and get it ready for launch. Our producers in Nashville are working on some of these tasks already-

  • additional recording with studio musicians- horns, keys, electric guitar, etc!
  • mixing and mastering
  • album artwork
  • promotion

We've listed a lot of perks that we believe would be genuinely valuable to backers including presales of the album, kids t-shirts, customized videos, and opportunities to be involved or included in the music itself- please reach out to us if you feel there's something we missed!

The Music

We pride ourselves on developing music that young children can really enjoy and participate in, but that won't make their parents' ears bleed. We're picky music snobs ourselves and come from a background of "grown up" music (check us out at www.WalkingforPennies.com) so we've worked hard to balance this recording between rich/complex and catchy/fun. 

The Hustle

Becoming a family of 3 last year was far and away the best thing that has ever happened to us. But having a small child means that there's a lot less money, time, and energy to spend on our own projects and growing our business. We simply can't hustle as hard as we used to. So we're hoping that putting our music further out into the world will allow us to be in more than one place at once, and continue entertaining others while we focus on entertaining our own little one. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, we'd be so grateful if you could help us get the word out about this campaign and promote the songs once they're up and running online. We hope to have them up on all the various streaming platforms by the end of the year, so if you know any fire truck fanatics or little ones who love to dance please share our music with as many of them as you can!

story:
Delicious Food and Goosebumps Music!

My name is William Gets and I have been involved with music my whole life long -  I believe there is nothing more powerful than music terms of representing a country, a culture, bringing people together in joy and just the deepest feelings that a human being can have.

Like any country, South African music is right up there with such beauty it is chilling! But South Africa struggles to be on the global mainstage and I believe that many more people in the world should hear this music.

I am based in the UK at the moment but moving back to South Africa in September 2019. I'm developing the show while here and the plan is to have the show as a feature in South Africa that tourists can come to, to experience the food and music of South Africa in a wonderful two hour show.

So not only will you be helping for this show to be launched, it will over be providing endless joy for tourists and job opportunities for South African musicians, event managers, stage managers and so on.

Dawn Denton, who will be hosting this event with me, is a passionate South African who has been living in the UK for 24 years.  Her event management and marketing knowledge comes from a background in teaching, training, international tour directing and guiding, event organising and running social media for her online retail brands in mostly the USA. She currently hosts an online radio show for Celebrate Southern Africa, focusing on Southern African music, history, culture and stories.  Her love of African music, lead her to explore ways to run and host a South African music show in her home town as part of the Frome Festival, and thus this show was born.

Click to see our website

 

What We Need & What You Get

Enormous resources are needed to design the show and arrange the music. We are charging tickets for the show in the ever popular Frome Festival in the UK, but of course we can't cover all the costs merely from what we take at the door.

We have to cover the venue, decor, instrument/PA hire, sound technicians and commission musicians for the show.  despite the enormous time that musicians have to spend learning the music, practising the music and rehearsing the music, all of them have offered to do it for free. But I don't think that that is fair. I would like to give them something back for their generosity. This show is not intended to make a profit, merely to fund the launch of the show and pay something towards the people who have put so much love and energy into the production.

For the perks, we are offering:

  • Bottles of wine from the Perold Wine Cellar -  the owner of which is the great-grandson of the man who invented the famous Pinotage cultivar in South Africa. Wow! And it is great wine; we have tried it!
  • Business training and ebooks by Dawn A Denton
  • Packs of the most delicious PADKOS brand South African traditional biltong; a great delicacy; we have tried it!
  • The main sponsor receives the  music part of the show performed for them either in their home or at their company
  • The second sponsor will receive a free African drumming team building session from Naturali Catchi Rhythms
  •  A short story anthology by award-winning South African writer, Willem van der Walt
  •  Marketing ROI workshop from Brainstorm Strategic Marketing
  •  Advertising spots on Mix Tape Radio International for six months.
  •  If you are Southern African, an interview opportunity with Celebrate Southern Africa which will be podcasted and available on iTunes, Spotify, RadioPublic and Stitcher
  • Audio and video recordings of the show

The Impact

The goal of this show is to provide a permanent, repeating feature show in the UK and South Africa.

  • In the UK, it is about bringing South African music to the country in a delightful music and food show.
  • In South Africa, it will be for tourists to experience the amazing music and delicious food of South Africa. The show can be put on in Johannesburg, Durban and Cape Town and provide a lot of joy to tourists and a lot of employment opportunities for the musicians, event managers and so on.

This is about bringing the joy of music and food to the world and employment for people.

Risks & Challenges

Overall, we will be taking money at the door. I (William) own and manage an award-winning marketing and advertising company, so me and my team will do our best to fill the seats but even so, the income from the door probably won't cover the expenses of launching an event like this.

Having said that, the show will go on if funds are not brought in through Indiegogo because the people who are involved are passionate about it, and very generous about doing their bit for this show to work. It would however make it a lot less stressful if there are some additional funds to help us pay these additional launch expenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially to the show, we would sincerely appreciate it if you could share this as much as possible with people you know, as well as on social media platforms.  Thank you.

A Thank You to Our Perks Sponsors

A huge thank you to our sponsors who have offered various items to help us raise money for this venture. Here are links to their websites.

  • Perold Wine Cellar for the delicious wines
  • Mix Tape Radio International for the audio call recording of the event and the radio advertising
  • Naturali Catchi Rhythms for the team building drumming session
  • PADKOS for the delicious biltong and Droewors
  • Will van der Walt for the Your Mother Is a Crocodile books
  • Brainstorm Strategic Marketing for the website, marketing ROI workshop and video recording of the event.
  • Dawn Denton for the Facebook and Instagram e-book and the Udemy Facebook course
  • Celebrate Southern Africa for the podcast interview.

Delicious Food and Goosebumps Music!My name is William Gets and I have been involved with music my whole life long -  I believe there is nothing more powerful than music terms of representing a country, a culture, bringing people together in joy and just the deepest feelings that a human being can have.Like any country, South African music is right up there with such beauty it is chilling! But South Africa struggles to be on the global mainstage and I believe that many more people in the world should hear this music.I am based in the UK at the moment but moving back to South Africa in September 2019. I'm developing the show while here and the plan is to have the show as a feature in South Africa that tourists can come to, to experience the food and music of South Africa in a wonderful two hour show.So not only will you be helping for this show to be launched, it will over be providing endless joy for tourists and job opportunities for South African musicians, event managers, stage managers and so on.Dawn Denton, who will be hosting this event with me, is a passionate South African who has been living in the UK for 24 years.  Her event management and marketing knowledge comes from a background in teaching, training, international tour directing and guiding, event organising and running social media for her online retail brands in mostly the USA. She currently hosts an online radio show for Celebrate Southern Africa, focusing on Southern African music, history, culture and stories.  Her love of African music, lead her to explore ways to run and host a South African music show in her home town as part of the Frome Festival, and thus this show was born.Click to see our website What We Need & What You GetEnormous resources are needed to design the show and arrange the music. We are charging tickets for the show in the ever popular Frome Festival in the UK, but of course we can't cover all the costs merely from what we take at the door.We have to cover the venue, decor, instrument/PA hire, sound technicians and commission musicians for the show.  despite the enormous time that musicians have to spend learning the music, practising the music and rehearsing the music, all of them have offered to do it for free. But I don't think that that is fair. I would like to give them something back for their generosity. This show is not intended to make a profit, merely to fund the launch of the show and pay something towards the people who have put so much love and energy into the production.For the perks, we are offering:
Bottles of wine from the Perold Wine Cellar -  the owner of which is the great-grandson of the man who invented the famous Pinotage cultivar in South Africa. Wow! And it is great wine; we have tried it!
Business training and ebooks by Dawn A Denton
Packs of the most delicious PADKOS brand South African traditional biltong; a great delicacy; we have tried it!
The main sponsor receives the  music part of the show performed for them either in their home or at their company
The second sponsor will receive a free African drumming team building session from Naturali Catchi Rhythms
 A short story anthology by award-winning South African writer, Willem van der Walt
 Marketing ROI workshop from Brainstorm Strategic Marketing
 Advertising spots on Mix Tape Radio International for six months.
 If you are Southern African, an interview opportunity with Celebrate Southern Africa which will be podcasted and available on iTunes, Spotify, RadioPublic and Stitcher
Audio and video recordings of the show
The ImpactThe goal of this show is to provide a permanent, repeating feature show in the UK and South Africa.
In the UK, it is about bringing South African music to the country in a delightful music and food show.
In South Africa, it will be for tourists to experience the amazing music and delicious food of South Africa. The show can be put on in Johannesburg, Durban and Cape Town and provide a lot of joy to tourists and a lot of employment opportunities for the musicians, event managers and so on.
This is about bringing the joy of music and food to the world and employment for people.Risks & ChallengesOverall, we will be taking money at the door. I (William) own and manage an award-winning marketing and advertising company, so me and my team will do our best to fill the seats but even so, the income from the door probably won't cover the expenses of launching an event like this.Having said that, the show will go on if funds are not brought in through Indiegogo because the people who are involved are passionate about it, and very generous about doing their bit for this show to work. It would however make it a lot less stressful if there are some additional funds to help us pay these additional launch expenses.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't contribute financially to the show, we would sincerely appreciate it if you could share this as much as possible with people you know, as well as on social media platforms.  Thank you.A Thank You to Our Perks SponsorsA huge thank you to our sponsors who have offered various items to help us raise money for this venture. Here are links to their websites.

Perold Wine Cellar for the delicious wines

Mix Tape Radio International for the audio call recording of the event and the radio advertising

Naturali Catchi Rhythms for the team building drumming session

PADKOS for the delicious biltong and Droewors

Will van der Walt for the Your Mother Is a Crocodile books

Brainstorm Strategic Marketing for the website, marketing ROI workshop and video recording of the event.

Dawn Denton for the Facebook and Instagram e-book and the Udemy Facebook course

Celebrate Southern Africa for the podcast interview.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Gordon Vaughn, and I'm originally from Los Angeles now living in Atlanta Georgia. I grew up in a small suburb of LA called Sylmar, in San Fernando Valley. I was a misunderstood child turned choir geek in High School and started writing my own music with a friend while a senior. I joined a band my 2nd year in college and we named ourselves Cool For August. 2 years later, we were in the middle of a bidding war with 5 major labels wanting to sign us. Our first single hit top 15 on radio before a new CEO was hired at WB Records, & 2/3 of the entire label was fired. Needless to say everything came to a halt for us. I then became a salaried songwriter for Hitco Music @ $30,000 a year for 2 years, and had many song placements on TV shows, sporting events, etc, but not enough to see good residual checks. I've spent the past 10 years working regular jobs & raising 2 beautiful sons, & at the same time spending these last 4 years preparing for this moment to finally do what I was born to do. And the great part is I don't have to rely on big labels and expensive studio recordings. However, I do need money to support what's needed for me to succeed.  I've worked so very hard these past 4 years, sacrificing so much to make this happen. Please help me see this through! I know the results will be monumental!

What we need & what you get

Much of our expenses such as rehearsal studios, equipment, new website design, and close to 1/2 of the album recording has already been completed. I need roughly $30,000 to complete my goals, which include finishing the recording, mixing, and mastering of the album. Your funds will also be used to pay for 50% of our professional video costs, hire a social media marketing expert for 6 months to expand our fan base and visibility, design and purchase our first order of band merchandise, and allow us to lease a touring vehicle with a trailer until we start making money on the road. Our perks will include everything from digital downloads, autographed CD's, band t-shirts, signed handwritten lyric sheets, free guest list attendance to our live shows, backstage passes, personal performances at your home or place of choice, and more! We are seasoned artists, musicians, and performers, so the sky's the limit!!

The Impact

Your contribution will allow us to get the best songs I've ever written, to the public. Your contribution will also allow my band, 1500 Pieces to take our performance to almost every state in the nation, & hopefully to Australia, New Zealand, & Europe! My songs have been featured on MTV, Conan OBrien, Hey Hey It's Saturday, and have been played on multiple radio stations in the US and around the world! I also have contacts with many people in the business, including pros and artists that you've heard of, & they're watching to see how 1500 Pieces puts this together. Your contributions will accomplish more than anyone could possibly imagine! We have a very real shot at the top, and everything that comes with it: TV shows, radio, and tours in the US & abroad! Go to www.1500pieces.com and listen to 3 of the album tracks completed so far. Hopefully they will speak for me, but your donations are the key to their success!  

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge facing 1500 Pieces is whether a group of older guys can succeed in a business that has traditionally been dominated by young artists. My goal is huge. I want to be on stage with The Killers, Portugal The Man, & Daft Punk. I want my songs to be played in heavy rotation on Sirius XM, Spotify & Pandora. I want to have over a million followers on Instagram, and want to write songs for movie soundtracks. My musical desires haven't changed since I was very young. This goal is a longshot for anyone's pursuit, but I know what it's gonna take to accomplish it: I have to keep an open mind, enjoy every moment of the journey, make many friends along the way that share the same vision, seek advice from people in the business that know more than myself, support the people that surround me including the ones that don't support me, and continue to write strong, melodic, hooky, pop sensible songs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to support or donate financially, but there are so many other ways you can show your support! I frequently keep in contact with my friends on fans, and enjoy showing them love when they show their support by getting the word out on our behalf! This includes sharing my posts, suggesting they follow 1500 Pieces on Instagram & Facebook, telling their friends to listen and download our music. Being a success in music today takes the effort of thousands rallying around music and musicians they like and respect. Please listen to my music: www.1500pieces.com. If you believe in the music, let your feelings be known on social media. Your participation, no matter how big or small, will always make a significant impact!!

story:
Groove. Legacy. Impact.

The TOaG Quartet is an Oakland-based assembly of instrumentalists inspired by the many lineages of improvisation and groove. Striving to be honest to who we are, where we have been, and where we hope to go, we pay homage to the work of our elders - who laid the groundwork upon which we stand - while aspiring to spark the mind with truth, and move the spirit with groove. Alongside the tireless service of community music educators, TOaG also works to support arts education by curating jazz clinics for young students, creating a positive space for musical exchange between professionals and pupils.


We produce furious jazz.

Our music, described as "raw but refined," is inspired by the many lineages of improvisation and groove.  Charting a course of all original compositions with dirge-like ballads, greasy grooves, lush soundscapes, sizzling up-tempo swingers, and narrative interludes, our music is a sonic adventure that will take you places. We intend for our music to be a thread in the fabric of creative resistance that both honors and continues the fight for a better world: one that is just, green, safe, and joy-filled for all peoples.  
 

We support music educators.

The TOaG Quartet also supports arts education by curating jazz clinics for young students, which create a positive space for musical exchange between professionals and pupils. In partnership with Oakland High School Music department head David Byrd, we successfully finished our first complete year of the program. The clinics culminated in a 10-hour studio session for the student jazz band at Airship Laboratories, where they recorded a selection of their repertoire for their future use.


We are preparing to launch a live studio album.

Recorded live at the legendary Airship Laboratories with the audience in the studio with us, our upcoming double album is an impassioned follow-up to our first record Grey and Green.  With all the grit and grace of a live show, each tune will play seamlessly from track to track - including two suites that were performed as continuous compositions at the recording session. We are also very proud to have assembled a dream team of local creatives to handle our production needs - with Neil Godbole as recording and mixing engineer, Jessica Thompson as mastering engineer, Nino Fernandez as videographer, and Johnny Jones of COMA as our graphic designer. Our collective souls have been poured into this record - and now we want to share it with the world. 


We are throwing an album release party!

We are gonna kick off the release of this record with a special evening concert in East Bay, CA on July 25th 2019. The show will begin with a opening set by our Oakland High School jazz students, who will be showcasing their own band and music. After a brief intermission, The TOaG Quartet will play two sets of our music, celebrating the album as well as brand new compositions never before heard in public. You don't want to miss this night of entertainment!


But we can't do all this without your support.

We've done so much work to get to this point, but the fact is that the large front end costs of launching a project like ours make it impossible to do on our own. We know we have to invest now in order to secure a sustainable future for our work, but we just don't have the capital to do all the things that are necessary.

Running a successful band means managing a consistent stream of content that can be utilized to market our services for bigger and bigger opportunities. In our case, the success of this record will not only help us elevate our booking capabilities, but will enable us to expand our outreach efforts in support of music education programs that need mentors and supplemental programming. Every single show we play will help us raise funds for our educational partners. That means the more we book, the more we give back. 

Here is what the funds raised will pay for:

  • Mixing the record
  • Mastering the record
  • Manufacturing double CDs
  • Manufacturing double Vinyls
  • Manufacturing T-shirts
  • Manufacturing promotional materials
  • Producing two videos
  • Promoting the record both nationally and internationally
  • Marketing our services to schools and institutions
  • Paying venue booking fees for the release show
  • Renting sound and lighting equipment for the release show
  • Paying our hardworking musicians a living wage for their time


So many ways to say THANK YOU!

We've put together an incredible variety of perks to thank you for your generous donation to our cause, ranging from digital to physical to experiential. While all are designed to please, we did want to highlight a few. 

1. Sponsored OUSD Student Ticket
We know that not everyone is going to be able to make it to our release show. But, that doesn't mean you cant support us AND make a meaningful difference in a young artist's life. I'm sure we can all remember how hard it was to see all the live music we wanted to go to when we were under 18 - not to mention our general lack of funds at that an age. That's why we're offering sponsored tickets to our release show for Oakland student musicians. Not only will they have an opportunity to come see our band put on a kick-ass show at no cost to them, they will also get to see their peers perform in a professional environment. How cool is that?!

2. A Visual Masterpiece
Have you checked out our graphics yet? They are unique visual art, painstakingly crafted by the incredible being that is Johnny Jones. A kind soul with a sharp eye, he is a top-shelf graphic designer with decades in the industry. Thanks to him, the representation of our musical organization in visual form has taken on a life of its own. And we just can't say enough about the album cover art. . . it's stunning. Get the limited edition double vinyl to appreciate his beautiful and incredibly detailed art at it's best, but the digital still and the CD design look freakin' awesome, too.  

3. A Private Concert Exclusive
For our highest giving levels, we will present an entire evening of excitement, entertainment, and groove, tailored to fit your particular taste. This private performance at your home or work will be an up-close and personal experience like no other. You'll have the opportunity to meet members of the band, get a behind the scenes look at our compositions and process, check out our high-end gear, and hear some of our unreleased music! From conception to concert, we'll work with you to make sure your evening with The TOaG Quartet is absolutely extraordinary. 

4. A Hi-Fi Vinyl Record That Sounds Great to Professional Audiophiles
For you audiophiles out there, two industry heavies are absolutely hyped on how good this record is gonna sound: Jessica Thompson and Neil Godbole. Jessica, our mastering engineer, is a top-shelf mastering engineer/audio preservationist who serves as the secretary of the San Francisco Chapter of the Recording Academy, sits on the board of the San Francisco Chapter of the Audio Engineering Society, and teaches a course on the history of music production at SAE/Expression College.  

Neil, our recording and mixing engineer, is the owner of one of the premier studios in Northern California - Airship Laboratories. As a heavy in the industry who consistently works with world class talent, Neil knew what he was getting into this time around - a hard hitting band, feet away from each other, with no isolation, and a live audience. No big deal for a pro like him. From the design of the room through the hand-off to Jessica, Neil has had his hand on every single stem of audio we produced. 


No one is gonna help except you, and us.

Let's be real: it's no easy task to manage a band, fundraise, build curricula, book shows, and development new material - especially in a society that has consistently under-supported art. Whether we are talking about the seemingly endless cutbacks to arts programming in our schools, especially in those that serve our communities of color, or the colossal depression of creative industry wages that has working artists all over the country hustling for "exposure and food" gigs, we've chosen a rather difficult path. Good thing we have great people with us :)
 

Our Team Is Our Strength.

Utilizing our diverse set of skills, backgrounds, and perspectives, we feel confident that we can and will overcome the challenges facing our organization. We will keep producing kick ass music to uplift and excite people, and we will continue to support the work of arts educators, whose positive contributions to humanity's future are immeasurable. 
 

The Network Keeps Us Alive.

As working artists, we know all too well what it means to be in a tight financial spot. But a direct contribution isn't the only way you can help. Spreading our campaign to as many interested people as possible is vital to our success. So if you can take the moment to share our story with your network, please do! And know that we are eternally grateful. May we all rise together :)

story:
Dream Delayed

Have you ever had a dream delayed? Has it ever been for the best of reasons? Rob's daughter Margaux Ivy was born days apart from his last release in September of 2017, and instead of hitting the road in support of the recording, Rob took a break to be with his new baby.  While she is Mary Poppins practically perfect in every way, caring for her slowed down the band's momentum.  Rob and crew are now ready to return to the studio and get back into the fray of making original music full time.

The songs are ready, full of passion and poetry.  The band is tight and ready to go. We have a top notch producer lined up and time booked at one of the finest studios in Nashville Tennessee.  All we need is your support. 

Dream Renewed

Proceeds from this campaign will go towards a day of recording at Sound Emporium Studios and the subsequent costs of mixing and mastering what we lay down.  Our Grammy award winning friends Buckley Miller will be in charge of tracking and Andy Selby will handle the mixing.  The remaining proceeds will go towards making a short run of CDs and merch to share with you, loyal contributors! 

What We Need, The Breakdown

One day of tracking at Sound Emporium: $1850

Mixing and post production on 6 songs: $900

Mastering: $650

Total: $3400

Everything over that will go towards a short CD run and all the goodies you can find below!

What You Get

Anyone who contributes can get their name on our website thank you page (or opt out if you're off the grid...)  We have:

Official Rob Higginbotham Guitar Picks

Pre-release digital downloads

Signed posters

CDs

Digital Companion Liner Notes

Shirts, Sweatshirts, private lessons, a spot in our next music video, an invite to the actual recording (July 13 2019), house concerts and more!

What It Means

We are so grateful to all of you who helped us meet our goal in 2017.  Our first EP recording surpassed all our expectations.  We learned a ton about using a new release to gain exposure and open new markets, and this time around we're going to hit the ground running with your help.  

The songs on this new EP are passionate works from Rob's heart, and need to make it out into the light.  "Margaux" and "Ivy Bee" were both inspired by his little one, and the other songs spin tales and create worlds of beauty and longing.  Help us bring that into the world.

Make It Or Break It

We know there are a million things to invest in, a million causes to get behind.  Why pick this one?

Rob has always been a dreamer.  His goal has never been to make money, but to follow his heart.  His genre defying, exceptionally eclectic songs certainly prove that.  Instead of chasing the dog's tail of the popular to make a buck, Rob finds his muse elsewhere:  in family, the heartache of friends, the longing of the soul, even in a perfect cup of black coffee.  You can help make this dream a reality and bring some heartfelt music into a world that could honestly use some more.

This music resonates with so many that hear it.  Rob and the Mysterious Undertones have been playing out constantly to share these songs with all who will listen.  Help us reach more.

How You Can Help

You can tip the band with $5 and get a thank you, or throw us $1500 and get a free pass to everything we do for the next year and a boatload of perks.  Or if you're as broke as we are, you can:

Share this with your friends and on social media

Follow Rob and company on social media (IG, FB, Twitter)

Subscribe to Rob's Spotify profile and YouTube channel (and play on repeat!)

Thoughts and prayers

 

Thanks for helping dreamers dream...
story_txt:
Dream Delayed
Have you ever had a dream delayed? Has it ever been for the best of reasons? Rob's daughter Margaux Ivy was born days apart from his last release in September of 2017, and instead of hitting the road in support of the recording, Rob took a break to be with his new baby.  While she is Mary Poppins practically perfect in every way, caring for her slowed down the band's momentum.  Rob and crew are now ready to return to the studio and get back into the fray of making original music full time.
The songs are ready, full of passion and poetry.  The band is tight and ready to go. We have a top notch producer lined up and time booked at one of the finest studios in Nashville Tennessee.  All we need is your support. 
Dream Renewed
Proceeds from this campaign will go towards a day of recording at Sound Emporium Studios and the subsequent costs of mixing and mastering what we lay down.  Our Grammy award winning friends Buckley Miller will be in charge of tracking and Andy Selby will handle the mixing.  The remaining proceeds will go towards making a short run of CDs and merch to share with you, loyal contributors! 
What We Need, The Breakdown
One day of tracking at Sound Emporium: $1850
Mixing and post production on 6 songs: $900
Mastering: $650
Total: $3400
Everything over that will go towards a short CD run and all the goodies you can find below!

story:
Greetings!

Hello there! We are a Texas-grown, independent band known as Televangelist. As we started planning the ground work for 2017, we had no idea how many changes and challenges we would face--it's been an exciting time. New members, a bigger show, our first west coast tour, and a new album on the horizon have certainly kept us busy even in the planning stages. 

To keep up with our expanding show, we come to an unavoidable conclusion: WE NEED A VAN. Our first tour effort saw us cramming into Kyle's 2013 Honda Fit. With an extra member and more equipment, this is no longer a possibility. 

This is why we need your help. With the tour right around the corner, we are still around $3750 short of getting a van that meets our requirements. Getting a vehicle like this will help us to tour longer and more often!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to be able to buy a suitable van (enough space, secure, safe) for the tour. We decided that, to keep the price down, we would get a used van. $3750 seemed like enough to do this. If there is ANY excess money, it will go to the following:

  • Stage light
  • Music video efforts
  • Recording our next album

It's important to note that any money we raise with this album will remain with the band; that is to say that whatever YOU help us raise will directly impact what we can do for the upcoming year. We have big plans (international touring, music video series), so getting the van out of the way and paid for will help us reach our more lofty goals.

Risks & Challenges

We realize that this campaign is last minute--truth be told, we weren't really in a position to ask for something like this until this week! This goal is the absolute lowest amount we feel will the tour van expenses. If we do not make this goal, we will still honor any perks that are met. If we exceed our goal, we will publish a statement so that you will know where all the money is going. If our goal is met, expect to see a shiny, new (used) van in a city near you.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be able to personally help with this effort. If you don't have money to spare, please take a second to share our event. We are entirely funded by our fan base, so the more people that includes the more likely we are to be able to keep it going. 

If something about the Indiegogo platform turns you off, a lot of this merch is accessible via our bandcamp wesbite televangelist.bandcamp.com.

 

Thank you so much for your time! We'll see you on the road!!

story:
So here we are..

For three and a half years I have been promoting my own music in Germany. It went so well, that now I have a band to call my own and I am very excited that after years of trying, my music finally sounds like I always knew that it could.

My band and I recorded this EP, with full belief that this is something special. After all, it has been living in my head for years and then it met the right combination of musicians who managed to take it beyond my wildest dreams. 

 



Friends, family and fans have been extremely supportive of us. That, together with passion for the music, is what keeps us all going and knowing that we will be playing on big stages around the world. 

by supporting us, you support our dream, to bring the music that you love, to more people who could love it as well.


You can listen to more of our music on: https://soundcloud.com/noam-b-a

story:
Short Summary

As an artist, AMET Ricky's style captivates all audiences. His lyrical word play is enticing. Inspired by artists such as Lauryn Hill, Roxanne Shante', and Common, he continues to bring a style that is innovative and refreshing to modern hip hop. Along with his musical abilities, Ricky is known for being an advocate for the LGBT community and being an openly transgender rapper. As of now he has been nominated for two awards, one for best Indie Female Hip Hop at the Women In Charge Awards held in Atlanta,GA, and also for the Young Artist Spotlight Award at the SCM Awards held in Memphis, TN. AMET Ricky's creativity leaves listeners wondering if he will take the crown as the true new prince of Hip Hop.

What We Need & What You Get

AMET Ricky has been given an opportunity, thanks to MP3Waxx, to make His-Story as the first transgender male artist to ever take over major radio platforms. Along with this opportunity, all contributions to this campaign will go to the marketing of "LxVE" both on social media and on major platforms.

The Impact

AMET Ricky wants to thank everyone in advance for their support of this campaign. As a young artist, he has faced many challenges both personally and in his career. Being a part of the LGBT as well as the hip-hop community is not ordinary, and he appreciates everyone who is helping him break down the barriers to show that it doesn't matter who you are or how you identify, what matters is the music.

Other Ways You Can Help

Along with donations, you can help this cause by supporting AMET Ricky's music, as well as sharing the campaign with others. Thank you!
