story:
Imagine it’s coming up to midnight on April 19.

You are still up nervously watching election returns when the television talking heads announce Bernie Sanders has won the New York primary.  How would you feel?

It can happen. Sanders trails in the delegate count but is rapidly gaining in the polls. A victory in Hillary Clinton’s adopted “home state” of New York could alter the race for the Democratic nomination like no other single event.  Sanders would become the odds-on favorite in most if not all or the remaining primaries and caucuses while Clinton’ s aura of “inevitability” would be left in tatters.

Between now and then, we can expect corporate media to do everything it can to prop up Clinton and ignore or mischaracterize Sanders and the increasingly broad and diverse movement that supports him.

But we don’t have to leave it there. Independent media can tell another story. To do that, The Indypendent and The Occupied Wall Street Journal editorial group are teaming up to produce and distribute 500,000 copies of a special edition just for this moment.

Titled The Battle of New York, this special edition will appear in an extra-large, four-page broadsheet format. It will provide information and analysis from prominent voices with compelling, original art and photography. And a proven design team. It will provide a practical, compelling and interactive means of demonstrating the surge of support especially among those under 40. It will include a diversity of voices, speaking to the communities not represented by the Democratic Party establishment. Optimistic, determined, visionary, of our time.

The Battle of New York will be distributed during the week before the New York primary. We expect it to have a catalytic effect, amplifying and projecting a movement in motion. We will build on that by making the release of the special issue a news story in itself. It will give tangible (attractive) form to the popular surge needed to push Sanders over the top in New York.

We will print the special edition in both English and Spanish and mobilize volunteers to distribute the paper throughout New York City, with priority for statewide distribution to SUNY and CUNY campuses. We will also have articles translated into other languages to be made available online.  The editorial group is formed. The designers and artists have already begun their work. Production will begin April 7, when we are sure we can take this to print.

For $20,000 we can print 100,000 copies of The Battle for New York and for each additional $15,000 we can print another 100,000 copies. We can do this but only with your help. Please give right now and help us make The Battle of New York one for the ages.

In Solidarity,

The Indypendent & The Occupied Wall Street Journal editorial group

P.S. For a sample of what an extra-large four-page broadsheet can look like, click here.

P.P.S. From the aftermath of 9/11 to the 2004 Republican National Convention to Occupy Wall Street to the 2014 People’s Climate March, The Indypendent has been able to provide an enhanced megaphone during moments when people’s movements are surging. For more highlights, click here.

story:
In a fully-staged, memorized production called "graceful" and "haunting," Ensemble Vocatrix brings Hildegard von Bingen's masterpiece Ordo Virtutum to life. Now the group is traveling to Berkeley to perform on June 6th at the 2016 Berkeley Festival and Exhibition, and they need your help! 

Ensemble Vocatrix has successfully earned most of the funding for this tour through a performance that was featured in the LA Times and sponsored by USC Caruoso Catholic Center. Now is your chance to help raise the rest!

This 14-day flash fundraiser will cover the remaining expenses of the tour to Berkeley, a venture which enables the group to partake in one of North America's biggest early music festivals.

Indiegogo donations are not tax-deductible. To make a tax-deductible donation, please visit our sponsored project on Fractured Atlas.

story:
I'm a singer, songwriter and storyteller based in Brighton, United Kingdom. I've been writing and gigging, locally and nationally, for six years now, and have made two albums with the Bandana Collective.

For much of that time, I've also had a load of ideas growing for a solo album: songs with a feel of their own that was distinct from the band. Over the last two years I've built this into a strong, solid set of songs - drawing on personal, political and historical subjects, and on the indie rock, folk and country sounds I've loved since I was young. And now I've made the album!

You can hear some tracks by clicking the video above. It's nearly all recorded - all I need to do now is raise money for CDs!

Pre-order to help me print it!

The £500 target is the minimum allowed on the site - if we don't quite get there, I'll still be able to afford some CDs.

HOWEVER - this album is a real personal achievement, and I want the finished article to feel like a great package to be proud of. So it would be great to afford a high standard of replication and a really appealing cardboard gatefold sleeve; and what's more, the higher-quality packages are only available in larger quantities. So if we CAN get to £500, that means I can both print more CDs, and give them the professional, satisfying package that I'd like!

However much we raise, it'll just be great to have CD versions of the album available, as well as downloads. I know it's the digital age - but I'd love to have  some CDs as an artefact of what I've made; and they're also great to offer people as a memento of a good gig. So any money you chip in will be gratefully received for printing/manufacturing costs!

Pre-order the album now, and we're on our way! Look at the tempting perks in the sidebar... these include FREE BONUS TRACKS recorded during sessions for the album, that won't be released in any other form for a long time yet; and also the offer of a gig for you, in your part of the country!

Any donation is appreciated, though; and even if you can't contribute, please share this with other people - I'd be really chuffed for any assistance getting the word out. There are tools on this site, and you can use the film above! I feel like I've really said something open and honest and from myself on this album; and I'd love to get it out in the world how I'd always hoped.

Thanks loads guys! Hope you like the album!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section

  • This campaign is not only to restore and upgrade a store but to help create a new landmark for traveler's through the Black Rock Desert and people attending Burning Man. The town of Empire, Nevada literally closed it's gates over 6 years ago leaving the Empire Distributing Store alone on the Interstate Route 447. This is the only  grocery store/gas station for over 70 miles serving the entire mystical Black Rock Desert. There are over 700,000 traveler's that pass the store each year but sadly the times have left this little store behind.  Lack of parking during Burning Man event has made it difficult for the store to prosper from the event and lack of resources makes this store struggle without many services that would benefit many travelers as well as the people of the community. I feel like this store should be a landmark to traveler's and artist. It is important to me to help clean up the area.
  • Your contribution to this campaign will literally change peoples lives and help improve the safety of many traveler's.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We desperately need more resources out her in the rugged desert, all money goes to purchasing materials and labor to restore the store, gas station and the property. We plan on landscaping, creating two more parking lots to help with traffic during Burning Man, offering more health products to the store, adding showers, public restrooms, laundry facility, pet walking area, outside patio, new roofs, art displays, exterior fencing, complete painting, and remodeling basement of the store in to a speak easy.
  •  We have very unique perks for traveler's through the Black Rock Desert and people who attend Burning Man that you will instantly identify with and recognize the need for this to happen.
  • All funds go towards restoring the property and creating the new Black Rock Market.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  •  This project will literally be noticed by almost one million people a year and help hundreds of people that live year round in the surrounding area.
  • The Black Rock Market is being designed as a landmark location for traveler's to get better services and supplies.
  • The Black Rock Market is a proud supporter of Burning Man including allowing artist to display art at the store. 

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • The hurdles are that we are in a very impoverished area in which many locals do not have a lot of resources to invest, but I am hoping that people will instantly relate to this and help make this dream a reality.
  • I am asking people to help share this on the social networks with your friends so we can have this work done before Burning Man 2016!

Other Ways You Can Help

        If you cannot contribute please help share this with people that attend music & art festivals that might attend Burning Man, the Black Rock Desert or Five Springs Ranch. If you know anyone that can help please forward this to them and may the force be with you.
      • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends!
story_txt:
Short Summary Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section

This campaign is not only to restore and upgrade a store but to help create a new landmark for traveler's through the Black Rock Desert and people attending Burning Man. The town of Empire, Nevada literally closed it's gates over 6 years ago leaving the Empire Distributing Store alone on the Interstate Route 447. This is the only  grocery store/gas station for over 70 miles serving the entire mystical Black Rock Desert. There are over 700,000 traveler's that pass the store each year but sadly the times have left this little store behind.  Lack of parking during Burning Man event has made it difficult for the store to prosper from the event and lack of resources makes this store struggle without many services that would benefit many travelers as well as the people of the community. I feel like this store should be a landmark to traveler's and artist. It is important to me to help clean up the area. Your contribution to this campaign will literally change peoples lives and help improve the safety of many traveler's.
   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  We desperately need more resources out her in the rugged desert, all money goes to purchasing materials and labor to restore the store, gas station and the property. We plan on landscaping, creating two more parking lots to help with traffic during Burning Man, offering more health products to the store, adding showers, public restrooms, laundry facility, pet walking area, outside patio, new roofs, art displays, exterior fencing, complete painting, and remodeling basement of the store in to a speak easy.  We have very unique perks for traveler's through the Black Rock Desert and people who attend Burning Man that you will instantly identify with and recognize the need for this to happen. All funds go towards restoring the property and creating the new Black Rock Market.    The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:   This project will literally be noticed by almost one million people a year and help hundreds of people that live year round in the surrounding area.
The Black Rock Market is being designed as a landmark location for traveler's to get better services and supplies.
The Black Rock Market is a proud supporter of Burning Man including allowing artist to display art at the store.     Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.  The hurdles are that we are in a very impoverished area in which many locals do not have a lot of resources to invest, but I am hoping that people will instantly relate to this and help make this dream a reality. I am asking people to help share this on the social networks with your friends so we can have this work done before Burning Man 2016!    Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot contribute please help share this with people that attend music & art festivals that might attend Burning Man, the Black Rock Desert or Five Springs Ranch. If you know anyone that can help please forward this to them and may the force be with you.Please use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends!

story:
Hello World, Friends and Neighbors. 

First with the personal: I've been painstakingly working on a collection of songs for my solo debut album. After many years of being in bands, I went solo. It's been humbling to realize how much I achieved in the past because of working WITH great bandmates and musicians, and how much slower I am on my own. However, playing tons of solo gigs and leading a band myself has been an interesting and expansive experience and I am a stronger artist because of my successes and failures. The songs on this album are about my journeys through all kinds of love and loss, exaltations and breakdowns. 

Artistic: These songs are influenced by emotion more than the need to satisfy and please a base. I started writing on piano and Viola and that has really transformed my writing.  

Social: Rarely, but thankfully often enough, I get a glimpse of what the music I make can do for other people. Folks say they sing their asses off to my previous albums, or that knowing I'm out there chugging along through the difficult helps them keep going too. We need each other! 

Thanks for considering helping with my project. Making music is a huge part of my identity, as is being part of a community. 

PS- Stuff can be signed if you specify! Also my photo by Brad Emmons 

Risks and challenges

Raising funds is a huge challenge and I have a budget for an extremely lo fi version of the record if crowd funding doesn't work. 
Sometimes I get panic attacks too and that slows me down. If that happens, I'll do some deep breathing.

story:
Hi, I'm Eddie James!

Well... It's really kind of simple, I have to sing! A singer's got to sing just like a dancer's got to dance. And, there's no denying where it started.

Somehow I got this gift and so, I have to share it. I mean, what good does it do if I only sing to myself in the shower every day?!            

Although enjoyable and sexy, not very profitable unless I get a microphone, operating board & sound engineer in there, and well, that might be tricky.

I've worked in the theatre (Broadway, off-Broadway, regional), film & TV all of my adult life. I have had relative success and yes ~ you guessed it,  that's all I know how to do. Like so many of us in the arts it's not always easy to make a decent living. The good news is, I'm not a quitter, I work hard and I know how to make things happen.

Here's the crux of the whole deal!

I want to share my music and tell my story!

So, I'm recording an album! I'm putting together a compilation of 10 songs that tell my story of courage and tenderness. Forgive me if I'm cliché but, I find those two words to be paradoxically exciting and absolutely, undeniably descriptive of who I am.

In addition to the album, I am filming one of the songs as a short musical film. The award winning Director of Photography & Editor, Chuck Coleman  http://www.peripheralvistas.com/ and I will enter it into film festivals all over the world.

Here's What I Need  ~ The down & dirty:

    I'm looking to raise $35,000.00 to make this album and short musical film.

    I'll be recording in a beautiful boutique LA studio with

    Music Producer Patrick Avalon ,

    And,
    Carnegie Hall's solo pianist Richard Steinbach  http://epresskitz.com/index.php?u=2971  will  be accompanying me.

    The magic of Maestro Steinbach's talent is truly mesmerizing.

    AND, if that's not enough

    Additional Orchestrations and vocals by

    New York talents ~ Louis Tucci and Nancy Slusser.

    So...

    Ever wondered how one becomes a "Producer"? Well, one of the simplest ways is by helping fund a project.

    Poof!

    You're a Producer.

    And, the best part...

    I will do all the work!

    Have you ever wanted to see or imagined your name coming up on the credits at the beginning of a film or on an album? Imagine... Eddie James "A voice of courage and tenderness" produced by Your name here !

    What's The Impact? Well... that's a biggie!

    I want to sing about courage, tenderness and what it means to be kind.

    AND... Imagine the day you hear one of my songs on the radio. You can say...
    "I helped produce that album."

    Make it real my friends and create this with me. Help me and my whole team live this reality

    because, here's the truth about me:

    I'm unstoppable, however the "BIZ" is tough. Who doesn't know that. I just moved to LA from NYC to bump up my career a notch.  It was years ago when I came to know the phrase
    "why not me?" What makes my desire to be successful in this business any less attainable than that of Frank Sinatra, Michael Buble' or John Legend?  Even Barbra Streisand!?  Nothin!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't help monetarily, I understand, there are other ways to help;

    Share this campaign with your friends and family. Pass it forward, please.

    Help me create a positive and successful energy around this project with lots of light, love and generosity. That's how this will happen!

    • PLEASE, use all of  the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Any and all donations are welcome and humbly accepted. No gift is too small!

      Every penny I raise will go toward this project whether I meet my goal or not and everything is tax deductible for you.

    • Simply click on the "BACK IT" button at the top right of my campaign,
      Thank you!

    That's my story and I'm stickin to it!

story:
We would like to take this opportunity to invite you all to join us on our exciting journey into the awesome world of the Recording Studio where 10% is inspiration and 90% is perspiration! But where every step is a dance and every word is a song. It's gonna be a roller-coaster ride so please stay tuned.

As they say, music is the language of the soul. We believe, in this age of information technology it's important for singers, musicians, and performing artists to spread love, peace, spiritual understanding, and brother and sisterhood, through the medium of the oldest and most beautiful of languages, Sweet music!

We can't even begin to express in words what your kind contributions will mean to our Band, but suffice it to say, it will be the greatest of gifts, because you'll be helping us to do what we love and breathe for everyday - Sweet Music!

The band members of 'Babaji' are a beautiful mix of sugar n spice and all things nice. We are British-African, British-Jamaican, Polish, Russian, Lithuanian, Filipino, Finnish. Our lead singer and song writer Hari is the heart of our band. He has released a couple of solo albums previously, which you can get as part of your perks and hear for yourself what a gem his voice is. 

Every contribution will go into producing the tracks and releasing them as a Digital EP. 

The overall costs are:

  • Recording, editing and production of 4 tracks - studio hire, engineer & producer - £4000
  • Mixing and mastering - £1500
  • Marketing - 500 
  • Indiegogo admin fees - £500 

TOTAL: £6500   

If you can't contribute money please contribute your time by making some noise and spreading the word to friends and family.

Thank you all in advance for your support.

'Babaji'

story:
This next chapter, Brazil, will be our 4th season, documenting the stories of local musicians, seeking to reveal a musical thread with common roots of African rhythm and musical language.  

In our three years thus far, we have worked with over 250 musicians and 175 supporters who have helped create a new platform for music in New York, New Orleans, San Juan and Havana — coastal cities that have been cross sections of culture, trade and the evolution of sound over the past several hundred years.

"Trade Winds is different. There is a genuine conversation going on in realtime unfolding in realtime and alive with the spirit of exploration." -NPR, Tom Moon

"Once completed this is likely to be the most ambitious musical project of its kind to be undertaken by three itinerant artists."-Latin Jazz Network, Raul da Gama

In Brazil, Trade Winds will create a brand new body of work in one of the most important global music cultures along the former trade routes.

The public will be able to follow the adventure through 21 videos in 21 days, featuring a new improvised song by a diverse group of up and coming and established artists/musicians on the music scene. The only two rules for each session: Don't talk. Just play.

The music series will also be captured in a double CD recording and coffee table book featuring the sounds and visuals of the journey through Brazil.  Our most recent versions of those rewards can be seen below from the latest project destination in Cuba.

 

Trade Winds Cuba Album

Matt and Zé on the front cover of the Trade Winds Cuba Photo Book.

Explore all the Trade Winds videos from New York, New Orleans, San Juan and Havana here >>

story:
After months of work and creativity, we list the pre-production of an album that I want to share with everyone so as has already been the first single "Awake" ... but for that to happen we must be able to mix, master, and publish, and that is why we need your support at this stage.

I'm Silvana Romero, a singer who after years of flirting with the music today is committed 100% to follow this dream because I think we all deserve what we dream, and that's why I played it and leave aside all performing before into music because it is what excites me and was perhaps the fear that held me, but no more.

I need your support to record, mastering, mixing and also to promote and publish this album, which in its creation stage already completed.
Today having a disc is work that is achieved with the help of family, friends, acquaintances and also the fans, and that's something that makes changing the music industry is seen as a team, achieving music is the achievement of all.

What we need and what you get:

Need to finance the recording studio, mixing, mastering, publishing and promotion.
 
You'll have to help your disk rewards as physical, digital and autagrafo disk.

Thank you very much and blessings

Sil Romero

story:
Short Summary/Resumen


  • Felipe and David have been making music together for over ten years. Now, with the help of Juan, we have composed a series of songs inspired in our connectivity with different cultures, distinct natural and urban settings, and our personal creative spirits.
  •  Felipe y David han hecho música durante mas de diez años. Ahora, con la ayuda de Juan, hemos hecho una serie de canciones inspiradas en nuestra esencia multi-cultural, nuestro espíritu creador y distintos paisajes naturales y urbanos.
  • This is our third and most ambitious project of our discography. Our last two records have been home-made, but we´ve now had the opportunity to record in one of Colombia´s legendary studios (Audiovision) and with one of the country´s most talented producers.
  • Este es nuestro tercer y más elaborado trabajo. Nuestras dos últimas producciones fueron hechas en casa, ahora tuvimos la oportunidad de grabar en los estudios de Audiovisión en Bogotá con uno de los ingenieros más talentosos y con mayor proyección del país.
  •  We will present our new material in our debut concert in alliance with  Teatro Mayor Julio Mario Santo Domingo on August 25th. Your contributions will help us construct the stage props and finish producing the album.
  • Estaremos presentando el nuevo material en nuestro concierto debut en alianza con el Teatro Mayor Julio Mario Santo Domingo el 25 de agosto. Su contribución nos ayudará a construir la escenografía y el disco que lanzaremos esa noche.

What We Need & What You Get/Lo Que Necesitamos y Lo Que Obtienes

  • We need to collect $3,500 in total. The whole mix and master process will cost us $2,000. We will use $1,000 to print our CD´s, and the remaining $500 for the stage props.
  • Queremos recaudar $3,500 (US) en total. El proceso de mezcla y masterización cuesta  $2,000 (US). Usaremos $1,000 (US) para la impresión de los discos y los $500 (US) restantes serán destinados a la planeación y ejecución de la escenografía que hará parte del concierto de lanzamiento.
  • We have a lot of art to share and for you to enjoy! By contributing to our cause, you are elegible to receive: a hand-made card, our newest CD, an exciting poster, or your very own paper mache Recycled Pet.
  • ¡Tenemos mucho arte que queremos compartir con ustedes! Cuando contribuyan a nuestra causa, podrán llevarse una hermosa tarjeta hecha a mano, nuestro nuevo álbum, un fascinante afiche de la artista PuroAmor y/o tu propio muñeco de Mascotas Recicladas.

The Impact/El Impacto 

  • We believe in the power of art to express our individual and collective freedoms. We make music in order to heal and project our conscious and unconscious desires of a better human experience; one with a higher connectivity to life and our natural settings.  
  • Creemos en el poder que tiene el arte para construir la anhelada paz y expresar nuestra libertad individual y colectiva. Creamos música para sanarnos y proyectar nuestros deseos de una experiencia humana más armónica: una que expresa alta conectividad, conciencia de nuestro entorno y el mundo natural.
  • Our paper mache animals are an expression of our dreamscape, of our ability as creators to give life to the world and the distinct manifestations of consciousness that inhabit it. With these animals we give homage to the creatures that inspire and teach us about existence.
  • Los animales hechos de papel maché son una expresión de nuestro mundo fantástico, de nuestra habilidad como creadores para dar vida a un universo lleno de magia. Con estos animales queremos hacer homenaje a las criaturas que nos inspiran y nos enseñan a vivir en este planeta.

Challenges

  • It is a race against the clock! The artists and the recordings are ready but we need your support to finish the post-production process and make our album launch an unforgettable experience! We only have until August to finish our campaign!
  • ¡ Es una carrera a contrarreloj !  Los artistas y sus obras están listos pero necesitamos su apoyo oportuno para que el lanzamiento del tercer álbum de Pet Recycle el próximo 25 de Agosto sea una experiencia única y que los amantes de la música puedan disfrutar de un disco de excelente calidad. 

Other Ways You Can Help/Otras Formas de Ayudar

  • Share our music and campaign with others! Go to our gigs and visit our website!
  • ¡Compartan nuestra música y nuestra campaña con otras personas!
    Vayan a nuestros recitales y visiten nuestras redes sociales.

Creemos en el poder que tiene el arte para construir la anhelada paz y expresar nuestra libertad individual y colectiva. Creamos música para sanarnos y proyectar nuestros deseos de una experiencia humana más armónica: una que expresa alta conectividad, conciencia de nuestro entorno y el mundo natural.
Our paper mache animals are an expression of our dreamscape, of our ability as creators to give life to the world and the distinct manifestations of consciousness that inhabit it. With these animals we give homage to the creatures that inspire and teach us about existence.
Los animales hechos de papel maché son una expresión de nuestro mundo fantástico, de nuestra habilidad como creadores para dar vida a un universo lleno de magia. Con estos animales queremos hacer homenaje a las criaturas que nos inspiran y nos enseñan a vivir en este planeta.    Challenges

It is a race against the clock! The artists and the recordings are ready but we need your support to finish the post-production process and make our album launch an unforgettable experience! We only have until August to finish our campaign!
¡ Es una carrera a contrarreloj !  Los artistas y sus obras están listos pero necesitamos su apoyo oportuno para que el lanzamiento del tercer álbum de Pet Recycle el próximo 25 de Agosto sea una experiencia única y que los amantes de la música puedan disfrutar de un disco de excelente calidad. 
   Other Ways You Can Help/Otras Formas de Ayudar  Share our music and campaign with others! Go to our gigs and visit our website! ¡Compartan nuestra música y nuestra campaña con otras personas!Vayan a nuestros recitales y visiten nuestras redes sociales.

story:
About The Liberation Music Collective

The Liberation Music Collective is a contemporary jazz ensemble dedicated to performing original compositions about social issues. The Liberation Music Collective brings a 21st-century approach to the tradition of protest music in jazz. In the words of jazz critic Neil Tesser, The Liberation Music Collective is an energetic group "conceived in the blazing crucible of political awakening." At the Collective, we believe that art should reflect life, and our work seeks to illustrate important cultural conversations with thought-provoking musical narrative. ​

Get to know the musicians in the Collective in the "Gallery" tab or through our website.

About Rebel Portraiture

Each song on Rebel Portraiture is dedicated to someone who lost their life because of who they were or what they believed in. However, this music is not a meditation on death (how dull!) These songs are illustrations of character—of decision, belief, and risk, filling a person’s life with enough power that someone seeks to extinguish it. 

In that sense, Rebel Portraiture is an art gallery of martyrs. But there is another way to see it. The people we have chosen to depict – Giles Corey, students at Kent State, Noxolo Nogwaza, Berta Cáceres, journalists in the Middle East—were targeted. They were singled out to be silenced. But we refuse to accept that. We believe that you can bury a body, but you cannot bury a life. We hope our music stirs ripples of remembrance and helps assure that these people are not forgotten. That their messages echo for generations to come. That all who listen hear our message: you cannot prevail when you silence through violence and intimidation. In this way, the portraiture itself becomes an act of rebellion.

Portraits of rebels, rebellion through portraiture—whichever interpretation you choose, we hope that this music offers you courage. Rebel Portraiture is a tribute to those who went before us on the frontlines. They have yet to be forgotten, affirming their lives (and ours) as a worthy cause.

Musicians: Jess Henry, Matt Riggen, Wayne Wallace, Miró Sobrer, Brennan Johns, Ana Nelson, Sean Imboden, Alex Dura, Ellie Pruneau, Kyle Schardt, Hannah Fidler, Hannah Johnson

Production: Hannah Fidler, Matt Riggen, Wayne Wallace, Jake Belser (recording & mixing), Kabir Sehgal (mastering & liner notes)

The Impact of Your Support

Whenever the LMC goes into the studio, we believe it is imperative to pay all the musicians, engineers, and producers the professional wages they deserve for all their hard work. As you can imagine, with a big band, this adds up to a lot of money! As of right now, we have most of the funding we need Rebel Portraiture. However, there are some expenses that are still out of our reach. And that’s where we could use your help. 

For our first album (Siglo XXI) we were able to hire a print and radio agent, all because of grants and contributions from people like you. Those two amazing agents got the record played on hundreds of stations worldwide, and got the word out to reporters that the music was worth writing about. Our goal is to be able to do this for Rebel Portraiture too.

This music makes more of a difference if people around the world actually listen to it and are galvanized by it. The two women we want to hire as our print and radio agents know this. They believe in our message and believe in the power of art. We all want it to be heard for the same reason--at its core, this is social music. 

And that’s where you come in.

To raise the money, we’re selling the record in advance, and we’re using a “name your own price” model. No matter how much you donate, you will receive a copy of the album. We’re willing to accept whatever that might be worth to you. But if you can give a little extra, you’re not only paying for yourself to hear the album--you’re also helping other people around the world hear it.

How to Learn More

Learn more about the "rebels" of Rebel Portraiture in the "Gallery" tab or our website. 

Stay in the loop about Rebel Portraiture through The Liberation Music Collective's website, Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, and Instagram.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Namah: Salutations to Greatness

NAMAH, is a salutation to the legends who walked further than us and created the way and path for us to explore further into the different realms of music. We are  completing the entire production in a few days.  Legendary stalwarts have been approached for the same, where each video will feature a legend from the industry.  We have just released a teaser featuring our first collaboration Neeladri Kumar and the second one featuring the legendary Padmashri Ustad Rashid Khan and the latest one with Pandit Viswa Mohan Bhatt creating magic on Mohan Veena. With an affirmative nod from legends around the world the album has truly become International . The other sensational collaborations will be announced as we go forward .

story:
A bit about me... 

My name is Eric Bro but if you're reading this, that much you already know. I could give you a list of facts like, where am I from? (NH) Am I married? (Yes, to my best friend) How many kids do I have, if any? (3 ridiculously amazing daughters) Do I have any Pets? (Be honest, you really don't care about this one.) and so on. But, just give me a handful of paragraphs worth of reading and you will know the heart behind the artist and all that I am trying to accomplish.

People are hurting. Drug abuse, mental illness, poverty, racism, homelessness, battered women and children; the list goes on and on. My desire and goal as a musician has always been to speak hope into peoples lives. I write and play to remind the listener that hopelessness is a lie. I write music that comes straight off the pages of my life or those close to me. Like so many, I have been hurt and I have hurt others. I have faced my demons head on and I have hid in the corner afraid to face the world. We all laugh... we all cry. I capture those moments in song.

I've been writing those songs for a very long time but it was only a few short years ago that I began playing them out at shows. I quickly found out that what I had been doing in the quiet of my own home was reaching people. What I thought was meant only for me resonated with others and I realized that I enjoyed reaching them. After two years of playing anywhere and everywhere I could, I am ready to record my first EP.

A bit about this campaign...

Simply put, I am asking you for help in raising the funds to do it. Making music in my living room is cheap. Having it done correctly in studio with professionals and the end product being radio ready is very costly. I need your help. If you are family or a friend, I am really counting on you. You will be the backbone of this campaign. This will be our journey together and you will be with me through the entire process. If you don't know me, I am so glad you are reading this. I need your support just as much and want you in on the journey with us. I can't overstate the gratitude I have for any and all support.   

I will be working with Nashville Recording Artist and Producer Jonas Woods (jonaswoods.net) and his team of merry men and women. Jonas has worked with some of the best and I am very excited to work with him. As a matter of fact, thanks to his generosity, you can too. See the PERKS section of this campaign. Jonas is offering a couple SKYPE songwriting sessions. If you are a songwriter, this is a great opportunity to build your writing skills and help yours truly at the same time. There are only two (2) so claim them quick. Be sure to check out all the perks! It's my way of saying thank you.

How the funds will be used?

  • Songwriting time with Jonas and others
  • Recording vocals/guitar 
  • Studio time
  • Audio engineer/mixing
  • Additional musicians
  • Producer
  • Mastering
  • Artwork design and layout
  • EP Promotion
  • Travel expenses

If I don't reach my goal (I know you wont let that happen), I will begin the process and complete as many songs as I can and I will continue as more funds are raised. This project will be completed.

It's more than music to me...

Though making music at this level is most certainly a dream of mine, that dream is not the driving force behind what I am doing. I believe in the power of music and I believe I can reach people through it. I have a heart to share what has been done in my life. I once was lost but not anymore. I have been found and I can't help but sing about it. The rest is the proverbial icing on the cake. I like icing.

Other Ways You Can Help

There have been times I have given to campaigns like this and times when I just couldn't do it financially. If you've read this far, I thank you tremendously. If you are not in a position to give then you can still help!! Whether you give or not, will you please help me get the word out. Make some noise for me. Let others know who I am and what I am trying to do. There are social media share links located on this page. Share on Facebook. Share on Twitter. Share on any and every social media site you use. Believe me, it will make a difference.

I can't wait to put my CD in your hands. You could even be listed on the inside liner. (see perks)

Please like and follow me on Facebook. Find me at ericbromusic.

THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH,

Eric

story:
Since the start of this decade, Gatas y Vatas has been bringing original, solo music written and performed by women, transgender and nonbinary performers to stages in New Mexico. The initial goal of Gatas y Vatas: To find women who made art and music and ask them to bring something to the stage alone, entirely in control of the presentation of themselves and their ideas.

But we're shaking things up this year and welcoming some collaborations. Our intersectional group of organizers also invites participants to consider linking performance and protest—aimed at anything.

Gatas y Vatas 2017 will happen over three days in Albuquerque (at Fusion Forum) and Santa Fe (at Ghost warehouse). Video and installation artists will exhibit their work at the festival, along with visual artists, and crafters and makers of wearable art. Community organizations will table the event. People from all over New Mexico and elsewhere in the country will take the stage. In the weeks leading up to the event, we're also hosting all kinds of showcases.

Over time, the fest itself has become generative. Audience members one year often become participants the next. And performers work for months building into a dream or a distant vision of what a set could be like. Fest veterans know that part of it is pushing yourself a little further outside your comfort zone at every Gatas y Vatas.  

It’s a huge party. Anything goes, and anything can happen.

The fest aims to close the on-stage gender gap by making space for new people to climb into the spotlight. We’ve seen Gatas y Vatas give rise to many new performers who went on to continue playing year-round, booking shows, starting bands and going on tour.

GyV has also sparked a series of compilation albums, companion zines, art shows, benefit parties and workshops. 

The people who organize the festival are volunteers, and all funding goes toward basics like venue fees, materials for merchandise (handmade by us!), and paying performers.

story:
The Spy Boys and I have been playing together for almost 6 years at various venues and festivals around Centre County, PA.

We put modern twists on old jazz & blues tunes, with a little swing & Tom Waits thrown in for good measure.

The Spy Boys are: John "JT" Thompson on keys and melodica, Doug McMinn on sax & clarinet, Stubby Stubbs on drums, Robert Gardner on upright & electric bass and, of course, myself - Natascha Hoffmeyer on the mic :-)

We have recently worked up six originals that we are hoping to record at the Penn State Music School in early August, along with 3-4 of our favorite cover songs. The CD will be titled "...that's the hardest part."

As you may know, working musicians don't make a lot of money, and so we are asking you for your support to help make this happen.

We will need to cover recording & mastering costs, as well as printing a goodly number of CDs for your listening pleasure :-)

Take a look at the various support options & pick your favorite perk.

Every little bit helps for sure -- even if you can't contribute yourself, please spread the word & share our campaign with your friends! We can't wait to present the fruits of our work with you when we are done!!!

Thanks as always for your support of Natascha & The Spy Boys :-)

story:
TBLMKR es el nombre artístico de Alex Rodríguez, un chavo de 18 años que hace música desde su casa en Monterrey, Nuevo León, y es apoyado desde Miami por Frank “El Médico” Rodríguez (aunque no son familia), el mastermind detrás de La Clínica Records, una disquera digital independiente que se enfoca en apoyar y proyectar artistas de la música under latinoamericana, y todos los géneros derivados del BASS.

TBLMKR is Alex Rodríguez’s artistic name, an 18 year old kid who makes music straight from his room in Monterrey, México, and is also supported by Frank “El Médico” (The Doctor) Rodríguez (even though they’re not family), who is the mastermind behind La Clínica Records, an independent label kicking the game in Latin American’s BASS music.

Que lo bailen fue una creación de TBLMKR, junto al mix y masterización de Frank El Médico, y desde su publicación en la cuenta de Soundcloud de La Clínica Records en diciembre de 2016, ha recolectado más de 12,000 reproducciones, más de 700 likes y 200 compartidos.

Nada mal para un chavito que salió de la nada y nació en 1999, ¿no?

Que lo bailen’s birth was a joint process between Alex’s creation and Frank’s mix and master. Since its launch through La Clínica’s Soundcloud account, the track has gained more than 12,000 plays, around 700 likes, and 200 shares.

Not so bad for a kid who came out of nowhere and was born in 1999, right?

  1. ¡TBLMKR podría ganar un Grammy! Bueno, por asociación. Frank El Médico Rodríguez fue nominado a los Grammy y Grammy Latinos por su trabajo como ingeniero de sonido en el disco “El Cartel: The Big Boss” de Daddy Yankee. Frank también confía en el talento de TBLMKR y mixeó y remasterizó su EP, así que al apoyar esta campaña podrías ser parte del futuro de un próximo gran artista.
  2. La alianza entre TBLMKR, La Clínica Records y nuestra casa productora Cocula Films es un trabajo en conjunto donde todos estamos aportando de nuestras ganas, tiempo y esfuerzo para crear un producto donde no estamos ganando un solo peso, pero sí ganamos en proyectar el talento local con el buen trabajo que merece. La idea es que esta alianza no solo se quede aquí, sino que gracias a este proyecto contemos con los recursos para apoyar más artistas emergentes y podamos crecer juntos.
  3. ¡Viva México! No solo en Monterrey, sino en todo México hay un sinfín de artistas con un talento enorme que no siempre pueden llevar a cabo sus proyectos por falta de presupuesto. Apoyar nuestra campaña es una apuesta por el futuro de todos esos artistas con los que queremos seguir trabajando y que no solo se queden en Monterrey o en México, sino que puedan expandirse a todos lados.

1. TBLMKR could win a Grammy!!! Well, by association. Frank El Médico Rodríguez was nominated to the Grammy’s and Latin Grammy’s for his sound engineer work in Daddy Yankee’s album “El Cartel: The Big Boss”. We’re talking about this is the guy who blindly trusts in TBLMKR and mixed and mastered his upcoming EP. So, supporting this campaign you could be part of the future of a very big artist.​

2. The alliance between TBLMKR, La Clínica Records, and our production company Cocula Films, is a team work where all of us are putting our time and effort to create something without any financial gain. We believe in this young artist and other great talents that might not have the resources to expose their work, but with projects like these, they could have a chance to make it out there, be heard and be seen.

3. Viva México!! There’s a huge amount of talent not just in Monterrey, but everywhere in México. These unknown artists are a great example of this country’s amazing cultural variety, but not many can succeed in their projects because of financial problems. Supporting our campaign it’s a bet on the young people we would love to work with and to help them expand all over the world.

 

Arriba, en el video introductorio a esta agradable campaña, les explicamos de qué tratará la historia de “Que lo bailen”. Pero aquí les van algunos detalles de producción:

Up there in our introduction video for this campaign, we explain what’s the deal with the videoclip’s story. But here you’ll find some details about the production process behind all of it:

El rodaje será en dos días. El primer día para cubrir todas las escenas de fiesta y descontrol, y el segundo día para grabar el ritual de resurrección y baile. Para estos dos días necesitamos transporte, alimentación, pagar algunos permisos y refrigerios del cast & crew.

Filming will take two days. One day for the party scenes, and a second day for the dancing resurrection ritual. For all that we’ll need transportation, food, permit fees and snacks for the cast & crew.

La cámara que queremos usar es una Scarlet M-X de la familia de RED. De esta manera tendremos todo el material en 4K y listo para modificar a nuestro antojo en edición. Para manejarla contamos con la mano experta de Juansa Ávalos, director de fotografía consagrado de Monterrey y México. (PD: ¡Gracias por seguir con nosotros, Juansa!)

The videocamera we want to use is the beautiful Scarlet-MX from RED. This way, we’ll have all the footage in 4K, ready to be preciously edited to our wishes. To handle this bad girl, we have the expert hands of Juansa Ávalos, one of the best DPs in the country. Thank you, Juansa!

El diseño de producción estará a cargo de los chicos de La Causa, un estudio creativo de Monterrey que ha estado a cargo de proyectos artísticos desde el diseño de la identidad, hasta montar sets completos en cortometrajes y videoclips.

Production Design will lay in the talented team of La Causa, a creative studio in Monterrey with several years of experience.

Y también se unió a nuestro proyecto Fantasma Films, una casa productora de Monterrey que ha trabajado en proyectos de artistas como Cuatro Sobre La Luna, Morenito De Fuego y Teen Flirt, el festival musical Pa'l Norte, y la cadena de supermercados H-E-B.

We’ll also will be working with Fantasma Films, the great production company in Monterrey responsible for some of the best music videos, shortfilms, and TV spots of the country. Having clients like Teen Flirt, music festival Pa’l Norte, and supermarket chain H-E-B.

El maquillaje de los chicos y los minions para que den miedo y parezcan de ultratumba estará a cargo de Grecia Silva, una gran maquillista de efectos especiales de Monterrey.

Our trusted make up artist’s name is Grecia Silva, and she will give the dead-look to our three anti-heroes and the dancing minions.

Finalmente, la dirección y co-producción estará a cargo de Luis Machín y nuestro equipo de Cocula Films. Somos una agencia nueva de Monterrey que nos enfocaremos en crear contenido creativo y original desde México para todas partes. Apenas estamos comenzando en este campo, pero para que confíes un poco más en nosotros, llevamos dos años construyendo nuestro trabajo en Meraki Weddings, una agencia de video y fotografía para bodas con base en Monterrey. Checa nuestro trabajo aquí mero: www.vimeo.com/merakiweddings

Finally, direction and co-production will be in charge of Luis Machín and our team at Cocula Films. We’re a new creative agency in Monterrey and we’ll devote ourselves to create new, exciting and original content from México, to everywhere in the world. We might be new in this field, but just so you can trust us a little of your money, we can show you the work we have been doing for two years in Meraki Weddings, our wedding video agency based in Monterrey. Check it out! www.vimeo.com/merakiweddings

Todavía estamos en proceso de casting para los personajes principales. ¿Quieres ser parte de nuestro video musical? ¡Mándanos tus datos y 3 fotografías con el asunto “Casting Que Lo Bailen” a info@grupomeraki.mx!) (Solo Monterrey)

We’re still in casting process for our main characters. Would you like to be part of our music video? Send us your info and 3 pictures with the subject “Casting Que Lo Bailen” to info@grupomeraki.mx (Monterrey only)

 

Este es nuestro proyecto. No es tan grande, pero para poder hacerlo necesitamos tu apoyo, y en el camino que seas parte de esto con nosotros.

Si no puedes colaborar económicamente, no te preocupes, ¡entendemos!

Otras maneras de apoyarnos podrían ser:

Compartiendo esta campaña con todos tus conocidos, vecinos, compañeros del colegio que no ves desde hace años, ¡todos! A alguien le podría encantar J

Ser parte de nuestro equipo en algún área en la que seas bueno. ¿Eres el mejor montando grúas, peinando a muertos o tienes un talento natural para bailar? Escríbenos y sé parte del videoclip. ¡Aquí te esperamos! (Solo Monterrey)

¿Cocinas rico? Todavía estamos buscando nuestro catering para los dos días de rodaje. Si tienes algún local de comida o te encanta cocinar para alrededor de 20 personas, contáctanos y nos ponemos de acuerdo. ¡Tu logo, nombre o huella digital estaría marcada en los créditos del videoclip! (Piénsalo…)

So, this is our project. It’s not so big, but in order to make it a reality, we need your help, and along the road, make you part of this with us.

If you can’t help financially, don’t worry, we get it!

There’s other ways to support us:

Sharing this campaign with everyone you know, neighbors, friends, school mates you haven’t seen in years, everybody!! Someone might like it.

Be part of our team in some field you’re really good at. Are you the best assistant, script supervisor, urban dancer or hairstylist? Let us know, we’ll be waiting for you.

Are you a good cook? We’re still looking for our catering, so if you would like to cook for us or help us offering food from your restaurant in exchange of us blasting your logo and info everywhere, let us know! (Monterrey only)

TBLMKR es el nombre artístico de Alex Rodríguez, un chavo de 18 años que hace música desde su casa en Monterrey, Nuevo León, y es apoyado desde Miami por Frank “El Médico” Rodríguez (aunque no son familia), el mastermind detrás de La Clínica Records, una disquera digital independiente que se enfoca en apoyar y proyectar artistas de la música under latinoamericana, y todos los géneros derivados del BASS.TBLMKR is Alex Rodríguez’s artistic name, an 18 year old kid who makes music straight from his room in Monterrey, México, and is also supported by Frank “El Médico” (The Doctor) Rodríguez (even though they’re not family), who is the mastermind behind La Clínica Records, an independent label kicking the game in Latin American’s BASS music.Que lo bailen fue una creación de TBLMKR, junto al mix y masterización de Frank El Médico, y desde su publicación en la cuenta de Soundcloud de La Clínica Records en diciembre de 2016, ha recolectado más de 12,000 reproducciones, más de 700 likes y 200 compartidos.Nada mal para un chavito que salió de la nada y nació en 1999, ¿no?Que lo bailen’s birth was a joint process between Alex’s creation and Frank’s mix and master. Since its launch through La Clínica’s Soundcloud account, the track has gained more than 12,000 plays, around 700 likes, and 200 shares.Not so bad for a kid who came out of nowhere and was born in 1999, right?
¡TBLMKR podría ganar un Grammy! Bueno, por asociación. Frank El Médico Rodríguez fue nominado a los Grammy y Grammy Latinos por su trabajo como ingeniero de sonido en el disco “El Cartel: The Big Boss” de Daddy Yankee. Frank también confía en el talento de TBLMKR y mixeó y remasterizó su EP, así que al apoyar esta campaña podrías ser parte del futuro de un próximo gran artista.
La alianza entre TBLMKR, La Clínica Records y nuestra casa productora Cocula Films es un trabajo en conjunto donde todos estamos aportando de nuestras ganas, tiempo y esfuerzo para crear un producto donde no estamos ganando un solo peso, pero sí ganamos en proyectar el talento local con el buen trabajo que merece. story:
FROM SONGBOOKS TO A GLOBAL ONLINE PLATFORM

After offering as free download since 2002 our original songbooks used in singing circles worldwide, presenting a total of 775 traditional and modern popular and spiritual songs with chords and rythm information, Songfisher now has a new vision: creating an online platform for the global Circle Singing community.

MANY SONGS, MANY BOOKS TO CARRY ALONG... NOW, IMAGINE:

  • A “night-time” tablet/smartphone-friendly version of all 5 published songbooks

  • Accessing any song in a  global online searchable database containing all existing songs, and also updated regularly with new songs with texts, chords, etc..., all indexed with searchable tags for genres, etc...

  • All songs being approved in their original version by the songwriters

  • Creating and export your own custom compilations designed around a specific genre or theme, or for a particular occasion (circle, workshop, concert, etc...)

  • Listening to each song with one click

  • Connecting online with others members of the singing community

  • A calendar of circle singing related events and festivals, as well as many other features which will be developed in the future

 

​

 

WHY DO WE NEED FUNDING?

Until now, all Songfisher's operations have been resourced through volunteer work. Through this crowdfunding campaign we are looking forward to resource the main elements required to realise this project: graphic design, web development, administration and co-ordination with the songwriters and the various communities, etc...

To complete all 3 phases of the development of this platform will require €50k. We will complete as much as possible according to the funding available.


Songfisher's mission is to offer a service to the singing community and is not for profit. If you have any query about the detail of how the money raised will be spent, please contact us at music@songfisher.org

In the long term, Songfisher.org will become financially sustainable through subscriptions to affordable membership to website services, user donations and if necessary advertising.  

 

HOW WE PLAN TO MANIFEST THIS VISION

Here are the detail of how we plan to roll out this new project, through 3 main phases:

PHASE 1

  • Redesign and update all first 4 songbooks to the higher standard of last book “Ibiza Sagrada” 

  • Compile all 5 songbooks into a single pdf version with global index

  • Produce pdf “night-time” tablet/smartphone-friendly versions of all 5 songbooks and compilation 

  • Develop themed compilations such as Medicine Songs and Mantras

PHASE 2

  • Re-develop the website www.songfisher.org
  • Develop a searchable database to contain and index all songs with texts, chords, etc...

BASIC FEATURES OF THE  ONLINE SEARCHABLE DATABASE:

  • Search for, listen to and see songs from the songbooks on a global web platform containing songs from many different cultures, traditions and languages: Mantras, Rainbow, Native, Santo Daime, Umbanda, Hebrew, etc...
  • Each songs contains information about the artist/songwriter, lyrics, chords, key, tempo and links to the artist's website
  • Search tool for songs by artist, title, genre, language, songbook, etc...
  • Artists can introduce their songs (lyrics, chords, links to music) to a wider audience of listeners, musicians, seminar/workshop facilitators and singing circles
  • Compile and export your own personalised collection of songs as a printable online songbook which can be used in events, workshops, singing circles or for musicians/singers to study new songs
  • Artists can link their songs to places where they can sell and promote the songs such as Bandcamp, YouTube, iTunes, Sound Cloud, Melobee etc...

ADVANCED FEATURES:

  • Communicate with artists and users of the app, write comments and feedback through a chat/ forum platform
  • "Like" your favourite songs and get info on other users favourites
  • Artists: announce new songs and new additions in your song books to all users or to a selected group of users
  • Artists: get statistics on songs audience and their location, to help promote concerts and events

PHASE 3

  • Further develop the website to better serve the global community: events calendars, forums, etc...
  • Open the online platform to other songbook producers (Ciranda, Sacred Valley, SoL, etc...), in order to feature their songs in the database, so that their are available in the Songfisher format (these songs from other books from other communities will retain their same song numbers as in the original books, which will remain usable of course)
  • Develop melodical notations for all songs

 

SONGFISHER HAS THE FULL SUPPORT OF SONGWRITERS AND SINGING CIRCLES INTERNATIONALLY.

The following musicians, songwriters and circle facilitators have all given their approval and expressed their support for this project (by alphabetical order):

Adrian Freedman, Ale de Maria, Alexia Chellun, Amu, Andrea & Amin, Arnaldo Herrara/Boveda Celeste, Ayla, Carioca, Carlos, Chris Mancini, Chris Orange, Danit, Darpan, Diego Palma, Fantuzzi, Guy Lacroix, Heera, Ilona, Kuauthli, Laor, Loli, Lorna, Lucidia/Raphael, Lulu & Mischka, MaureenJi, Murray Kyle, Nick Barbachano, Omer, Oscar, Paloma Devi, Rainer Scheurenbrand, RaviJi, Rob/Rayo, Ryan Whitewolf, Shimshai, Tao, Tom Tom Lev, Vismay and many more.

We already have the support of the following communities:
Byron Community (Australia), Ubud Community (Bali, Indonesia), Alto Paraiso Community (Brazil), Mae de Agua (Brazil), Pacha Mama Community (Costa Rica), Miami Community (US), Ibiza Family (Spain), Sacred Valley Tribe (Peru), Eternal Heart Tribe (UK), Sol Community (Costa Rica), Ciranda (Brazil), Israel Families, Hawaii Families as well as people from Kaxinawá, Yawanawa, Huichol and other indigenous communities.

THE POWER OF SINGING TOGETHER

We truly believe that singing as a group is a key factor in creating a more harmonious world: chanting songs form various cultures contributes to creating a true brotherhood and sisterhood globally, and group singing has been used to promote cohesion and harmony in native tribes and societies since ancient times. Today, science also acknowledges the psychological and health benefits of the practice of music and singing, especially in a group, as shown in this published research by Mona Lisa Chanda and Daniel J. Levitin: The neurochemistry of Music - www.daniellevitin.com/levitinlab/articles/2013-...

Yulia Olidort

www.soundcloud.com/yuliaolidort

 

Please donate, and support Songfisher making this vision a reality for all the artists and singers!
story_txt:
FROM SONGBOOKS TO A GLOBAL ONLINE PLATFORMAfter offering as free download since 2002 our original songbooks used in singing circles worldwide, presenting a total of 775 traditional and modern popular and spiritual songs with chords and rythm information, Songfisher now has a new vision: creating an online platform for the global Circle Singing community.MANY SONGS, MANY BOOKS TO CARRY ALONG... NOW, IMAGINE:
A “night-time” tablet/smartphone-friendly version of all 5 published songbooks
Accessing any song in a  global online searchable database containing all existing songs, and also updated regularly with new songs with texts, chords, etc..., all indexed with searchable tags for genres, etc...
All songs being approved in their original version by the songwriters
Creating and export your own custom compilations designed around a specific genre or theme, or for a particular occasion (circle, workshop, concert, etc...)
Listening to each song with one click
Connecting online with others members of the singing community
A calendar of circle singing related events and festivals, as well as many other features which will be developed in the future
 ​ WHY DO WE NEED FUNDING?Until now, all Songfisher's operations have been resourced through volunteer work. Through this crowdfunding campaign we are looking forward to resource the main elements required to realise this project: graphic design, web development, administration and co-ordination with the songwriters and the various communities, etc...To complete all 3 phases of the development of this platform will require €50k. We will complete as much as possible according to the funding available.Songfisher's mission is to offer a service to the singing community and is not for profit. If you have any query about the detail of how the money raised will be spent, please contact us at music@songfisher.orgIn the long term, Songfisher.org will become financially sustainable through subscriptions to affordable membership to website services, user donations and if necessary advertising.   HOW WE PLAN TO MANIFEST THIS VISIONHere are the detail of how we plan to roll out this new project, through 3 main phases:PHASE 1
Redesign and update all first 4 songbooks to the higher standard of last book “Ibiza Sagrada” 
Compile all 5 songbooks into a single pdf version with global index
Produce pdf “night-time” tablet/smartphone-friendly versions of all 5 songbooks and compilation 
Develop themed compilations such as Medicine Songs and Mantras
PHASE 2
Re-develop the website www.songfisher.org

Develop a searchable database to contain and index all songs with texts, chords, etc...
BASIC FEATURES OF THE  ONLINE SEARCHABLE DATABASE:
Search for, listen to and see songs from the songbooks on a global web platform containing songs from many different cultures, traditions and languages: Mantras, Rainbow, Native, Santo Daime, Umbanda, Hebrew, etc...
Each songs contains information about the artist/songwriter, lyrics, chords, key, tempo and links to the artist's website
Search tool for songs by artist, title, genre, language, songbook, etc...
Artists can introduce their songs (lyrics, chords, links to music) to a wider audience of listeners, musicians, seminar/workshop facilitators and singing circles
Compile and export your own personalised collection of songs as a printable online songbook which can be used in events, workshops, singing circles or for musicians/singers to study new songs
Artists can link their songs to places where they can sell and promote the songs such as Bandcamp, YouTube, iTunes, Sound Cloud, Melobee etc...
ADVANCED FEATURES:
Communicate with artists and users of the app, write comments and feedback through a chat/ forum platform
"Like" your favourite songs and get info on other users favourites
Artists: announce new songs and new additions in your song books to all users or to a selected group of users
Artists: get statistics on songs audience and their location, to help promote concerts and events
PHASE 3
Further develop the website to better serve the global community: events calendars, forums, etc...
Open the online platform to other songbook producers (Ciranda, Sacred Valley, SoL, etc...), in order to feature their songs in the database, so that their are available in the Songfisher format (these songs from other books from other communities will retain their same song numbers as in the original books, which will remain usable of course)
Develop melodical notations for all songs
 SONGFISHER HAS THE FULL SUPPORT OF SONGWRITERS AND SINGING CIRCLES INTERNATIONALLY.The following musicians, songwriters and circle facilitators have all given their approval and expressed their support for this project (by alphabetical order):Adrian Freedman, Ale de Maria, Alexia Chellun, Amu, Andrea & Amin, Arnaldo Herrara/Boveda Celeste, Ayla, Carioca, Carlos, Chris Mancini, Chris Orange, Danit, Darpan, Diego Palma, Fantuzzi, Guy Lacroix, Heera, Ilona, Kuauthli, Laor, Loli, Lorna, Lucidia/Raphael, Lulu & Mischka, MaureenJi, Murray Kyle, Nick Barbachano, Omer, Oscar, Paloma Devi, Rainer Scheurenbrand, RaviJi, Rob/Rayo, Ryan Whitewolf, Shimshai, Tao, Tom Tom Lev, Vismay and many more.We already have the support of the following communities:Byron Community (Australia), Ubud Community (Bali, Indonesia), Alto Paraiso Community (Brazil), Mae de Agua (Brazil), Pacha Mama Community (Costa Rica), Miami Community (US), Ibiza Family (Spain), Sacred Valley Tribe (Peru), Eternal Heart Tribe (UK), Sol Community (Costa Rica), Ciranda (Brazil), Israel Families, Hawaii Families as well as people from Kaxinawá, Yawanawa, Huichol and other indigenous communities.THE POWER OF SINGING TOGETHERWe truly believe that singing as a group is a key factor in creating a more harmonious world: chanting songs form various cultures contributes to creating a true brotherhood and sisterhood globally, and group singing has been used to promote cohesion and harmony in native tribes and societies since ancient times. Today, science also acknowledges the psychological and health benefits of the practice of music and singing, especially in a group, as shown in this published research by Mona Lisa Chanda and Daniel J. Levitin: The neurochemistry of Music - www.daniellevitin.com/levitinlab/articles/2013-... SOME OF THE MUSICIANS & SONGWRITERS SHARING THEIR SONGS ON SONGFISHER.ORG:Aayam - Andrea & Amínwww.aayam.bandcamp.comAdrian Freedman www.adrianfreedman.comAlberto Kuselman www.facebook.com/search/top/?q=Alberto+Kuselman...Ale de Mariawww.youtube.com/channel/UC6t2nSp3Y6F6w0ghSEPGKB...www.facebook.com/alexandre.souzalima.14Alexia Chellunwww.alexiachellun.comAmu Ahavawww.soundcloud.com/amu-ahavaAylawww.soundcloud.com/aylamusicBoveda Celeste www.soundcloud.com/bovedaceleste-1Cariocawww.ciranda.orgwww.cariocafreitas.comChandra Lacombewww.chandralacombe.comChen Benitawww.youtube.com/channel/UCHpX3RybcTuEbsn0-iwAKyQwww.facebook.com/chen.benita.5?lst=758557797%3A...Chris Orangewww.chrisorangemusic.comDanit Treubigwww.danit.bandcamp.com/releasesDarpanwww.darpan.comDiego Palmawww.sacredvalleytribe.comEostar Kamalawww.facebook.com/Eostarwww.eostar.netFantuzziwww.fantuzzimusic.comFredy & Juan Carlos - Shinariwww.soundcloud.com/sweet-medicinewww.soundcloud.com/shrinariRaio (Rob Weber) www.facebook.com/people/Rob-Weber/100009436052134www.soundcloud.com/pachamantraRavi Jiwww.ravi2.bandcamp.com/track/we-areRising Appalachiawww.risingappalachia.comRugilewww.rugilemusic.comSacred Circle Collectivewww.facebook.com/SacredCircleCollectiveShaina Nollwww.facebook.com/arkawamusicShimshaiwww.shimshai.comSnatam Kaurwww.snatamkaur.comSuyanasuyana.bandcamp.com/album/sanandTao Chanwww.soundcloud.com/tao-chan-1Temple Mae d’Aguawww.ayahuascadreams.com/temple-mae-daguaThe LuvAmp Projectwww.theluvampproject.bandcamp.comTina Malia www.tinamalia.comTom LevXavier Ruddwww.xavierrudd.comYatrawww.ayahuasca-brasil.comYulia Olidortwww.soundcloud.com/yuliaolidort Please donate, and support Songfisher making this vision a reality for all the artists and singers!

story:
About Us

We are One Sultry Day, a 5 piece indie rock band from Kent, WA (Seattle). We have formally been a band since April 2017, and have composed 14 original songs and perfected our music playing all over Washington, Oregon, and Idaho. We have been ready to record for many months, and are eager to do it right.

By nature, our songs are transformative: They portray moving on, overcoming life challenges, finding a way forward out of chaos, or navigating emotional tides... rising out of the flames like the phoenix to renewed revelation. Our songs are written with an inspiring and uplifting intent. Although we're a rock band, often we honor our heritage by including culturally inspired instruments, whether its a hide drum, wooden flute, crystal bowls or even a bear shaped rattle.

Our musical journey has been an fantastic voyage of personal growth and fulfillment. We have been and remain clean hard working professionals with jobs, families, and businesses. Up until a few years ago, none of us pursued a full time career in music. Learning to take an experience or a feeling of something that is intimate and personal, wrap a song around it, and then expose our souls to the world in a public performance has forever changed us.

In all candor, the first few times we did it was a horrible mess. But the support of caring friends  in the music community kept us strong and moving forward. Now we are playing to sold out venues and theaters and being cheered back for encores. The music has matured into something to be proud of. Melodies that reach into the soul and resonate with a voice all their own. We are super excited: every time we take the stage; its all we want to do. You can help to make that dream reality.

What we are asking for

Our budget is $20k, and here's exactly  where its going:

$12k – Recording.  Although we are handling the recording part in house, mixing and mastering is our biggest expense. The golden rule of music production is: “Never mix or master your own music.” 5x Emmy winning, Grammy nominated producer Brian Lanese has graciously agreed to help give our music the voice it deserves at a great rate.

$3k – Production. This covers 600 limited edition CD's in jewel cases with 8 page booklets, and 400 standard edition CD's in Digipaks. Almost all of these will be distributed to our Indiegogo community. The few that remain we will take on the road with us, using those proceeds to fund the next batch.

$3k - Promotion. Distributing our material to publicists, radio promoters, and “taste makers”. This includes generating press kits, promotional videos, and show promotion paks (the whole social world has moved to video). While we can do most post production work ourselves, it is really hard to be both cameraman and actor at the same time... people with skills have to be hired to hold cameras, media printed, etc.

$2k – Art. Inspiring art for albums and inserts takes creativity and skilled artists who can deliver on time. We want to make sure that the album art is an accurate and memorable reflection of the music. Professional art adds character, depth and gives extra life to its spirit.

Upon reaching our goal, we will split the remainder between video production and marketing. Compelling music videos tell a powerful story about the music; but require detailed artwork, designs and professional post-production to help visually represent the message of the songs.

The Impact You Will Make

“Imagine listening to a song with your eyes closed: Can you feel it? This is such an amazing time. So many scientists are melding information with community. As you continue listening, an idea grows: we are the creators of our lives and can transform anything. The next song plays... and you begin to understand that how we feel, what we say, what we think and believe... creates a vibrational signature which draws our desires to our lives from a cellular level. By the end of the album, you are calm but awake to the realization: There has never been a better time then now to manifest our desire. All of us can have the life we have dreamed of having.”

Our music is conceived with this vision in mind. It’s part of what keeps us going. With your support, together, this is what we can achieve.

Ways You Can Get Involved

To make it easy for anyone, at any stage, to join us and also achieve a great return for helping out, we structured a fantastic set of incremental rewards to choose from:

Easy way

  • Limited Edition copies of "W.W.Y.D." for you and your friends.
  • Supporter Only T-shirts.
  • VIP Tickets to the one of our concerts.

Generous way

  • Unique one of a kind hand crafted art pieces, only 1 per song.
  • Let the world see your support, with one of the 4 available sponsor slots.
  • A private concert, just for you. Impress your friends and family with this exclusive perk.
  • Rarest of all: Share the experience! Join in our studio recording session and leave with a fantastic story that is yours and yours alone.

The highway

Sadly, some people just aren’t in a financial position to contribute. But you can still participate if you:

  • Like and friend us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Spotify, Itunes, Amazon, etc.
  • Share our campaign with your friends using the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Listen to and rate our single and demo songs.

story:
Who am I and why am I recording an EP?

 

A small accident on November 30, 2013 led to what is by far the most difficult year of my life. I incurred a terrible concussion that made me very sensitive to light and sound, so much so that I had to stay in the dark and wear earplugs a lot for months and months on end. That was very, very, very frustrating as a singer/songwriter and musician. To top that off, I had very bad anxiety and some depression, because I could hardly do anything. There were many occasions when I'd start feeling better and try to do something simple as washing dishes or being on the computer or driving and then I'd get a setback. So I was pretty much traumatized by what I was going through.

But, thank God, He still enabled me to hear melodies and write songs in my head. He even gave me dreams where I'd hear beautiful music or me singing. That was a great encouragement to me. And even though that may be the most difficult period of my life so far - it would eventually take about a year and 9 months before I'd be well enough to work at least part time - I am very grateful for the experience. Not only did it teach me to value silence, but songs were born out of it which I believe will be an encouragement to others. Just like it says in II Corinthians 1:4, "He comforts us in all our troubles so that we can comfort others." (NLT)

These are songs that not only voiced my cry and prayers to God for help and healing, but also speak the truth. When times got confusing, I had to remind myself of the truth to find peace in the midst of the storm I was going through. A song was also written as a thank you to friends and family that came along side me in my time of greatest need.

The working title of this project is "My Future Is Alive" as that is the hope that God gave me and I believe it is the same hope He wants me to convey to those who are going through difficulties, including you. No matter what you're going through in life, your future is still alive in Christ.

Most of the songs in the EP will come from what was born out of my struggle to get better from the post-concussion syndrome. There may be one or two in there that were written before that, but they are all going to work towards the theme of My Future Is Alive.

If this vision resonates with you and you would like to help me encourage people with the songs God has entrusted to me, you can partner with me in a couple of ways. First, pray that the right songs will be chosen for the project, the production and recording will go excellently, and that the Holy Spirit will use the songs mightily to heal and deliver. Second, pledge an amount towards the project and enjoy the perks when they become available.

What Is Needed to Make This Happen & What You Get

The estimated budget for the project is $6000. Around $1000 has already been raised. So I'm setting the goal of $5000. Donations made in cash save 8%, which is what it will cost to run it through Indiegogo. This budgeted amount covers the recording, production, mastering, online distribution, registration for copyright, CD duplication, cost of perks, mailing and marketing. The aim is not just to record 5 songs, but to get these songs in the hands and ears of those who need it. That is why marketing is included in the budget.

If we reach $7000 total, that will enable me to add 2 songs to the EP. Lord willing, it will get to that.

Target Date

The target date for official release is April 13, 2018. You should get the perks before the release date, unless something unforeseeable happens and we'd have to postpone the release date, in which case you will be notified.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help in a couple of ways:

  • Pray for the success of the campaign!
  • Talk it up with your friends and family and use the Indiegogo share tools and post it on your social media!

Thank you very much from the bottom of my heart!

- Christine Waters
