story:
Coucou! Hi!

We’re Telecolor, a young instrumental synth-pop band from Sudbury, Ontario and we recorded an EP this summer which we totally financed ourselves. But just like our accounting, our music isn’t mastered yet. That’s why we need your help.

Your money will allow us to complete the final step in getting our music to your ears.

On est Telecolor, un jeune band de synth-pop instrumental originaire de Sudbury, Ontario puis on vient d’enregistrer un EP cet été complètement autofinancé. Sauf qu’on n’est pas les meilleurs comptables au monde, fait qu’on a épuisé nos fonds puis il nous reste encore à mastériser et imprimer l’album.

Votre petit coup de pouce financier nous aiderait à compléter les dernières étapes avant que notre musique se rende jusqu’à vos tympans.

 

OK. WHAT I IZ NEEDS TO KNOW? | QUESSÉ QUI FAUT QUE J'SACHE?

We’ve chosen a mastering studio to work with. They estimate it’ll cost 525$.
On a choisi notre studio de mastérisation. Ils ont estimé 525$ de travail.

We also want to print CDs believe it or not (for your road trips in your old car without an aux jack or bluetooth) and that’ll cost us some dollars.
Mais on veut aussi faire imprimer des CDs (pour vos road trips dans l’char sans aux jack ou de bluetooth. C’est pas tout le monde qui a ces bébelles là!).

 

But we’re not lame or lazy. We’re willing to work for this money.
Mais ne vous inquiétez pas, on est loin d’être paresseux!

 

If you give us 5$, we’ll give you a high five (see, totally not lazy)!
Pour un petit Laurier, on vous rend la pareil : High five!

 

For 7$, Michel will take a photo of himself hiding beneath an object of your choice (#GoingViral)
Pour 7$, vous pourrez faire partie de la collection photographique « Où est caché Michel? ». Basically, Michel va se faire prendre en photo sous l’objet de votre choix.

 

For 8$, we’ll send you a digital copy of Lumia.
Pour 8$, on vous envoie une copie numérique de Lumia.

 

For 10$ plus postal fees, we’ll send you a CD copy of Lumia. 
Pour 10$, plus les frais postaux, on vous envoie une copie CD de Lumia.

 

If you give us 20$ plus les frais postaux, we’ll send you a flower-head Telecolor t-shirt.
Pour 20 piastres plus les frais postaux, on vous enverra un t-shirt “Tête-en-fleur” de Telecolor.

 

For 25$ we’ll send you a t-shirt autographed by its artist Joëlle Villeneuve and the band.
Pour 25$, l’artiste Joëlle Villeneuve puis Telecolor vont signer un t-shirt puis vous l'envoyer!

 

For 30$, we’ll thank you in the liner notes.
30$ - Un beau p'tit remerciement dans la pochette. C'est pas poche ça!

 

For 50$, André will come teach you an hour-long piano lesson. Maybe he’ll even teach you a Telecolor song!
50$ - Le beau André ira te donner une leçon de piano d’une heure. Si vous demandez gentiment, il vous montrera peut-être même une toune de Telecolor!

 

35$ + the cost of materials, Michel will change the oil on your car. Yeah, really.
35$ + le coût des matériaux, Michel changera l’huile de ton char. Ouin, vraiment!

 

For 100$, our visual artist friend Joëlle Villeneuve will do an original piece of artwork (8x10).
Notre amie Joëlle Villeneuve (celle qui a fait le design de Lumia) va créer une oeuvre originale en format 8x10 pour 100$.

 

If we don’t reach our goal, we’ll start by mastering the album and pushing out to digital formats. If there’s enough money, we will print CDs, then additional money would go to paying a visual artist/designer to design the jewel case. Any additional money will go to planning a launch party (1 in Sudbury and another in Toronto) and finally if there’s anything left over we will recoup the money we already spent on the album and put the rest aside for future projects!

 

Dans le cas malheureux où on n’atteint pas notre objectif, on va prendre l’argent recueilli pour d’abord matricer l’album. Ensuite, s’il reste des sous on fera l’impression sur CD (incluant le design de la pochette). Par la suite, les fonds seront utilisés pour planifier un spectacle lancement. Puis dans le cas où on dépasse le 3000$, on va se rembourser pour l’argent déjà dépensé en studio et en mettre de côté pour nos projets futurs.

 

TELECOLOR EVERYWHERE ET TOUT PARTOUT

 

Getting this album out not only allows you to finally hear our studio recordings, but it also let’s us start showcasing what we can do to people outside of Sudbury. That means we might eventually be able to start playing shows outside the city (which will be useful since Matt now lives in Toronto)!

 

Once this album comes out, it also means we can start working on the next one. That means a new show with new songs and new projections (because as cool as we think we are, you can only see our show so many times without getting bored)!

 

We’ve been good with our money! We’ve saved up all the cash made from gigging in order to do this record. Basically it’s Telecolor’s life savings. That being said, it’d be nice to have a little hand with rent and gas money since we do, in fact, do this for a living.

 

La sortie de l’album permettra enfin de vous mettre de la Lumia dans les oreilles, mais ça nous permettrait aussi de faire connaître notre musique à l’extérieur de Sudbury. Considérez ça comme notre carte de visite pour faire des shows ailleurs. Relativement utile pour un band où l’un des trois membres habite maintenant à Toronto!

 

Une fois Lumia sorti, on peut passer au prochain projet. Ça veut dire qu’à plus long terme un long-jeu verrait le jour! Ça veut aussi dire des nouvelles tounes, de nouvelles projections, puis un nouveau show (parce qu’il est peut-être bon notre show, mais après l’avoir vu 15 fois, vous allez commencer à vous ennuyer)!

 

On a été prudent avec notre argent jusque là. TOUT l’argent qu’on a amassé de nos gigs a été mis de côté pour cet enregistrement. C’est l’ensemble de l’épargne de Telecolor qui a été dépensé cet été. Ça serait vraiment nice de pouvoir en avoir un peu de côté pour manger (on fait quand même ça comme métier)!

 

RISQUÉ

 

At this point in the process, there’s not a whole lot of risk. The material is already recorded, we’ve already chosen a mastering studio and engineer to work with. Basically, the only way this won’t happen is if there’s a huge international war or natural disaster that makes the last of the work undoable (hey, it’s possible. Donald Trump is president of the USA)!

 

Rendu là, on assume à peu près tout le risque. Si notre projet ne fonctionne pas, c’est Telecolor qui sera perdant. Cela dit, il n’y a pas vraiment de raison pourquoi ça ne marcherait pas. Le matériel est déjà enregistré, on a choisi un studio et un ingénieur pour faire le matriçage. Essentiellement, la seule chose qui pourrait empêcher que l’album sorte, c’est une guerre nucléaire ou un désastre naturel (tout est possible, Donald Trump est président des États-Unis)!

YO, J'AI PAS D'CASH | YO, I'M BROKE DUDES

 

S'cool. If you can’t contribute financially, we totally get that! We’re broke too! That being said, a share on your facebook page or talking about it with your colleagues at lunch wouldn’t hurt. Use Indiegogo’s share tools to get to your favourite social media!

 

Fais-toé-zen-pas. Si vous n’avez pas une cenne, on comprend parce qu’on est dans le même bateau! Cela dit, vous pouvez quand même partager notre campagne indiegogo sur votre page Facebook, ou en parler avec vos amis autour d’un verre (on comprend, c’est une priorité la bière)!

But just like our accounting, our music isn’t mastered yet. Sauf qu’on n’est pas les meilleurs comptables au monde, fait qu’on a épuisé nos fonds puis il nous reste encore à mastériser et imprimer l’album.Votre petit coup de pouce financier nous aiderait à compléter les dernières étapes avant que notre musique se rende jusqu’à vos tympans. OK. WHAT I IZ NEEDS TO KNOW? | QUESSÉ QUI FAUT QUE J'SACHE?We’ve chosen a mastering studio to work with. They estimate it’ll cost 525$.On a choisi notre studio de mastérisation. story:
Summary

Hi folks, I'm Jeff Przech. Thanks for stopping by this page. What you'll see here is 100% me. No acting, no 'sales pitch', just myself. I strive to be authentic in my music and this campaign will be no different. Thanks for coming this far and I hope you'll keep reading!

To explain all this, I think it's best to start with the 5 W's:

  • WHO: Jeff Przech (me) and band (The Outfit)
  • WHAT: Our new record that we're recording now
  • WHERE: Well, we live and are recording in Connecticut, but it's music so the world is our target audience.
  • WHEN: Now! Today!
  • WHY: Because you can be a part of this process with us. Because you can get some really cool things for your pledge. Because you love good music and support those making it.

We're not simply asking for a handout. Instead, we're inviting everyone to join us in the music making process. We hope you'll share some of the ride with us. 

What We Need & Why

Truthfully, the usual budget for a record like this is far more than we're asking and can even leak into the six figures. We're doing this on a tight budget, but that does NOT mean we're doing this halfway. We have a good friend with a great studio and we're recording a majority of the record live in the same room. That means very few overdubs. What you'll hear is the four of us playing together in the same room. In addition to helping us on recording costs, it's an excellent vibe to make a record and has been used by some of our favorite artists. We've already got most of the record tracked and are thrilled with the way it's sounding so far. We're trying to raise a total of $7500. Here's what all that will go towards:

  • Studio time for recording
  • Mixing & mastering the final record
  • Production costs, including the CD pressing 
  • Licensing fees for the one cover song on the record 
  • Distribution costs (for physical CD and digital outlets - iTunes, Spotify, etc.)
  • Printing high quality T-shirts
  • IndieGogo & credit card fees
  • Promotion of the new record, to get it heard
  • Publicist/PR professional to help with promotion
  • Packaging & postage

If we're unable to reach our goal, some of these things will fall by the wayside, starting with the publicity and promotion. There's no sense paying for promo for a record that's not finished, of course. But, we don't want to make a record that no one will know about or hear either. If we're able to somehow exceed our goal, then we'll be able to do other things, like more promotion focusing on the digital world, and perhaps even shoot a music video. Anything is possible!

What You Get

In addition to being part of this project with us, there are a bunch of great exclusive items and experiences available depending on your pledge. Remember, these are NOT donations, and we are not a charity! Everyone who pledges their support will get something for it. There are the usual things like CD's and T-shirts, and also exclusive things like a round of golf with me or even one of my guitars. You can also have the opportunity to have your name listed in the liner notes of the record and even be credited as an executive producer. 

The Impact

This record is 'old school' in a lot of ways. We're recording it live in the studio. The music itself is, in my opinion, the kind you don't hear too much anymore. I'm not going to compare it to any particular artist - you the listener can do that for yourselves - but it'll be pretty clear who the influences are. We believe this record and these songs will help fill a void. There are a ton of music choices out there these days. The music business is changing daily and it's a far cry from the one many of us remember. Technology has allowed anyone who wants to become a recording artist the chance to do so.

However, technology has also led to streaming, which is the primary way, sometimes the ONLY way, people consume music these days. I won't bore you with the specifics, but suffice it to say when someone streams a song by an artist, that artist will only receive fractions of a penny for him/herself.

So what? My point is, I'm not getting rich off of this record and have no expectations of doing so. In fact, it's safe to say I probably won't even make a profit from it at all. And honestly, I don't care! I'm not doing this to make money or a living. I'm doing this because I love it and I need to. It's my passion and these songs are a huge part of who and what I am. Your support and pledge will help ensure that these songs get out there. I believe it's good music. I believe people who hear it will agree. But it must be made in order to be heard. Where the music goes from there? Who knows? But we'll never know unless this record gets made, right?

Challenges

 “There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure.”

Quite honestly, the challenge will come if we fail and don't meet our goal. Things need to be done and those things have a price. This is the reality of being an independent musician these days. We have not held back on the recording. In my mind, good enough is not good enough. That's my attitude about this entire project and meeting our goal will guarantee that nothing about this record is just 'good enough'.

Other Ways You Can Help

We can't do this by ourselves. If you aren't in a place where you can comfortably contribute to the making of this record, I completely understand. But, you can still help! The best way is by sharing this campaign via email and social media using the IndieGoGo Share Tools by the "BACK IT" button the top of the page! Any and all help is much appreciated.

story:
QUI SOMMES NOUS ?

Endless Sundown est un groupe de rock alternatif qui a vu le jour à Lyon.

Notre musique (euh comment dire ?), on appelle ça rock alternatif. C'est surtout bien pratique car c'est un fourre-tout ! Notre univers est à la fois sensible et poétique, tout en se mêlant à quelque chose de brutal et puissant.

Reste plus qu'à découvrir, et pour ça on a besoin de vous !

1er extrait de cet EP: " A Need " (Pré-mix, no master) 

 

LE PROJET.

Nous sommes donc heureux de vous annoncer l'enregistrement au studio Improve Tone de notre nouveau disque « Make Sense ».

Tout ça ne se fait pas seul . On bosse avec Dooweet Agency pour défendre notre projet à travers la France et l'Europe ! Nous serons aussi sur les routes française grâce School's Out Agency pour promouvoir ce nouvel opus. Une sacré équipe...

Mais le plus important : c'est vous !

 

POURQUOI 5000€ ?

Là vous entrez en scène :

Le budget total pour la sortie de ce CD est de 9000€. Nous avons pris en charge sa réalisation, (enregistrement, mixage et mastering), soit 4000€.

C'est beaucoup d'argent, c'est le prix d'une bagnole ! Mais on préfère une production de qualité que rouler en Dacia!

Malheureusement nos caisses sont vide et on a besoin de VOUS pour que la sortie de « Make Sense » se réalise, se concrétise.

 

Voici la répartition de notre budget :

story:
Summary

It has been nearly 6 months since the release of our début single 'Better From You', and in that time the band has refrained from an immediate follow up in order to prepare, develop and create a series of releases aimed at this coming summer. The consistent rehearsing, recording and production has seen the band evolve into something that our first single can no longer adequately characterise, with every new song expanding the group's songwriting capabilities, drive, and creative identity. We are now ready to break our silence and make some new noise.

Our goal is to finally take our fanbase on a journey through these last 6 months, and to show the world who we are, what we've become, and why we believe in Iridesce. 

Our Targets

The 3 songs that are scheduled for release this coming summer are only a fraction of the new material we've been working on, and will act as pillars to introduce Iridesce's developing sound. These singles are there to show the array of moods and atmospheres that have come to define our group's sonic identity, thereby re-inventing the band we were in 'Better From You'. To enable this successful evolution, we have a few key targets that we are aiming to meet. This is what the funds from our campaign will help us achieve:

A) Mixing/Mastering/Production of the 3rd single 

B) Recording & Production of the other new material we've written - this enables us to structure the second wave of releases we are currently drafting for autumn 2017

C) Music Video for the 3rd single 

D) Live sound equipment - this will be a bundle of sound engineering equipment that will help the band guarantee a great live sound, and bring the richness and depth we work into our records onto the stage with us 

E) Live show design - as well as re-inventing Iridesce's sound, the band are in the production stages of crafting an entirely new live show (containing only 2 out of the 8 older songs the band were touring when 'Better From You' was released). Live is the environment where we truly want our music to live in, so investing in this campaign will help the band present to you the exact experience and energy we feel when playing our songs. 

F) Promotion and advertisement to showcase and support the new releases and live dates 

 

Any and all support is appreciated! We cant wait to show you what we've become, and hope we can share our story with you!

Our Targets
The 3 songs that are scheduled for release this coming summer are only a fraction of the new material we've been working on, and will act as pillars to introduce Iridesce's developing sound. These singles are there to show the array of moods and atmospheres that have come to define our group's sonic identity, thereby re-inventing the band we were in 'Better From You'. To enable this successful evolution, we have a few key targets that we are aiming to meet. This is what the funds from our campaign will help us achieve:
A) Mixing/Mastering/Production of the 3rd single 
B) Recording & Production of the other new material we've written - this enables us to structure the second wave of releases we are currently drafting for autumn 2017
C) Music Video for the 3rd single 
D) Live sound equipment - this will be a bundle of sound engineering equipment that will help the band guarantee a great live sound, and bring the richness and depth we work into our records onto the stage with us 
E) Live show design - as well as re-inventing Iridesce's sound, the band are in the production stages of crafting an entirely new live show (containing only 2 out of the 8 older songs the band were touring when 'Better From You' was released). Live is the environment where we truly want our music to live in, so investing in this campaign will help the band present to you the exact experience and energy we feel when playing our songs. 
F) Promotion and advertisement to showcase and support the new releases and live dates 

 
Any and all support is appreciated! We cant wait to show you what we've become, and hope we can share our story with you!

story:
RIO ALEGRE - JOCA PERPIGNAN AND SPECIAL GUESTS: ÁUREA MARTINS, ANA COSTA, JOÃO CAVALCANTI, THANIA MACHADO AND DELCIO CARVALHO!

(TEXTO EM PORTUGUES ABAIXO)  - Amigos brasileiros, atendendo a pedidos estamos fornecendo uma alternativa para pagamento atraves de deposito em conta. Favor entrar em contato pelo email: jocaperpignan@gmail.com

חברים יקרים
 שמי ז׳וקה פרפיניאן, ואני מתרגש לבשר שהאלבום החדש של מוסיקה מקורית שלי - כבר בשלבי סיום! האלבום נקרא ריו אלגרה  (״ריו השמחה״) והוא הוקלט בברזיל. זהו האלבום השלישי שלי והראשון שכולו רק עם סמבות!
אני מזמין אתכם לבקר בעמוד הקמפיין של האלבום ולהכיר יותר את הפרוייקט. אתם יכולים גם לתמוך בפרוייקט, ע״י רכישת האלבום מראש או תמורות אחרות ייחודיות ומגוונות!
בתמורה לתמיכתכם בקמפיין, תוכלו לרכוש את האלבום טרום יציאתו לשוק, זוג כרטיסים למופע השקה, שיעור פרטי,מופע פרטי, סדנה פרטית של מקצבים ברזילאיים ועוד. 
ברכישה של אחת מהתמורות שבעמוד, או רק בשיתוף העמוד ברשתות החברתיות (על ידי אחד הכפתורים בחלק העליון של העמוד) אתם תהפכו לחלק בלתי נפרד מהגשמת החלום שלי ואודה לכם על כך מאוד!

Dear friends, wellcome to my Indiegogo campaign page!

My name is Joca Perpignan - percussionist, singer and composer, from Rio de Janeiro, living in Israel and I am here to present my new project: my third album of original music, and the first one exclusively of Sambas!

This project is very special for me due to the fact that the album is composed of  unreleased sambas that I wrote together with the late Brazilian poet and great songwriter Delcio Carvalho.

In order to produce this project I called some of the top samba musicians in Rio de Janeiro, led by the master cavaquinho player and producer Alceu Maia! 

The very special guests in this album are brazilian artists that I absolutely adore: Áurea Martins, Ana Costa, João Cavalcanti and Thania Machado.  These artists share a great respect and friendship for Delcio Carvalho and I am honored to have had worked with them, and to honor his legacy and memory together.

In addition to the guests mentioned above, we also used Delcio's voice recorded on my previous Album Manso Balanço on the track Rio Alegre, which we sung together!

Click the picture to watch the Manso Balanço's EPK youtube video:

Delcio and I started working on this project in 2008 and were planning on releasing it together. Unfortunately, before we were able to start the recordings- Delcio passed away. Now, finally, three years later, I completed the recordings and am excited to present our colaboration to you.

This project represents a lot for me as an artist. It is made with love and respect by me and by my fellow brazilian artists that are featured on the album and love samba just as much as I do!

The album Rio Alegre will be dedicated by us and you, the backers-  to the friend, partner, samba and poetry master - Delcio Carvalho!

I am really excited to bring this album to life, and would appreciate your support!

Yours,

Joca. 

PORTUGUES

Olá amigos e bem vindos a página da minha campanha de crowdfunding na Indiegogo!

Me chamo Joca Perpignan – sou percussionista, cantor e compositor, carioca, residente em Israel e estou aqui  apresentando meu novo trabalho, o meu terceiro cd autoral, e o primeiro só de sambas!

O cd Rio Alegre é um projeto muito especial pra mim e representa muito na minha carreira de compositor pelo fato de que todos os sambas gravados são parcerias inéditas minhas com o grande e saudoso poeta e compositor Delcio Carvalho.  

Para realizar esse projeto chamei um time de músicos de primeira linha do samba, comandado pelo grande cavaquinista e produtor musical Alceu Maia !

Os intérpretes que fazem participação especial nesse cd, além de serem artistas fantásticos de quem eu sou fã, são pessoas que tinham uma grande amizade com Delcio Carvalho: Áurea Martins, Ana Costa, João Cavalcanti e Thania Machado!

Além dos convidados citados, usamos tambem a voz do Delcio Carvalho gravada no meu cd anterior, cantando comigo a faixa título RIO ALEGRE.

Tinhamos planos de gravar essas parcerias juntos mas infelizmente na época não conseguimos realizar o projeto.  O  tempo passou e esse ano, tres anos após o falecimento do Delcio, resolvi finalmente tirar essas parcerias da gaveta e gravá-las.

Estou feliz e otimista com a  possibilidade de fazer esse trabalho nascer e florescer!

O CD Rio Alegre será dedicado ao amigo, parceiro, genio do samba e da poesia – Delcio Carvalho!

Abraços e obrigado pelo apoio!

Joca

Lista de musicas (songs list):

1- Vem procurar por mim - (Joca Perpignan / Delcio Carvalho)

2- A noite lá fora - (Joca Perpignan / Delcio Carvalho)

3- Brincadeira de roda - (Joca Perpignan / Delcio Carvalho)

4- Pra te ver brilhar - (Joca Perpignan / Delcio Carvalho)

5- Tanta saudade - (Joca Perpignan / Delcio Carvalho)

6- Louca fantasia - (Joca Perpignan / Delcio Carvalho)

7- Santo forte - (Joca Perpignan / Delcio Carvalho)

8- Passou o tempo - (Joca Perpignan / Delcio Carvalho)

9- Canto do horizonte - (Joca Perpignan / Delcio Carvalho)

10 - Rio alegre - (Joca Perpignan / Delcio Carvalho)

Bonus track: Sonho meu  - (Delcio Carvalho/D. Ivone Lara) - Joca's vocal arrangement

 

What I Need & What You Get

(TEXTO EM PORTUGUES ABAIXO)

To fund my project (see graphic below) I am launching this crowdfunding campaign. By purchasing the CD and other rewards quoted on this campaign you support the project, help fund it, and become part of the CD production!

Among the many perks that you can choose from: the complete download of the album Rio Alegre, a signed physical CD Rio Alegre, my previous CD Manso Balanço, tickets for the Rio Alegre album release concert in Rio de Janeiro, and in Tel-Aviv, private concerts/workshops, and more.

The name of the backer will be on the thank-you list on Joca’s social media pages!

(PORTUGUES)

Para financiar esse projeto estou lançando essa campanha de crowdfundig.  Adquirindo o  CD e outras recompensas antecipadamente  voces apoiam o projeto , ajudam a financiá-lo, e se tornam parte da produção desse CD.

Entre outras recompensas voce pode escolher – o download integral do album Rio Alegre, o CD Rio Alegre autografado em sua casa , o meu CD anterior Manso Balanço, ingressos para o show de lançamento do CD no Rio de Janeiro e para o show de lançamento do CD em Tel Aviv , show privado dos meus projetos musicais, e mais.

Atendendo a pedidos estamos fornecendo uma alternativa para pagamento atraves de deposito em conta. Entrar em contato pelo email: jocaperpignan@gmail.com

Dear friends, welcome to my in

O nome do apoiador estará na lista de agradecimentos de todas as páginas das redes sociais de Joca Perpignan!

BUDGET (Orçamento):

Other Ways You Can Help 

Can't contribute? that doesn't mean you can't help! 

Want to help more? Please read on!

I would appreciate it if you could get the word out, share my campaign and music. Here's a list of the Indiegogo share tools that you can use:

1. Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update

2. Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks (Located in the toolbar next to the campaign's Pitch image and video at the top of this page)

Thanks!

story:
My name is Dee, and I’ve been photographing some of the most significant and historic musical figures in jazz, since 1964.  My stepfather was Ornette Coleman, and my early memories are filled with Thelonious Monk knocking on our door after gigs at three AM to play on what I thought was MY living room piano!

I remember sitting right behind him in the Village Vanguard as he got on stage with my eyes hand-level to his flying piano keys.

Waiting for his burger between sets back in the dressing room, I remember the feel of his big hand holding my little one, as he twisted his beard in the mirror, rocking me off each foot sideways.  

When I was 12, I was given a camera which my aunt used at Quincy Jones’ rehearsals and recording sessions, because they worked daily side by side for Mercury/Philips Records in Artists and Repertoire.  I learned so much from being at some of those rehearsals and recordings, and FEELING the music, as Quincy stopped to explain, guide, refine, and produce those artists.  Recording sessions were what deepened my musical understanding, but as a child the musicians were to me family and friends, not stars.

The Smithsonian Institution  has requested my work to be included into their permanent collection. To accomplish this, I need to print and frame archival quality uniform images - and that’s where you come in!

The cost for this is ten thousand dollars to meet this prestigious standard of exhibition.  Your support will make this a reality. The interactions I’ve had with my subjects are priceless peeks into their humanity - in AND out of the spotlight: backstage or in the recording studio, concert hall or rehearsal room.

Whether you contribute a little or a lot, it will help get this work out where others can learn from, and enjoy it for the first time.  The musicians have dedicated so much of their lives for our enjoyment - we honor them by keeping the essence of them alive in our hearts, and these images vividly bring them to life for viewers and listeners.

This project needs ten thousand dollars to support the creation of museum-quality exhibitions.  The funds you donate will be used for printing and framing professional prints, as I’ve long awaited the opportunity to produce these commensurate with the image quality and the venues now courting my art.

Anything raised over the goal will be used to share my stories and prints with students in jazz and Latin music studies programs, and other university level cultural history and educational coursework.  

Much interest has already been expressed to me for this type of presentation,  while I still can enthusiastically relay the anecdotes and give the visual accompaniment to their music - which nobody else can.

With your support, we will make these images widely available to people for all of time to enjoy.  Many of these historic musicians are gone now, yet their music remains, and is being studied across the globe.   My photographs give life to that process by capturing the music in the interactions, smiles, the energy, and humanity of these great jazz artists who came before and are a valuable resource for all musicians and music lovers alike.

 Please look at the wide range offered, and choose any which fits your interest and budget.  There is a Limited Edition 100% cotton tee-shirt imprinted with an original high resolution 1988 photograph of ORNETTE COLEMAN - never before seen or reproduced anywhere before!

Thank you gifts will be shipped to you by First Class Mail immediately.

Thank you so much for contributing to the campaign so that I can reproduce my work for the Smithsonian Institute, and travel with the images to music studies programs.

My images bring viewers a glimpse of the musicians’ soul - as people. It is my wish to share these images and stories more widely, which might allow viewers to experience and enjoy some of the emotion I’ve captured in someone whose music they’ve appreciated or loved.  

Other THANK YOU GIFTS  you can choose from are:

 An expressive photo post card of monster Latin Jazz pianist/composer, EDDIE PALMIERI. 

 

 

 

 

An Intimate, extended (two-hour!) audio interview and
overview of his music with saxophonist
DAVID MURRAY (MP3 format).

 

Choose a program from the Music History Radio - CATALOGUE.pdf listed on my Web site.

 

 

 

 

 Or get an original photograph [8X10”] of
Luís ‘Perico’ Ortíz,    signed, numbered, and dated by the photographer. 

 

 

 

Also available is an un-released [original, edited] feature-length DVD music documentary called, “From Brazil To Cuba” - filmed and produced by photographer, with musicians Gonzalo Rubalcaba and João Bosco, and embedded with her relevant still photographs.  See the trailer 

For $150, you will receive an original photograph [8X10”] of the late, beloved David Valentín - signed, numbered, and dated by photographer. Dave was a master magician on the flute - recording and performing widely with both jazz and Latin musicians, and on his own.  His passing in 2016 leaves all who ever met him saddened, but this image will remind you of his talents daily!

Original [8X10”] photograph of Yomo Toro, signed, numbered, and dated by photographer 

This departed master of the Puerto Rican quatro was a founding member of the Fania All-Stars, and much loved by audiences world wide!

 

 

 

Original [8X10”] photograph/PRINT of Celia Cruz (ARM IN AIR), signed and numbered by photographer.

This departed "Queen of Latin Music" was the featured singer of the Fania All-Stars, with La Sonora Matancera, Johnny Pacheco, and ADORED by audiences world wide!

Collector's item - the original GIL EVANS Memorial Program from April 3, 1988 - eight pages long.  

Photographer was invited to attend this historic tribute to the composer, and received just one program,  kept in mint condition. 

Photographs of both GIL EVANS when living, or this event, have not been seen or published, and are also available.

 

 

An original vintage silver print (in an edition of ONE) - autographed by the musician/artist, and signed and dated by the photographer. This perk is for a $10,000 contribution. I have a variety of performing musicians in this category - but just one autographed each. 

Will provide on a first come, first served basis - contact photographer for your best choice !

Also, on some of the prints, the artist and price can be determined with the photographer.

AUTOGRAPHED PHOTOGRAPHS

Dizzy Gillespie
Horace Silver
Art Blakey and Billy Higgins
Gil Evans
Cecil Taylor and Tony Williams
Abbey Lincoln
Gato Barbieri
Pharaoh Sanders
Charlie Haden
Ernie Andrews
Mal Waldron
Steve McCall
Charlie Rouse
Freddie Green
Bobby Bradford
Béla Fleck
Buster Williams
Chico Freeman and Paquito d’Rivera
Eddie Palmieri
Eddie Gómez
Milton Nascimento
Djavan
João Bosco
Ivan Lins
Airto Moreira
José ‘Cheo’ Feliciano
Francisco Aguabella
Willie Colón
Yomo Toro
Dave Valentín
Papo Lucca
Yolanda Rivera

Autographed GERRY MULLIGAN original vintage silver print, signed and dated by the photographer.

Historic baritone sax player, Mulligan recorded on his own, and with multiple-dozens of others recordings, from the 1940's until his death in 1996.  

He was an instrumental part of MILES DAVIS "Birth Of The Cool" sessions, and his discography fills a book!

 

 

 

Autographed COUNT BASIE original vintage silver print, signed and dated by the photographer.

 

Autographed MILES DAVIS original vintage silver print, signed and dated by the photographer. 

This is the only existing print of this image which Miles later autographed.

 

 

 

To simply make a donation, click on this link:
Donations

To accomplish this, I need to print and frame archival quality uniform images - and that’s where you come in!The cost for this is ten thousand dollars to meet this prestigious standard of exhibition.  Your support will make this a reality. The interactions I’ve had with my subjects are priceless peeks into their humanity - in AND out of the spotlight: backstage or in the recording studio, concert hall or rehearsal room.Whether you contribute a little or a lot, it will help get this work out where others can learn from, and enjoy it for the first time.  The musicians have dedicated so much of their lives for our enjoyment - we honor them by keeping the essence of them alive in our hearts, and these images vividly bring them to life for viewers and listeners.This project needs ten thousand dollars to support the creation of museum-quality exhibitions.  The funds you donate will be used for printing and framing professional prints, as I’ve long awaited the opportunity to produce these commensurate with the image quality and the venues now courting my art.Anything raised over the goal will be used to share my stories and prints with students in jazz and Latin music studies programs, and other university level cultural history and educational coursework.  Much interest has already been expressed to me for this type of presentation,  while I still can enthusiastically relay the anecdotes and give the visual accompaniment to their music - which nobody else can.With your support, we will make these images widely available to people for all of time to enjoy.  Many of these historic musicians are gone now, yet their music remains, and is being studied across the globe.   My photographs give life to that process by capturing the music in the interactions, smiles, the energy, and humanity of these great jazz artists who came before and are a valuable resource for all musicians and music lovers alike.  Please look at the wide range offered, and choose any which fits your interest and budget.  There is a Limited Edition 100% cotton tee-shirt imprinted with an original high resolution 1988 photograph of ORNETTE COLEMAN - never before seen or reproduced anywhere before!Thank you gifts will be shipped to you by First Class Mail immediately.Thank you so much for contributing to the campaign so that I can reproduce my work for the Smithsonian Institute, and travel with the images to music studies programs.My images bring viewers a glimpse of the musicians’ soul - as people. It is my wish to share these images and stories more widely, which might allow viewers to experience and enjoy some of the emotion I’ve captured in someone whose music they’ve appreciated or loved.  Other THANK YOU GIFTS  you can choose from are: An expressive photo post card of monster Latin Jazz pianist/composer, EDDIE PALMIERI.     An Intimate, extended (two-hour!) audio interview andoverview of his music with saxophonistDAVID MURRAY (MP3 format). Choose a program from the Music History Radio - CATALOGUE.pdf listed on my Web site.     Or get an original photograph [8X10”] ofLuís ‘Perico’ Ortíz,    signed, numbered, and dated by the photographer.    Also available is an un-released [original, edited] feature-length DVD music documentary called, “From Brazil To Cuba” - filmed and produced by photographer, with musicians Gonzalo Rubalcaba and João Bosco, and embedded with her relevant still photographs.  See the trailer For $150, you will receive an original photograph [8X10”] of the late, beloved David Valentín - signed, numbered, and dated by photographer. Dave was a master magician on the flute - recording and performing widely with both jazz and Latin musicians, and on his own.  His passing in 2016 leaves all who ever met him saddened, but this image will remind you of his talents daily!Original [8X10”] photograph of Yomo Toro, signed, numbered, and dated by photographer This departed master of the Puerto Rican quatro was a founding member of the Fania All-Stars, and much loved by audiences world wide!   Original [8X10”] photograph/PRINT of Celia Cruz (ARM IN AIR), signed and numbered by photographer.This departed "Queen of Latin Music" was the featured singer of the Fania All-Stars, with La Sonora Matancera, Johnny Pacheco, and ADORED by audiences world wide!Collector's item - the original GIL EVANS Memorial Program from April 3, 1988 - eight pages long.  Photographer was invited to attend this historic tribute to the composer, and received just one program,  kept in mint condition. Photographs of both GIL EVANS when living, or this event, have not been seen or published, and are also available.  An original vintage silver print (in an edition of ONE) - autographed by the musician/artist, and signed and dated by the photographer. This perk is for a $10,000 contribution. I have a variety of performing musicians in this category - but just one autographed each. Will provide on a first come, first served basis - contact photographer for your best choice !Also, on some of the prints, the artist and price can be determined with the photographer.AUTOGRAPHED PHOTOGRAPHSDizzy GillespieHorace SilverArt Blakey and Billy HigginsGil EvansCecil Taylor and Tony WilliamsAbbey LincolnGato BarbieriPharaoh SandersCharlie HadenErnie AndrewsMal WaldronSteve McCallCharlie RouseFreddie GreenBobby BradfordBéla FleckBuster WilliamsChico Freeman and Paquito d’RiveraEddie PalmieriEddie GómezMilton NascimentoDjavanJoão BoscoIvan LinsAirto MoreiraJosé ‘Cheo’ FelicianoFrancisco AguabellaWillie ColónYomo ToroDave ValentínPapo LuccaYolanda RiveraAutographed GERRY MULLIGAN original vintage silver print, signed and dated by the photographer.Historic baritone sax player, Mulligan recorded on his own, and with multiple-dozens of others recordings, from the 1940's until his death in 1996.  He was an instrumental part of MILES DAVIS "Birth Of The Cool" sessions, and his discography fills a book!   Autographed COUNT BASIE original vintage silver print, signed and dated by the photographer. Autographed MILES DAVIS original vintage silver print, signed and dated by the photographer. This is the only existing print of this image which Miles later autographed.   To simply make a donation, click on this link:Donations

story:
Can I be honest?

Let's be real, this is always the hardest part, talking about yourself and asking for money. I just wanted to get that out of the way up front. 

Since I was in middle school I knew I wanted to create music. I never had aspirations of becoming some big pop star or being in the magazines but I knew I wanted to create music that mattered. As I grew older and confronted the reality of other peoples opinions, my own self-esteem, and confidence, and my lack of faith in myself I put that hope aside. I regained it from time to time, I even attempted to record and release a project nearly 5 years ago and failed. I began to realize that all of those experiences from trying to failing, loving and hating myself, believing and not believing weren't isolated to just me. I realized that we as humans share many common experiences and I had the opportunity to express that in music form and thats exactly what I did and still do. 

Creating music for me is beyond bringing a dream to reality. It’s about relating, connecting, grieving, loving, and journeying with others in melodies and languages laced with honesty and hope. 

That's what I want to do with my first project; put out music that starts as “my” experience, but becomes a reflection of “our” lives, with all its complexities of pain and joy.

What this project entails:

This will be an extended play or EP which means its the in-between phase of a single and album usually consisting of 4-8 songs. Im aiming to release 4 songs on all digital media platforms such as iTunes and Spotify by mid fall 2017. 

The funds you donate will go towards: 

  • Producing
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Duplication/Printing
  • Album Artwork 
  • Promotion

Perks:

  • My never ending gratitude
  • Some cool music 
  • Live performances
  • Generosity points 

 

Risks & Challenges

The truth is it cost to create music now. Most artist and musicians do not live off sales from music. The industry has shifted into a digital platform which actually cost artist to create music with no financial return. If i reach my goal it will give me the ability to move forward and finish this first project. Anything left over or extra will go towards unexpected cost (which always happen) and future projects. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Honestly if you are hesitant, uncomfortable or unable to give financially, I will take all the prayers, good vibes and encouraging words I can get. Im grateful to those of you who have even gotten this far in reading. I would love for you to share this campaign and video as much as you can on your social media platforms and support me with your prayers. I love you all and hopefully by this fall I have something musically to express my love to you!

story:
SUMMARY

Hello there potential Indiegogo Contributor and thanks for visiting my page!  My name is Charlie Millikin and I’m a Pop Singer/Songwriter from Cincinnati, OH.  I’ve been out in the gigging world for the past 7 years and just last year released my debut self-titled EP (Check it out on Spotify now!) #SelfPlug.  I’m crazy proud of my original songs, but need YOU GUYS to help me get to the next step.  I need a STELLAR MUSIC VIDEO!

Over the past year, one of the songs on my EP, “Take Control”, has been heard more than 60,000 times on Spotify alone and this is the song that I think has the greatest potential for an amazing video!  The idea for the video is in place (it’s great, you’ll see) and I’ve found myself a director who hatched this cool concept for the video.

VIDEO CONCEPT

The idea for the music video IS AS FOLLOWS - The general genre/feel of the video will be a dark rom-com.  The basic idea is that a girl hits and kills me with her car.  Instead of calling the police, she takes me home and re-animates me because she has acquired a magic epi pen that she can use to turn me into the “ideal boyfriend” whenever she’d like.  Out in public, I’m a total gentleman/life of the party, but at home I’m basically a vegetable.

Think of it as a little mash-up of the themes from Frankenstein, The Nutty Professor (Jerry Lewis Version) and Cinderella

Pretty crazy right?  Just crazy enough to become something amazing!  The idea is subject to change of course, but this is the basic idea that we’re working with.  THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN. 

SUPER-SWEET PERKS

People like you, (YES YOU!) wondering how you can take part in something amazing.  Well, here’s how you can do just that.  The perks are as unique as the day is wide!  (That’s a saying, right?)  Anyway, ranging from the $1 perk of a digital download of my 4-song EP ALL THE WAY to the $350 perk level of a PERSONALIZED SONG (and everything in between **INCLUDING BEING IN THE MUSIC VIDEO**) there are some really cool things in there I think you’ll enjoy :)

There are only 10 perks for now but more could always be added!

PS:  With every perk you get, you get all rewards in all previous perks - cuz I’m a nice guy like that

WHERE THE MONEY GOES

Now for the money…  The 5K that we need to raise covers these key things:

Videographer/Director

Editor

Actors

Locations

Props

Art Design

Make-Up Artist

Storyboarding/Pre-Production

Food/Drink for cast/crew

Plus many more things!

**Every dollar raised (even if we raise more than 5k) will go to MAKING A BETTER VIDEO!**

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t contribute, not a problem!  All I ask it that you help me spread the word and share this campaign around the Inter-Webs!

THANK YOU

So that’s it!  Pretty straight-forward and to the point, right?  Thanks for all your help and I’m excited to see what we can do together!

story:
Short Summary

Lea Anderson is an R&B singer and flutist. She wrote and recorded a collection of songs with a Grammy nominated and 16-time Billboard winning producer. After its release in 2016, Lea went through lengths to promote the EP including but not limiting to: open mics, showcases, college fashion shows, headlining in clubs, and the public train stations. With the goal to reach as many people as possible, she wants to travel beyond NYC to heal people through sound at a time where we need it the most. An online presence is essential to the development of an independent artist. Lea Anderson wants to make sure she can keep providing high quality visuals to music lovers. She is so proud to have a budding career in music and now you can be apart of it, too! 

 

What I Need & What You Get

  • I am hoping to raise at least $3,000 dollars. This will go to pay a number of professions who have already agreed to help me create the visuals I want. I have a vivd imagination and great music. I want to create music videos that reflect that. 
  • Having an unexpected setback of being released from my cruise gig, I am not in the situation to save for the videos my good music demands.  This is why I need help from my musical family. 
  • If I don't reach my goal, the money will first go to the production costs of "Real Love" which seems to be everyone's favorite song.  [https://soundcloud.com/iamleaanderson/real-love...]

The Impact

  • If I am fully funded, the big door that is waiting to open for me will abide. R&B music will be resurrected. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help by getting the word out and make some noise about Lea's campaign.
  • Share it on social media, email, and word of mouth. 
  • "Like" and share the official videos she currently has out. It will look attractive to prospective supporters!

story:
Short Summary

Lynn Hadley-Gillitzer’s first Album a mixture of country/blues and jazz with a little rock thrown in.  I have been singing my whole life, Music is my Passion, my Paradise.

Music heals, and brings such joy to our lives, I am raising funds for my first Album,  and at the same time hope to bring to awareness to those who suffer from mental illnesses; coping with everyday life and It’s challenges.  People need a way to escape and heal.  Many wear masks to disguise their pain, and are left adrift at sea alone to their own devices. We must come together, to help unmask the stigma of mental illnesses.  Below is a meandering of my story, with my song titles embedded within it.

I have traveled many roads while enjoying the adventures of motherhood, all the while quietly dreaming my path would lead back to music.

Within the meanderings of life, I have many Reflections and have stood by Still Waters and dove into the deep to try to solve the many mysteries of life, only to have been lead down Mystery Street  trying  to understanding the many twist and turns that life brings.

I have been left Breathless by the joys and experiences of parenthood, marriage and friendships, at the same time felt the sadness of loss.  The bitter sweetness of life.  These experiences have left their mark, leaving many Scrapes and Bruises along the way, music has always lead me back to the harmonious melodies of Paradise Alley, while dealing with my own depression and anxiety,  my escape, the gift that lifts me up and brings me back home.

I spent so much time watching my children grow, felt the love only mothers know, the love Mothers and Daughters  feel. I have seen the sands of time slip through the glass, only to awaken to feel the Winds of Change at my feet, and see through new eyes, the love that shines through their experiences, experiences through Sophie’s Eyes and with renewed vision see,  realize It’s Never Too Late. 

What We Need & What You Get

The adventure continues, and I hope you will join me on my journey, and help me raise funds to pay for the many talented and dedicated musicians that have graciously help produce and play on my Album.

Beth Kille

Dana Perry

Jenna Joanis

Shawnie Marks

Rin Ribble

Dan Kennedy

Nikki Wentworth Allbaugh

I also need to pay for production costs, audio engineering, graphic design, photography, and CD mastering.

My journey would not be possible with Beth Kille, who has invested countless hours to help breathe life into my songs. I have been able to collaborate with many others on this project as well, including songwriters  Elizabeth Petty(Mystery Street), Jacob Peetz(It's Never to late) Elizabeth Gillitzer(Reflections), and my fellow Ladies Rock Campers, Sarah Chrysler, Heather Williams, Judi Alvarado, Lynda Mcafee who cowrote "Winds of Change" with me.

The Impact

Finally, it is my hope with this album will continue to always bring awareness of Mental Health, and the importance of recognizing; being vigilant to those who suffer from mental illnesses, and to those who have taken their own lives.  One of the songs Still Waters is a testimony to my brother, who took his own life, and to a multitude of others who have done the same.

People with mental illness often wear a mask, we often do not even know those who are suffering, but if we can erase the stigma, so people can remove their masks and get the help they need.

Music heals, it has helped me grieve the loss of my brother, my mother and also my father, and not to mention so many other facets of my life.  Music is my paradise I escape to so I may reflect on life and find the peace love and happiness I so long for.

Any extra funds I raise will be donated to the MAMA's and Girls Rock Camp Madison, organizations that put instruments into the hands of children, and foster the love of music to new generations. 

 

.

story:
PROJECT OVERVIEW

The legendary trombonist, Joseph Alessi ("a stunningly virtuosic performance by Joseph Alessi." New York Times) and British Conductor and Composer Benjamin Ellin (“Ellin's is a musical voice worth getting acquainted with.” Gramophone Magazine) are planning to bring their recent collaboration, the trombone concerto PANDORA, to a global audience by recording and releasing it with the San Francisco Ballet Orchestra in 2019, conducted by their Music Director Martin West. 

The concerto by Ellin was premiered and written for Alessi in 2010 following Ellin's success in the Barlow Endowment Prize for Composition. He became only the second British composer to win the award in its history and the concerto was subsequently premiered by the BYU Symphony Orchestra (under Kory Katseanes) with Joseph Alessi as soloist. Since then PANDORA has been performed across the globe. This recording project seeks to create a fascinating documented addition to the trombone repertoire which can be enjoyed by fellow musicians, trombone aficionados and the wider public for years to come. The recording will also celebrate the creation of the new concerto which Joseph Alessi was integral in bringing  in to existence. 

The whole programme on the album explores and showcases two things; a celebration of the vibrancy of the world of brass music (with a major focus on the trombone!) and the community and legacy that music and music making brings both to those who make it and those who share it. Alongside the concerto the CD will feature a work for brass dectet entitled Vánon (in memory of the London Symphony Orchestra's tuba legend John Fletcher) as well as a brand new piece for solo trombone and trombone quartet.

The album is slated to be released by PARMA records in the USA, experts at embracing and delivering projects that deserve to be released. 

 

This album will also be produced by CRF (Classical Record Foundation). The mission of the Classical Recording Foundation is to provide great performing artists and composers with an opportunity to record, release, and promote new classical recordings in a manner that captures ideal performances that define our era, by providing established artists with awards and new artists with grants. CRF does not benefit from record sales or royalties, and depends entirely on support from generous individuals and corporations, as well as merit-based grants from public and private sources.

WHY/USP

This project is not about making money, it is about making music. The money we need is to cover the cost of the recording and to bring it to market so we can share it with the widest possible audience.

This project will result in a benchmark recording that documents the creation of new works and allows future generations to share and enjoy the performance of one of the masters of the instrument.

The album celebrates Joseph’s return to the San Francisco Ballet Orchestra, where his professional musical career began. This project also showcases the brilliance of his playing, his personality and some of the musical areas he is passionate about; collaboration, new music and sharing fresh perspectives.

Perhaps above all, this project highlights the positive unifying aspect of music making and being able to share this with people from across the world.

 

BUDGET/TARGET*:

Total Budget: $161,500 (Of this total budget $96,000 has already been raised)

Orchestra costs (including all fees, cartages, travel etc): $130,500

Studio and production costs: $16,000

Travel and accommodations: $2,500

Contingency : $9,500

Printing/pressing: $3,000

*Special note for U.S. backers: If you would like to make a tax deductible donation, you can make your pledge directly with the Classical Recording Foundation via PayPal.  At the end of the year, CRF will send you a letter documenting your donation for tax purposes.  When you make your donation, just enter the word "PANDORA" under "Add special instructions to the seller" so that we can track this donation appropriately.
story_txt: PROJECT OVERVIEWThe legendary trombonist, Joseph Alessi ("a stunningly virtuosic performance by Joseph Alessi." New York Times) and British Conductor and Composer Benjamin Ellin (“Ellin's is a musical voice worth getting acquainted with.” Gramophone Magazine) are planning to bring their recent collaboration, the trombone concerto PANDORA, to a global audience by recording and releasing it with the San Francisco Ballet Orchestra in 2019, conducted by their Music Director Martin West. The concerto by Ellin was premiered and written for Alessi in 2010 following Ellin's success in the Barlow Endowment Prize for Composition. He became only the second British composer to win the award in its history and the concerto was subsequently premiered by the BYU Symphony Orchestra (under Kory Katseanes) with Joseph Alessi as soloist. Since then PANDORA has been performed across the globe. This recording project seeks to create a fascinating documented addition to the trombone repertoire which can be enjoyed by fellow musicians, trombone aficionados and the wider public for years to come. The recording will also celebrate the creation of the new concerto which Joseph Alessi was integral in bringing  in to existence. The whole programme on the album explores and showcases two things; a celebration of the vibrancy of the world of brass music (with a major focus on the trombone!) and the community and legacy that music and music making brings both to those who make it and those who share it. Alongside the concerto the CD will feature a work for brass dectet entitled Vánon (in memory of the London Symphony Orchestra's tuba legend John Fletcher) as well as a brand new piece for solo trombone and trombone quartet.The album is slated to be released by PARMA records in the USA, experts at embracing and delivering projects that deserve to be released.  This album will also be produced by CRF (Classical Record Foundation). The mission of the Classical Recording Foundation is to provide great performing artists and composers with an opportunity to record, release, and promote new classical recordings in a manner that captures ideal performances that define our era, by providing established artists with awards and new artists with grants. CRF does not benefit from record sales or royalties, and depends entirely on support from generous individuals and corporations, as well as merit-based grants from public and private sources.WHY/USPThis project is not about making money, it is about making music. The money we need is to cover the cost of the recording and to bring it to market so we can share it with the widest possible audience.This project will result in a benchmark recording that documents the creation of new works and allows future generations to share and enjoy the performance of one of the masters of the instrument.The album celebrates Joseph’s return to the San Francisco Ballet Orchestra, where his professional musical career began. This project also showcases the brilliance of his playing, his personality and some of the musical areas he is passionate about; collaboration, new music and sharing fresh perspectives.Perhaps above all, this project highlights the positive unifying aspect of music making and being able to share this with people from across the world. BUDGET/TARGET*:Total Budget: $161,500 (Of this total budget $96,000 has already been raised)Orchestra costs (including all fees, cartages, travel etc): $130,500Studio and production costs: $16,000Travel and accommodations: $2,500Contingency : $9,500Printing/pressing: $3,000*Special note for U.S. backers: If you would like to make a tax deductible donation, you can make your pledge directly with the Classical Recording Foundation via PayPal.  At the end of the year, CRF will send you a letter documenting your donation for tax purposes.  When you make your donation, just enter the word "PANDORA" under "Add special instructions to the seller" so that we can track this donation appropriately.

story:
Introduction
We are Experience Points! A Video Game Music band combining funk, jazz, and groove-based music with classic video game melodies. We started out as a group of friends with a shared passion for rearranging and performing video game music that we grew up listening to and have a deep connection with. Over the past year, our fan-base has grown allowing us to perform throughout Western Canada to audiences with our shared passion of video game music! We know that we could not have gotten this far without your support. This campaign is a way for us to keep doing what we do while giving special perks back to those who keep supporting us!


Our Campaign

This summer we are hitting the studio and recording our debut album! We are super proud of our music and are excited to share it with all of you in a permanent format! The success of this campaign will determine how big our album is. We have set up higher-tier donations to allow you to receive all previous donation level bonuses!


Your contribution will help us pay for:
Studio time
Recording engineers
Studio musicians (horn players)
Mixing
Mastering
Artwork
Packaging and distribution


Without your support, we would have to fund everything out of pocket.

All items are exclusive to the campaign. Remember, if you go for a higher-tier donation, you will receive all previous donation level bonuses (so if you donate at the $150 level you’ll receive a pixel character version of yourself, guest entry to the CD release show, physical CD, etc.)


Donors for this limited-time campaign will receive special rewards including:

$10 (Banana) —Digital copy of our CD

$20 (Green Shell) —A “Thank You” in the CD sleeve

$30 (Mushroom) – Signed copy of the physical CD 

$50 (Red Shell) —EXP T-shirt

$100 (Thunderbolt) —Guest entry to our CD release show

$150 (Blue Shell) —Exclusive pixel character version of you created by our pixel artist, Stephanie

$250 (Super Star)—Any video game tune of your choice recorded by us!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't help us out with a dollar contribution, but you can still help us out! Spread the word by letting your friends and family know about the campaign and our unique perks. Also share it on social media!

Thanks for checking out our campaign!

story:
Who Is Rick Lee James?

Hi, I'm Rick.

I realize that you might not be familiar with the kind of music I make, so I wanted to make this easy for your right off the bat. Here are 4 music videos from my last album, Hymns, Prayers, and Invitations, an album that I made with Lifeway Worship. Check these out to get a feel for my style then if you like what you hear keep scrolling down the page.

The Invitation

 

Advent Hymn (Watching, Waiting, Longing)

 

Christ Is Lord (Christ Before Me)

 

More Than The Watchman (Psalm 130)

 

 

Here I Am Again

Hello my friends, it's Rick again.

I hope you enjoyed hearing some of my music in the videos above.

Let me be up front with you, this is my second attempt to fund this album. Last time we raised about half of what I needed so now I'm attempting to raise the other half.

 

Let Me Tell You about This Album

I’ve already finished recording this album with my super-talented friends at Old Bear Studio in Buffalo, New York. Chris Hoisington, of Brothers McClurg, produced the project and he has been an amazing collaborator to work with.  We completed the recording of the album on the week of March 12th.

This album is important to me for a variety of reasons. One big reason is that I have the honor of releasing a never before published song on this album by one of my musical heroes, the late Rich Mullins. The song is called Thunder, and I love it so much that I decided to give the album the same title.

The album is much more than music by Rich Mullins though.

Over the last couple of years I feel like I have been through some large peaks and valleys in life. The songs I'm putting on this album are songs of worship but they are also songs that deal with hard things I have been through with family, my friends, and my church.

  • Some of the songs on this album deal with hard life issues like death of loved ones, miscarriages, and painful human struggles we all encounter. 
  • Certain songs deal with rich but difficult theological matters like the contemplative prayer, the Trinity and loving our enemies.
  • Some of the songs are just some fun proclamations of joy designed to help the church rejoice and sing together.

My hope is that the music on this album will not only have the highest musical quality, but that it will be a tool used by God to draw worship from His people no matter what circumstance of life we find ourselves in. 

What Do I Need?

To meet the financial needs for this recording, we needed to raise $5200 dollars more. However, just prior to our launch a $500 came in so now we only need to raise $4700 total to meet the recording budget. There are many complex aspects that go into a live recording like this.

The money will be used to pay for:

  • Studio time  
  • The musicians 
  • The engineers 
  • The videographers
  • The photographers
  • Pre and post production expenses
  • The Producer

Good News

With God's help, I've already raised over $5000 dollars and with generosity of good people like you I know we can raise the rest in 45 days.

Your contributions to this campaign will ensure that I don't have to take out a large loan for this project thus keeping my family out of financial hardship. These days you really can't depend on albums to pay for themselves after they release, especially as an independent artist, so your contributions literally allow me to continue making music now and in the future.

Perks For Giving

  • Album Pre-Orders

Every donation is greatly appreciated, but donations $30 dollars and above receive two tracks from the album immediately, a digital download of the entire album when it releases, and an autographed physical copy of the CD.

 

What If I Can't Afford To Give Money?

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Here's How:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by sharing on social media, email, and word of mouth.
  • Indiegogo has a number of great sharing tools that you can use!

story:
“When we talk about ‘classic’ jazz, I think what we really mean is timeless jazz. Music that not only endures for decades, but remains relevant. This is where E. J. Decker comes in. With  Bluer Than Velvet: The Prysock Project he goes deep into the timeless sound of Arthur Prysock, carefully choosing a repertoire that is at once classic and fresh. The Prysock Project breathes life into songs that have obviously made a lasting impression on this vocalist.

Having been fortunate enough to watch this recording project move from concept to final tracks, I’ve been reminded of the determination and commitment it takes to be an artist, to have a desire to honor a legacy, and to jump in on your own to make it happen. I’ve listened to it again and again, each time hearing another nuance, another nod, another moment of appreciation for the groundwork laid by an often under sung classic singer. And I hear compassion, heartache, and humor in this music. This is why it’s worthy of your time…to listen, to support, and to help bring the creative process to full fruition.

That, and the music is just so d*mned good.” —Claudia Russell, KSDS Public Radio 88.3 fm, San Diego, CA

This is the level of response that Bluer Than Velvet: The Prysock Project  has engendered from those in the industry with whom I've spoken about it and those few who have had the chance to hear it. This album's low-note tastiness and its refocusing on human connection in jazz is why I'm making this effort to reach the wider industry. I've started this funding campaign because many more taste makers than I can reach alone have expressed interest in hearing it and judging for themselves. We need the assistance of promotions professionals & you can help with that!

WHO'S ON THIS ALBUM?
I'm joined on this session by some of New York's top players: Claire Daly, baritone sax; Chris Bergson, guitar; Elizabeth Frascoia, trombone; Les Kurtz, piano; Saadi Zain, bass; Tom Melito, drums. We've sought to channel the lush, romantic quality of Prysock's sound to make music of today that has a deeply human heartbeat. The first few reviews I've seen intimate that we may very well have succeeded.

HOW I KNOW ARTHUR PRYSOCK
I was a 17-year-old kid when I first encountered Arthur Prysock.

An AM radio played softly behind me where I was working one night. Suddenly I heard this stunning, deep voice behind me, telling me the story of his love gone wrong. A powerful man’s voice, standing out from the string of tenor men’s voices and women’s voices I’d long stopped listening to that day. I stopped everything, listening as he told me his tale of woe and I waited for the DJ to name him. It was Arthur Prysock. I suddenly was a fan. And he became a major influence on my singing.

HOW YOU MAY KNOW ARTHUR PRYSOCK
“Here’s to good friends, tonight is kind of special…” —Arthur Prysock, for Löwenbräu beer.

In the ’70s, with his recording career in eclipse, Prysock reached his widest audience, ironically, as the ubiquitous soundtrack to “good times” with his famous beer jingle — arguably the best beer jingle ever made:

 

 

WHY THE ALBUM
The wondrously happy look on people’s faces when they hear I'm honoring Prysock is a big motivator. Half the people I meet know of him and are elated, as if being reminded of an old friend. Half of the rest don’t know him by name — but when I sing the beer jingle, their eyes light up. And the remainder are simply in for a treat!

HIS INFLUENCE
By the early '90s, after years in folk & rock, I’d moved to jazz, listening to everyone intently. Prysock jumped to the fore of my research, telling stories of real people that simply were more honest and direct than the work of other singers I heard; he was steadfast in sharing his love, joy or heartbreak to a specific person in each song. The more I listened, the more I realized that’s how you go about things. Sadly I also found those elements were diminishing in an increasingly academic music. I made sure to insert that Prysock honesty, along with songs of his I connected to, into my earlier albums.

I studied briefly with jazz great Mark Murphy and he once asked me my influences. I named a few singers, but as I mentioned Prysock, he jumped and his face lit up, a reaction I’d soon get from many others. “Prysock?! Prysock! You have to do a Prysock tribute!” I resisted a bit, but he insisted over time.

And with Bluer Than Velvet, we’ve produced what I believe is both a fitting tribute and a very human album. There are songs here that only Prysock recorded. There are Songbook tunes with which he had pop or R&B hits. As his discography numbers hundreds of tracks, there are many songs here that he did that have been in my gig book for years. We include a few songs that he most likely never sang — but where, to my mind, you can hear the unmistakable influence on me of Prysock's approach or the influence of the amazing arrangements that always surrounded him. I then rearranged the whole collection and formed my own approach to his consistent lesson of connecting with each person across the speakers.

I’ve put nine years into this project — not just getting it out but making it the best it could be. I certainly hope that Arthur would feel honored. I believe Mark would be pleased that his insistence bore fruit.

Now I ask your help in bringing this long-overdue celebration of Arthur Prysock to the greater jazz audience.

HOW WE'RE GOING TO PROMOTE THIS ALBUM
My fundraising goal is $6,000 to build the national promotions campaign this album needs. That helps cover the fees of the stellar publicist and radio promotion teams I’ve assembled, who are already laying the groundwork in their arenas.

  • Press: Chris DiGirolamo, Two for the Show Media — has run successful press campaigns for Eddie Gomez, Steve Gadd, Donny McCaslin, Mike Longo, Jay Leonhart, Wycliffe Gordon, The Persuasions, Dafnis Prieto, Tierney Sutton, Edie Brickell, and scores of others.
  • Radio: Kate Smith, Kate Smith Promotions — has achieved extensive radio airplay for a long list of jazz luminaries, including Dave Stryker, Nnenna Freelon, Steve Slagle, Nancy Kelly and Howard Johnson, as well as promoting Wayne Wallace's recently Grammy nominated album. She also did a stunning job on my previous album, A Job of Work (Tales of the Great Recession), helping me forge strong relationships with radio programmers and on-air hosts around the world.

Everything we receive above our goal goes to the postage for the more than 600 top jazz journalists and radio programmers to whom we’re reaching out — a cost that’s risen dramatically since my last album.

For the nine years we’ve worked on this project, we’ve borne the entire cost of this production, which as you can imagine has been sizable — but your pre-order of this album now and/or any donation you can give will allow us to take that critical final step to reach its broadest fair hearing, a process which is already beginning…

THE EARLY RETURNS
In step with the Russell quote above, here’s a taste of the reaction this album is now receiving as industry people hear early pre-release copies:

"Hitting it out of the park here in the classiest of ways, Decker isn’t aping Prysock so much as he is following in his footsteps. One of the class acts of the past, this is a smoking way to make sure he’s not forgotten." —Chris Spector, Midwest Record, Lake Zurich, IL

Your donation to Bluer Than Velvet  allows us to give this album its full release to the taste makers who point audiences to music worth their time.

Every donation, large or small, that you can afford gets us closer to our goal. Your donation at various levels gains you an early pre-release copy of the Bluer Than Velvet  CD, something from an array of gifts, and your being a part of this effort.

THANK YOU!
And, yes, we have a number of tasty ‘gets’ to interest you at different levels — New York City donors can even choose 'joy for the taste buds' as well as the ears — as our way of saying, “Thank you!”

Even if you’re not in the position to donate today, join us by sharing this campaign with your Facebook and Twitter communities — or passing it on to people you know who love solid and romantic vocal jazz. There are handy IndieGoGo share tools at the upper right of this page, above the perks.

And for each of you who joins this campaign, we will mention, in perpetuity, your part in this effort on the Bluer Than Velvet  page on my website, www.ejdecker.com — with your permission, of course — instead of in the usual CD notes, as this CD is now already fully pressed and printed.

Join us in commemorating the amazing voice of Arthur Prysock by pre-ordering this album today and choosing your gift. Let Bluer Than Velvet  be a feast for your ears and your soul.

And enjoy the good karma that lives in that lovely place where, as Arthur said, “tonight is kind of special…”

Thank you!

 

E. J.'s website

E. J.'s citation in the Encyclopedia of Jazz Musicians (from 2003)

See reviews from E. J.'s previous two albums

Every donation, large or small, that you can afford gets us closer to our goal. Your donation at various levels gains you an early pre-release copy of the Bluer Than Velvet  CD, something from an array of gifts, and your being a part of this effort.
THANK YOU!And, yes, we have a number of tasty ‘gets’ to interest you at different levels — New York City donors can even choose 'joy for the taste buds' as well as the ears — as our way of saying, “Thank you!”
Even if you’re not in the position to donate today, join us by sharing this campaign with your Facebook and Twitter communities — or passing it on to people you know who love solid and romantic vocal jazz. There are handy IndieGoGo share tools at the upper right of this page, above the perks.
And for each of you who joins this campaign, we will mention, in perpetuity, your part in this effort on the Bluer Than Velvet  page on my website, www.ejdecker.com — with your permission, of course — instead of in the usual CD notes, as this CD is now already fully pressed and printed.
Join us in commemorating the amazing voice of Arthur Prysock by pre-ordering this album today and choosing your gift. Let Bluer Than Velvet  be a feast for your ears and your soul.
And enjoy the good karma that lives in that lovely place where, as Arthur said, “tonight is kind of special…”
Thank you!
 
E. J.'s website
E. J.'s citation in the Encyclopedia of Jazz Musicians (from 2003)
See reviews from E. J.'s previous two albums

story:
Thank You! We LOVE YOU!

Thank you to all of the fans, friends, musicians, venues, funders, family, bookers and bands, who made this last year one of the most amazing of all.

  • Sjock fest video
  • Sjock fest video
  • The Wobble video by Antonin Atger
  • Lust For Life video by David Biene
     
After a great summer tour with the 7" single Saudia Young Noir Rockabilly Blues, we are in production of our first full Vinyl LP entitled " unlovable". The record is a mix of original songs, including the title and classic covers of some the greats of Rhythm & Blues and  Rock & Roll.  Bo Diddley again plays a role in our story.
  • Hello! I am Saudia Young - Lead singer and band leader of the Noir Rockabilly Blues Show.
  • We are making our first 12 " LP entitled 'Unlovable' with 5 original songs & 7 covers.
  • We hope to raise 1500 Euro  for the studio production of  the  12 " LP to be pressed on Vinyl.
  • This is PART 1 of 2 which is to PAY for recording
  • We are set to record at: Lightning Recorders in Berlin. A fully equipped live recording studio with vintage microphones and amps.

Your contributions made the Wobble video happen. Your contributions made the 7 " Vinyl Single happen. We Hope that you can join us again in this next step in our Noir Rockabilly Blues Show Journey.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need: 1500 Euro
  • You get:
  • The satisfaction of funding an independent artist that you dig!
  • Perks including:T-shirts, 7" Vinyl singles, Tote-Bags
  • The opportunity to buy and play new said record on your old record player hidden in the cellar
  • BACK-UP PLAN IF WE DON'T RAISE THROUGH THIS PLATFORM; I will: busk, clean houses, dog-sit, cat-sit, kid-sit, you name it to make this happen. It will happen.

The Impact

  • We have been told that Saudia Young Noir Rockabilly Blues Show  project is helping the world through storytelling, keeping the roots music tradition alive  and having a strong funny woman on the front line. It may even help give little girls the inspiration to stomp around rock stages screaming their lungs out celebrating life and SURVIVAL!  Don't Panick- Rock & Roll!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Everybody please makes some noise about the campaign and record
  • Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
